text: Great service . Courtney was lovely and cute :) will return for the steak and Mac cheese .

My wife and I have been waiting to go here for a while, we finally made time to bring the family in. We went around 11:30, it was pretty busy, We were seated right away, which was good because we brought both kids. Our waitress approached us as soon as we were seated and let us know about the menu and how everything works. We ordered for our kids right away and orders drinks for ourselves. My wife ordered a bloody Mary and Our waitress recommended a beer for me, so I decided to go with it. When she returned she brought the Bloody Mary and the kids drinks, 20 min or so went by and still no beer for me.... My wife decides to ask the waitress and she said there must be a problem at the bar, I noticed she went to the computer and put my beer through because she must have forgot to put it in. got my beer another 10 minutes later (30 min after I ordered it). The kids got sliders, and we ordered the huntsman burger and calamari to share. we got the burger (no side plates) and kids sliders but no calamari. The burger was delicious! once we finished our burger we asked the waitress if the calamari was coming out still. She went to the kitchen and returned with no calamari and told us our order was bumped..... Not sure what that means or how that happened. We get the calamari 10 min later and ask to get it to go since we were already done with everything else.  The food was ok, the service wasn't so great.

I think someone forgot to tell the people behind the bar that there are hundreds of great bartenders in Vegas looking for jobs. These people are very rude with no smile. Artisan beer really? Served with horrible food? I can get better beer and food just walking out of that place. With wonderful food drink and service all around them they are due to fail. Go ahead try and pay that large rent with you poor service and food.

Went to this restaurant on a rare night out and I was not impressed. The atmosphere is really loud, and definitely not the right place for a date night. Seriously, I could barely hear what my husband was saying sitting right across from me. There were not that many food options (just one side of one page of a menu) and the prices were a little higher than I was expecting. The service was not that great either, as we rarely saw our waitress.

The theme of the restaurant is well coordinated, so that I appreciated. You are in for menus that look like composition books, and napkins that look like lined paper, along with a variety of other cool themed decorations. The hummus plate we ordered was very good, but the cocktails we ordered were terrible. I couldn't even drink mine, and felt bad that I had paid so much for something I didn't enjoy. 

We were having such a bad time that we left after appetizers, so the food may have been amazing. However, the atmosphere and limited variety of meal options turned us off. We might try this again, but I'm not sure it would be worth it.

Great family dinner at Public school 702 last night. Our waitress Emily was fantastic and chef Jason is amazing. Try the watermelon, heirloom tomato and mozzarella platter. Never would have put these things together but it was delicious!!
Loved our service tonight! Katie was great and made it a fun night.  met all of our needs!!! I have a tendency to be a needy customer.

Great weekend brunch!  We enjoyed almost bottomless bloody marys, stuffed french toast and the huntsman bacon burger, YUMMY!  Wow service from the front door greeting to our fun server Ruth. The school theme decorations are fun and create an excellent atmosphere.

I have eaten here 4 times with 4 different friends. The conclusion that I have reached is that the back of the house (food) is well run while the front of the house (wait and bar staff) is not. 

Their menu is creative and the food is quite good. In the past I have ordered the brussels sprouts salad, the shrimp and grits and the salmon. The food was delivered in a timely manner. 

However, they have staffing issues. On the server side, I think they are just short of experienced servers. The couple of times that I did not eat at the bar the server had a trainee with them. If the restaurant succeeds, this should correct itself.

My criticism of the bar staff is more problematic. With the exception of one nice fellow, Simon,  the boss bartender and the other staff were condescending and slow to serve. I felt as if somehow I did something wrong or that I was sitting at the losers table.  Las Vegas is home to the the world's best hospitality workers. Can't they find people that like other people and want to make them feel welcomed?  Each time I have been to the restaurant I have had a similar experience. Managers wake up! You have a not nice, too cool for school attitude percolating in the front of the house.

Great food, good service. Came in for a first visit and was definitely inpressed. The menu is a touch fancy but ask for a recommend item and you wont be disappointed. 

Our server Sheri was legit, ( had to ask to spell her name, and thats the only thing we needed. ) 

Even the frys are good. Soda comes in a glass bottle ( coke ) which i prefer as it is made with real sugar!  

The sauces and specials are house made, and tons of good rotating beers on draft. We will return

This company definitely struck gold with the manager Shaun!!! He visited our table after our server messed up our order ( I don't remember her name) anyway Shaun made it right. He has a glowing personality that made us forget about any issues...

I have to say I'm very disappointed by the service we received here today. We came for dinner and after we were seated we waited 15 minutes before anyone even acknowledged we were there. Several servers and staff including the hostess that sat us walked by without saying a word. So when our server, Carissa did come over we told her we had been waiting for 15 minutes and she gave us attitude and just said "ok, there was confusion with the tables". And she wasn't very nice about it either. We placed our order and it took another 10 minutes to get our drinks. Our food came fairly quick and I'm sad to say it was not worth the wait. I had the seared scallop salad and it was very bland. I would have asked for more dressing but Carissa was no where to be found. The entire time we were there she checked on us once, she was not pleasant at all or even smiled. Such a shame because the atmosphere of the restaurant is fun, cute decor, and quite a fun bar menu, but I don't feel we will be back due to the horrible service we received. With so many restaurants in downtown summerlin I would rather go someplace where they at least act like they want our business and are not rude to us.

Dropped in today to grab a Bloody Mary, we walked in at 9:47 and the place was empty, so we asked the first person we saw (young guy with black hair) if they were open. He said they opened at 10, so I said well that's only a few minutes, do you mind if we have a seat inside out of the heat. He told us no, you have to leave. Well I though that was pretty rude since it was only 11 minutes until they opened at that point. I've seen enough of this place, we decided to go to Distill for our celebration instead. No problems getting in here!

Good food, better service.  Second time I've been there - the brown bag fries are a definite plus.  Tyler, our server, was just awesome - would ask to sit in his area the next time and there will definitely be a next time.

So, bring me new silverware when you take my appetizer plates away. Don't make me put my silverware back on your dirty placemats to use again. This isn't McDonald's.

Our server didn't even look at us when talking to us or taking out order. He was watching something on the other side of the restaurant.  He was rude and condescending. 

The bartenders were very nice and made some good cocktails. I liked the players cup. 

Unfortunately our server made our visit to Public School an unpleasant experience.

If I could do zero stars I would because it was so awful I couldn't even comprehend how they have customers. The servers and bartenders, hell even the managers didn't know left from right Cabernet from Chardonnay they didn't even know what whiskeys they had available. Let alone the amount of time it took for each drink, app, and entrée to come out and let me tell you the timing between each encounter with the server/order was a good 20 minutes. And I wouldn't mind a long waiting time if ANYTHING was even edible.
I'm not one to wish failure upon anyone but that amount to space should go towards  a team that has their stuff together. McDonald's could run a better "gastro pub"

I love gastropubs so I was thrilled to find a new one opened five minutes from my house. Service is great and almost everything I've tried has been fantastic! My favorites are the buffalo cauliflower and vegetarian chili (soup of the day). The only complaint I have is that the orange juice for brunch is extremely small, filled with ice, and no refills. It's only $3.50 so I'm not trying to fret about it, but if you're parched from the Vegas heat, I would recommend ordering something else; a beermosa would have been the better choice.

I had high hopes, alas, not the case. Service was extremely slow. Took at least 15 minutes to get our beer and then my beer was flat. Took it back to the bar to tell them and the bartender tried to tell us that it was a nitro beer and supposed to be that way. I've had this beer before, many times in fact, it's the beer of choice for me and I know what it should taste like. Our server was nice enough to take it back and take it off the check. Food was ok. Missing some components on the sandwich that were on the menu but not on the actual sandwich. Fries were good. I like the atmosphere and decor, but that won't go far if the food and bartender are not up to par.

This was the worst service I've ever had. My boyfriend and I went in for lunch. There was about a ten minute wait to be seated, which is no big deal. Then we got seated and we waited atleast 10 more minutes until a server that wasn't even in our section, realized no one has even greeted us, or taken out drink order. She took our drink order and then our actual server (the receipt said her name was lauren) showed up a few minutes later to take our drink order and we said someone else took it. She then took our food order I got a ccb with no bun and Brussel and kale slaw. My boyfriend got a chicken and waffles on their Sunday brunch. She leaves to put in our order then returns about 10 minutes later and asks how everything is going and if we were ready to order food. And we just looked at her confused and said that she had already taken our order. She said oh yeah and then stares at my empty iced tea and leaves. I assumed she was getting me more. She then is walking around almost looking like she was trying to be busy but not really doing anything. Our food showed up mine with a bun on it that I asked not to have. I just took it off. Both our meals were delicious. She did not stop back in though to make sure everything was ok. Waited another 15 minutes until we realized she isn't comin back and asked another server for more drinks. Then when we finished our meals she stopped by twice to see if we wanted more drinks. Yeah now that were done eating she wants to be attentive? It was almost humorous how absent she was.

*** someone from public school messaged me on yelp and appologized and asked for my email to further discuss. I gave them my boyfriends email. It's been almost three days now, and they never reached out. Same half ass service as the restaurant.
Good happy hour specials. This place can get extremely packed! I enjoyed trying the buffalo cauliflower for the first time. And their Jungle Juice is amazing!! I'll be back! Good place for a crowd.

I was so excited to try this restaurant.  The restaurant is beautiful, location great, and I had heard their food was pretty good, but I was sadly mistaken.  Our disappointing visit started as soon as we walked in the door... one of the hostesses was talking with a waiter in the corner, looked our way a few times, made eye contact, but did not stop her conversation.  We then thought that maybe she wasn't a hostess and started walking into the dinning area... we saw some people, but didn't know if there were hosts.  We returned to the front and stood for a few minutes.  The hostess from the corner and two other people we had walked by in the dinning room all came over at once?  Okay, finally seated!  Our waitress never refilled our drinks and our food was so salty and overall not good.

It was just a bad experience and I do not recommend eating here.  There are so many better options in Downtown Summerlin!

Service was extremely slow and the restaurant was practically empty so I don't know why it took so long.  Our waitress seemed very indifferent and needs to work on her customer service skills.  Food was ok, not great.

Terrible! Three of us went to brunch yesterday. Two of us ordered the edamame hummus breakfast. Both of us were feeling unwell by yesterday afternoon. Not sure what was wrong with it, but I couldn't keep anything down all last night. Co-incidence that the two of us who ordered the same item both got sick? Make your own determination, I guess.

I've been to PS 702 a number of times for the experience and beer selection. Understanding the service is usually terrible, but Kaila at your Las Vegas location took it a step further. Took roughly 15 min to get two drinks, then took another 25 min to get our meal(my salmon came out overdone and 15 min before my GFs poke came out). I am used to both entrees coming out at the same time and the waitress not giving attitude when asked what issue occurred. Mark, the alleged manager was very nice and took our drinks off of the bill, but Kaila was noticably rude throughout the experience. Kaila is the epitome of what not to be in regards to Las Vegas industry standards. I'll no longer frequent this location again. 

Lazy dogs and Wolfgang Puck's next door has never steered me wrong though.

About a week ago I threw my boyfriend a surprise birthday party at Public School. It turned out perfect!

I had been to Public School before, but I somehow missed the chef's table hiding behind a wall. As the hostess escorted us to the table all of our closest friends and family jumped up from behind the wall to surprised him! Again, perfect!

It was nice to know that although we had not all arrived, the server (Emily) had taken care of our guests with drinks and appetizers. As the evening progresses, everything came out in a timely matter, drinks were constantly refilled until we had to cut ourselves off, and a manager (forgot her name) even came over to make sure everything was going well.

Thank you to the entire staff who made my boyfriends birthday dinner one to remember! Just, PEEFECT! :) 

P.S. My favorite dish - Banger & Mash, two grilled chicken & herb sausages, bacon brussels mash, caramelized onions au jus.

I agree with a few others reviews in that IT'S LOUD! They seriously need noise dampers. It's also very BJ's, YardHouse, Cheesecake Factory-ish style menu. But I feel like the food here is pretty good. Service sucks but that's just Vegas-esque. Nice happy hour menu, beer menu changes weekly... overall I'm a fan. I've been multiple times. Wish they had more TVs tho. Patio in the spring/fall will be a good time.

Pretty cool spot, a bit yuppy-ish for me sometimes.

Great spot for first dates, as I've taken a couple ladies there.
Never had a bad time.

The staff are friendly and younger.
Plenty of tattoos and piercings to go around.

Food is innovative and fun to eat.
Beer selection is outstanding for such a pub.

Was great when it opened but sadly gone downhill. Service has been beyond bad on last few visits. (waited 15 mins to be acknowledged last night and another 15 mins to get our bill after we had said we were in a hurry!). My guess would be that it's a management issue and not the servers fault. Food generally is ok but my wifes pizza last night was all dried out. Too many good spots in Summerlin to waste our time going back here. Sad to lose an old friend!

I was excited to try it out because of the location, theme, and outdoor space. However, I was weary because of the mixed reviews.  Went on a Friday night. They said it would be 20 min but it took about 10 so that was great. The patio has a really nice look and feel! I was excited! 
Then we get to the bad: the service. It took the server about 10-15 min to come take our drink order, took even longer to actually get the drinks. The water she said she'd bring didn't come until we asked for it again halfway through our meal.  We ordered a cheese plate which was delicious and the drinks were just as good. Too bad it would take forever every time we ordered a round. It took even longer to get our check and what seemed like an eternity to get our cards back to sign. 
With so many other options to chose from, why go back to a place where they don't respect their customers enough to provide efficient service?

Great food. Terrible service.


When i got seated i was given a menu to look at. After that, i waited a long time for my server to come back and take my order. I tried looking directly at her as a signal to show i was ready to order and i did see her look back at me. Also, she walked by my table several times without stopping to take my order. I was pretty fed up and asked another worker if he could find my server but he went ahead and just took my order anyways, Right after that ANOTHER server came and introduced himself to us and said our server is switching sections and he will be taking over BUT i still see the server i had assisting tables that were right next to mine. I get having to switch sections but i'm offended she started off with us and left halfway without saying anything.

Our second server was great and attentive unlike the first one i had.

Public School gets an A for decor and an A- on the food. It's Hand Held Cobb is a solid piece that I'd be happy to have every time I'm here. The fries are the weakest link but only because there's nothing really different about them. 

My only complaint is that I ordered a Diet Coke and it comes in a bottle in which you're charged for refills.

Sorry guys, but the majority of your competition gives those away. A $2.75 soda plus $1.50 refills...not good.

I've heard great things about this restaurant, up until yesterday when a coworker of mine had nothing but poor words to spill. I didn't let this distract me from at least trying it...

I'm glad I did. I probably won't be back though.

Let me tell you why. This restaurant is big. So big the echo of everyone talking makes you feel like you're in a cafeteria. So big the food, while good, ends up cold if you aren't next to the kitchen. So big, it takes a server five minutes to get to one side and back.

...However, there are some big flavors here that I wouldn't shy away from. The tots are delicious, and the sriracha ketchup add the right kick to compliment the cheese and bacon filling. The chorizo mac n' cheese had some great textures and a full bite with everything in it showed what this dish could do (if piping hot). The Jidori Chicken & Waffles was a hit. I hope they use the cornbread muffin as some sort of breakfast dish, because I'd eat it morning, noon, and night.

I recommend trying Public School. It has a lot to look at, a great beer selection, and a short, yet formidable cocktail list.

My new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. I've lived here 5 months and have eaten at several restaurants around town, this one is easily in my top 5.  Great service, food and ambiance. Get a gin and tonic with their housemade gin, and the buffalo cauliflower.  Yowza.  I'll be back sooner than later!

1st time at public 702.  The food was good, I had the beet salad, my daughter had the stuffed french toast, boys had burgers...and was glad to see kids menu for my grandson.  Service was ok...took a bit to get refills but ok. Refills on ice tea and soda weren't free... $$$ for soft drinks...Good atmosphere though, probably try it again.

Came to public school for brunch with two friends celebrating my birthday... first off, loved the location and decor. Super cute and clever theme... the atmosphere was enjoyable. 
The service at this location was amazing. The host was very sweet and sat us in a booth.
Our waitress Emilia was amazing! Brought out our drinks quickly and helped us decided when ordering...
The food was very tasty. My vegetarian friend loved her dish. She gave it an A+ ;)
Overall our time spend at public school was so much fun and delicious. Thank you!

We have been looking forward to this restaurant opening for months and we were not disappointed!!!!  Our waitress, Vanessa, was very friendly and knowledgeable about the beer as well as the food.  Everything that we tried from the lamb burger to the fig and prosciutto pizza to the ahi tacos was amazing!  There is also a children's menu and the chicken fingers are delicious!  I highly recommend this restaurant.  Great food and atmosphere!!!

I have mixed reviews about Public School 702. There were some stand out dishes, but there were also dull ones as well. 

The Wild Mushroom and Taleggio Pizza is a MUST! I'm sold on anything with truffle oil, and if you feel the same I highly suggest ordering this. I can't wait to go back for this! 

The Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower is great as well! Loved the bleu cheese aioli sauce that it's paired with.

Now moving on to the things I wouldn't order again. The Speck and Eggs weren't that great. A little too salty if you ask me. Also, the Ahi Tuna Poke tasted off. I didn't think it paired well with the passion fruit. If you like fruity tuna poke, then maybe this is the dish for you, but it wasn't for me. 

Would I go back to Public School 702? Yes! I would go back just for the pizza and cauliflower. It was THAT good! Other than that, Public School 702 was mediocre. If you're confused by my review, I told you at the very top that I had "mixed reviews."

Went with the wife and a friend for dinner and drinks. The beer selection is unique, interesting and tasty. The deviled eggs were not your traditional Deviled eggs but we're very tasty. The bacon cheddar tots were God as well. The spaghetti and shrimp and grits were both good as well. The bison burger was a bit disappointing. What really impressed is that our friend left her leftovers behind and the waiter chased us down outside to give them to her. He definitely went above and beyond and it impressed me. We will be back.

most of what we ordered were good but super salty -- crispy buffalo cauliflower, french fries, mushroom pizza, bbq burger, moody burger. 

our server, Mandy was superb!

Super cute on the inside. Food was yummy. The portions are tiny for how much you pay. We sat at the bar. Had a super friendly bartender that rotated shifts with a not so friendly bartender. So I guess that cancels it out?  would go back for a drink, but grab dinner somewhere else.
Good food, good service in a very cute restaurant. What more can you ask for?They do a good job with the "public school" motif.  Nice outside patio when it cools down.

I get that Friday nights are busy - no problem.  We were a party of 2, went inside to check the wait, hostess mentioned that it would be a 20-25 minute wait, gave our phone number and waited inside between the rest rooms and hostess stand.  At the 30 minute mark, there were guests that came in after us that were seated.  Hostesses saw that we were still there, never said a thing to us.  40 minutes was our top wait time.  I told the hostess to remove our name, and she asked what our name was and removed it.
Service tip, the front door is the first experience the guests have when you walk into a restaurant.  Acknowledge your guests, keep better track of who has been seated and who hasn't, especially guests that are in front of your face for 40 minutes, advise guests of a longer wait time on a Friday night.  If they get seated earlier, bonus for your team!  If someone removes their name from the wait, have your hostess ask if there was an issue, offer an apology (after watching us wait!), say something!  Growing pains - i'm sure.
We won't be back, nor will we suggest to our friends and family.

Nice atmosphere from the moment you walk in the door. Great view from the outside balcony! Great beer selection and helpful, knowledgeable staff. Nice menu and several rotating selection of beer as well. Great addition to Downtown Summerlin

Sunday brunch... Awesome! Chicken and waffles were amazing as well as the chicken sausage and grits. Loved the "almost bottomless" mimosas. Prices were reasonable and service was great! Cool atmosphere. Definitely will be back again.

Great concept here at downtown Summerlin in the midst of several generic restaurants with the same old same old. 
       The public school theme is fun and the memorabilia on the walls and around the venue gives you a fun look into Las Vegas's local past. The menu looked like a marble notebook and the cocktail napkin looked like a note passed from a classmate.               
        Our server, Jared Smith gave us a great rundown of the menu and explained the beer selection really well. We were able to sample quite a few before making our selections and by the time we left the restaurant we had ordered almost all oft them. 
         I would definitely recommend the shrimp and grits and the cauliflower, delicious. Fun place, craft beer, good food, reasonable prices, and fantastic service. I'll be back. :))
Cool place. Nice location. Nice draft beer list. Food was solid. Short menu but well thought out. Better than most restaurants for this price.
Stopped in on Sunday for some beer, apps, and football. Good experience here,  or waiter was cool and always checking on us. Overall a good experience, we'll be back for sure.

Love this new (and much needed) addition to DT Summerlin.  We have visited 3x's in a week.  Food is excellent, craft beer menu very cool, and a skilled bar tender shakes a good martini.  BUT all I ask is that you turn down the tunes.  What is the point of music so loud you leave diners / bar visitors screaming at each other.  If I leave w a headache I won't remember how good the food is.

Really great vibe... And waitress Brittany helped with that a ton..... Although we did not take her suggestions... We ordered amazing food.... The fried cauliflower was to-die-for.... Ask for the ginger aioli with it.... The bomb!!! (That was Brittany's suggestion) working on the Nutella sandwich for dessert... So I must go now.... Wish me luck!!!

Horrible horrible horrible service. In this industry it does not matter how amazing the quality of the products are if it is not partnered with customer service. The entire experience was ridiculous. From the moment we walked in- cold stoic hosts to neglectful servers. I forgot about the food and drinks because I felt like an interruption rather than a paying guest in their establishment. The atmosphere was very dull and pretentious. It could have been leaps and bounds better but I'm never returning and will never recommend this establishment. Management needs to think about it's hiring process and establish better standards of guest service. Maybe then they could educate their target audience about "food and beer". I give this a couple of years tops. This place greatly reminds me of Rattlecan that used to be at the Venetian, great concept and great products but cold and unwelcoming staff and atmosphere. An epic fail and a waste of invenstor's money.

Vanessa was incredible, the drinks were amazing, and the food was great. Get the flat iron steak and mac n' cheese. 
Cancel the four roses and replaced with Woodford in the lavender cocktail. 
Thanks Vanessa!
Rachel was the best! Made me feel at home and warm. Will always keep me coming back. Woo.
The food is always tasty paired with good adult beverages! The service was friendly but alil slow. Also had to wait for the "dressing on the side" which took about 10 minutes to receive.
Nice atmosphere , ppl were kinda bland but environment made up for it, seating was very unique and confy. The food wasn't quite filling but I enjoyed it
The service was atrocious.  The food was okay and the drinks were delicious.  I think with time they will work out the kinks, they have a good concept just failed on the delivery.
Love the food! Love the atmosphere! Super great place to grab cocktails and dinner and chill out on their patio with friends.
My boyfriend and I went here for dinner, missed happy hour but had a good time. Good food, kinda pricey.

Went with friends to celebrate my wife's birthday and had a not so great experience. Service was ok but the food was not hot. From appetizers to the entries everything was room temperature to warm, like the food was made and sat around. Some of the dishes severely lacked basic seasoning in the form of salt and pepper, and chicken in the salad tasted like it was cooked(overcooked) the day before, then shredded for use the next day. Kids chicken finger was fried for longer than needed. We were seated near the kitchen and I could tell that there was no one in control of the food coming out of the kitchen, very undisciplined. Been there before and the food was much better months ago before the started changing some of the plating of the food. No complaints on the bar side or service side. They did recognize some of the faults of the kitchen and took it off our bill and gave us a dessert to share
If I could go lower I would... Went to the bar and the bartender was rude and acted like he did us a favor... All the staff acted above all the patrons.. Over this place!!

Disgusting! Read all these great reviews, was so excited to try it, as we approached the door there was a girl smoking RIGHT in front of the door and proceeded to flick her cigarette butt right in front of the door while making eye contact, she knew it was not the place. This was tile ground, not some dirty park. Bad first impression. The first 2 tables we tried to sit at were covered in leftover food. It was a slow night so if a restaurant doesn't know serving 101, clean your tables after the guests leave there was no way we trusted the rest of the cleanliness. We sat for 5 mins and still no one cared to wipe/sanitize the tables. The back of the house must be filthy if that is the standard of the front of the house. Again, slow night, employees just standing around. We walked out. Downtown Summerlin has a lot of restaurant options that I'm sure sanitize and clean up after their guests.

This is my #1 Choice for restaurants in Downtown Summerlin! Fun spot that offers a great menu including BRUNCH! I just had the Grilled Chicken & Quinoa Salad...it's a must have! Along with their Stuffed French Toast and Chicken & Waffles. And the service...is very friendly.

My wife wanted to go here, but I was kind of skeptical.  I thought it was just going to be pricier for the same stuff else where.  It's not, they have pretty unique stuff and flavors are amazing.  Fried Cauliflower doesn't sound to good, but it's amazing.  I was blown away by it.  I usually don't even like cauliflower.  My wife got the chicken and waffles, it taste better than other authentic southern restaurants.  I got a hamburger, but it was worth every penny.  Hamburgers are everywhere, but Superb hamburgers are hard to come by.  Even the kids Mac N Cheese tasted amazing.

Horrible food. Horrible service. Server was rude and had a bad attitude. The place doesn't even have ranch...... What kind of restaurant doesn't have ranch ? We had a big group and got a lot of different food and appetizers and everything was disgusting. Ordered kids meal pasta for my daughter and the pasta was still hard. Would never ever recommend this place. Never ever coming back again. If I could I wouldn't give this place any stars.

I was here today for lunch and had the buffalo cauliflower and the ahi poke with the Moroccan chicken club. Conner was our server and he kicked ass. Super knowledgable about the beers and gave really good feedback on the menu. If you try this place you must drink The Beer Camp, phenomenal choice! Thanks Conner, were definitely coming back for more (:!

We've eaten here a few times and are always pleased with the food. I'm deducting one star because without fail, one of our meal items always comes out incorrectly; regardless of the number of people in our party. BUT we'll keep going back ;)
Saw our waiter one time after ordering. Food was ok, not to die for. Will be history once the newness has worn off! No supervision or manager?

Great food. Excellent presentation. Friendly service!

Try the hummus and the sliders!

Im still on the fence.  I like the school theme concept.   From the actual menus to the entrees, the school theme is consistent.   I ordered the hummus/ babaganoush/chick pea appetizer to share.  Plenty of pita bread....they will bring you as much as you want, which if you are watching your carbs,  may not be a good idea.  The dips were ok, dont think ill order again.  For my entree I had the kale Caesar salad.  Didnt love seeing 2 sardines staring at me when they sat the salad in front of me, but I scooted them to the side.  It was a good amount of salad, but again not sure id order it again.  Id like to go back and try some other options....ill keep you posted.

Great beers, bartenders don't know anything about the beers. The menu is ok. Not bad to pair beer with. The bartenders aren't very friendly. Ask for Simon if you do come in. They do have a good happy hour menu for food and beer.
Food and beer was amazing, but the service here was phenomenal thanks to our waitress Valerie!!!!! Definitely recommending this place to friends!!!!
Great atmosphere... GREAT Happy Hour Menu and prices...great service...definitely coming back and this place will be on my Happy Hour rotation :  )

This was our first time coming to Public School 702 and it did not disappoint!!!  We were slightly skeptical because some of the reviews weren't very good but we absolutely loved it and I even told my husband I wanted to do a review because I loved it so much. We sat on the patio (in June after sunset) and it was very comfortable and a fun environment. We got the watermelon and heirloom salad stack which was refreshing and very flavorful. We also got the bison burger with fries and it was good sized and amazingly delicious. I would highly recommend this restaurant!!

The food offerings at Public School 702 are fine, it's the service I can't get past. I've been there with my wife three or four times now and service has always been terrible. There was one occurrence where our appetizer came out super quick, but the waiter realized it was for the wrong table and took it back... didn't get ours for another 20-30 minutes. 

The bar is always packed and the energy is awesome, but the restaurant isn't, which means to me they aren't bringing in enough servers to accommodate the group. For such a cool idea, I hope they amp up the service because I want to love it. I'll likely be back as well.

Great food menu. Great beer & wine menu. Absolutely terrible service. I've given it three tries because the cauliflower appetizer is amazing...but every time I've gone back the service has been worse than the time before. Very disappointing.

Love this place. The servers are excellent and make it fun. Ask for Lydia or Brandan. Tip them well!! We like the mushroom pizza, bacon Brussels  sprouts mashed potatoes and chicken quinoa salad. They used to have live music with Ryan Mahoney playing on Mondays. He was not here this last week, we hope he is coming back. Love sitting in the outside patio. Very good wine prices too. One of our favorite hangouts.

Amazing food, terrible service. This was our first time here and we were so excited to try. The hostess was extremely rude to start when I told her we had a party of 8. We had no expectation of being seated right away so I'm not sure where her attitude came from. Once we were seated we ordered some appetizers, waters, and drinks. There were four times where all 8 of us had empty glasses of water and had to ask someone to bring us more. I was never brought a refill on my lemonade (I think the fresh lemonade was missing an ingredient so i was ok dealing with water) without asking multiple times for one. One out of four of our appetizers never came out and we had to track down our waiter to remind him to bring it. The food came out and he never checked on our food (or water). One bison burger was ordered medium well and was completely rare. It was picked at around the edges but barely eaten, but I'm sure it didn't phase the lazy waiter. When it was time for our 4 separate checks he pulled the "our system can't do that" bs and had us literally write down per couple what we had, the price of each item, add it all up, include tax and give him the tab at the end for him to ring up. It took about 20 minutes to write everything out and then the computer magically rang separate checks. 

Now onto the good food: cauliflower buffalo appetizer was my favorite. We also tried the bacon cheese tots, chorizo Mac n cheese, and the calamari, which were all a huge hit. I had the steak with truffle butter and Mac n cheese. It was a good size portion and very tasty! My husband had the bison burger which was pretty good but his was also not cooked properly. The prosciutto pizza was alright but a little difficult to eat because the prosciutto is not cut up into pieces, and the chicken and waffles were great!

I appreciate the family atmosphere, it's Cheers with chucks and amazing food. Truly a place where everybody knows your name. Mama's Yellow Pilsner is the go-to beer. Tyler always has a smile and a new menu item or beer to suggest. I appreciate the staff and just met Tom today, excellent bartender who suggested the shorty bowl.
Hailey was an amazing server. She has the best lines and jokes!  Oh yea the food and wine were equally awesome!!
Vanessa was the bomb today for brunch! Last time I was here I was disappointed with the service so she really redeemed! I'll be back for brunch! Really great service!!! And Ice cold mimosas!

Loved the concept!  Food was good.  We had the buffalo cauliflower appetizer and we each ordered dinner...the chicken and waffles and the Irish stout short ribs.  Tasted like down home style cooking.  Very filling!  I felt the cost was a bit on the high side, just over $100 for the two of us.  With all that said, I would go back.
Looked like a great place to eat, but stay away from the bison burger. Way overpriced with no taste what so ever. Staff seems overwhelmed. Beer specials are a good deal if there available.

Dearest Public School 702,
I want to like you so badly, but your service sucks. You should get on that. K tnx. 
-Ericka. 

But for real. I love downtown summerlin and its contemporary dining offerings so I keep getting drawn to this place. The atmosphere is fine, it's like an interpretive, modern take on a schoolhouse and I guess that's the point. 

The food is a little above 3 stars. The flavors of the green chili chicken and cornbread waffles threw me off at first, but I definitely left wanting more. Bacon cheddar tots are total comfort food. Tried to be healthy one time so I ordered the kale Caesar with salmon--salmon was cooked well, but the dressing was bland. 

All the makings to be a cool Friday night neighborhood bar/restaurant, but I just can't get passed the service. Every time we come here, we've had to wait for water, drink orders, food, you name it. Just this last Friday night, they brought our appetizer out super quick, but turned out to be for another table so they took it back!!! And then ours was another 20-30 minutes. Yep.

Finally made it in to celebrate my husband and my daughter's birthdays. Service was excellent. The food was incredible.  We got the bacon cheddar tots.  Those were incredible and so was the Sriracha ketchup that came with it. We also got the calamari which was cooked perfectly not greasy at all and I loved that the spice on it was togarachi - one of my fave spice blends. For my entrée I got that Jidori chicken and waffles. Hands-down the best chicken and waffles I have ever had.  My husband got the short ribs which he said was excellent. I also tried two cocktails,  one was the passionfruit mojito. It is made with gin instead of the traditional rum and it worked so tasty. I also tried the guavalajara a take on a margarita with guava. So fantastic. My kids had to be cheese pizzas because they're kids,  but they both tried bites of everything else we had and loved it.  We will be back soon!!

I just want to say Thank You for making our birthday celebration so awesome! We were serve by Emily B. She made excellent suggestions to the group based on their food likes and preferences, and everyone loved their meals. What made the evening even better, was the excellent service and the special dishes made and by Chef Jason. Thanks again! Look forward tonier next visit!

This is the worst service I've ever had. Not once but three different times. Stay away, unless you have all day to spend waiting for drinks, like watered down alcohol, or enjoy having despicable customer service.

What a great experience. My girlfriend & I were looking for a good local happy hour & came across this place. Initially when we came around 5pm, it was a little quiet but as the night went on it really picked up. 
When we first walked in, we weren't greeted but no big deal. We quickly found our own seats. Our server Jared was amazing and the cocktails were so good. The sliders were perfect as well as the adobo tacos. We plan on coming back here very soon! Very nice happy hour selection.
Ahi tacos are amazing!!! Nutella cookie is to die for but the best part was Simon the bartender!! Super friendly and funny!!

This spot is located at downtown summerlin. Quick and easy to get to. The staff is very friendly and full of answers. Any of your craft beer questions they can answer for you! Kortnie was my bartender. She did a fabulous job at describing different craft brewed beers and pairing them with items on the menu. She kicked ass and gave me great service. This place rocks!

First time visit last night & we were absolutely impressed! We joined another couple for Happy Hour at 4:00pm & were seated at a very large booth in the bar area the moment we arrived which was great because it was pretty busy & continued to fill up to capacity. 
Lauren was our server & was at our table the minute the hostess left, she asked if we wanted to order drinks/water which was appreciated since the other half of our party was running late & we were ready for some refreshments. Cold water arrived immediately, drinks followed within minutes which was a surprise since, again, it was pretty busy!
As soon as the rest of our party arrived Lauren was back to take their order, within a minute or two. She took care to answer the boys questions about the large variety of beers & made some helpful suggestions, she mentioned that she was a bartender as well, so she was really informed on the bar offerings. She returned less than 10 minutes later with the additional drinks then answered questions about the menu, again offered a few suggestions. We selected the Farro Salad & Dip Duo, both arrived within five minutes, both had great flavors and nice presentation! Lauren did not hover, but did check in to see how we were doing, we sent her away with more drink and food orders...round two! We ordered 2 orders of Crispy Ahi Tacos, Crispy Cauliflower, Wild Mushroom Pizza and another order of Farro Salad (it was THAT good!). Again, everything came out very quickly & was perfect, each item was a very good size and did well to fill us up! We even ended up with a free order of Speck & Eggs due to the fact that one of the other servers mixed up her tables & had an extra, they were tasty as well!
Lauren checked in on us a few more times & made sure that we had everything we needed, all in all we were there over three hours and she never made us feel that we were holding up a table, she was a perfect server & we will ask to sit in her section the next time we come. 
We enjoyed the atmosphere and the cool design/decor and will definitely go back, can't wait for cooler weather to enjoy the patio!!!

Overall, the food was quick, tasty and had character! I definitely recommend ordering the crispy cauliflower, it's something else. The service was wonderful, but I really recommend making reservations so you don't have to wait a long line!
It's a great place to enjoy a fun night with friends (especially in the balcony), the food is good but they are changing items on the menu all the time so you don't really know what to expect

Created an account just to pay my compliments to Chef Drew and the amazing staff at PS702. The layout of the restaurant is great, with imagery bringing you back to school days and a clear view through the kitchen where you can see the chefs create tasty dishes. The beer choices are on point and the staff is knowledgeable and will help with any questions you have (from seasonal favorites to what will pair well with certain dishes). The food is what really drove me write this review. Speck and Eggs were phenomenal, Roasted Chicken and Quinoa Salad exceptional, Schoolyard Dog outstanding... but the best thing there has to be the Irish Stout Short Ribs, mouthwatering and extremely flavorful!! Make sure you save some room for dessert, the Chef's special dessert (chocolate chip cookie with nutella, vanilla ice cream and fried prosciutto/bacon with nilla wafers) brought the whole meal together. Left completely full, happy and satisfied. Will definitely be coming back!

The scallop salad was yummy. Scallops were cooked perfectly. We chose to sit outside because the music and noise level inside was very loud for a Wednesday night. It was great outside until they brought out a DJ then the music outside was so loud we were unable to carry on a conversation. I would not recommend if you want to talk to those you are sitting next to.

Appetizers were delicious! The hummus , ahi tuna dip and the fried cauliflower. I recommend the peanut butter & jelly sliders (DELICIOUS). The entrees however were a little "much". Not bad but just to much stuff added together. I recommend going though to at least try it out. Fun environment.

Food and service is amazing! We are the only ones outside but get checked up on frequently. The food came out at a very great timing! Jaimie is an amazing server! Shout out to her for her amazing service! The food is great! Would definitely recommend!
Fun place for a group or just two. Menu has something for everyone. Nice servers with good food and atmosphere.

I think this might be my new favorite spot! We have now been here 3 times and have not been disappointed! The staff are great as is the atmoshpere. Let yourself be a kid again and play giant Jenga and shuffleboard!

Very nice atmosphere,  my dish disappointment.  I had the chicken and waffles. Very mushy and soggy not what you normally would expect. Took one bite and asked for something else...fish and chips light fluffy and good. The upside the deep fried cauliflower appetizer very very good....drinks good too.
i do not understand the big deal about this place.  food was okay.  service was okay.  just okay

About ten of my friends and I stopped by for Sunday brunch and mimosas (or micheladas, or beermosas, etc.) and we had a blast. I ended up trying the ahi sandwich, which was pretty yummy - the french fries, though, were perfection.  Our server, Brittany Craig, was super nice and attentive. Thank you for a beautiful Sunday morning!
Love this place! The service & the food is always amazing. Rachel was our server tonight and did a great job. Super funny & attentive! Will be back soon!

Food and service was very good. We arrived on Sunday morning just in time for brunch. The wait was not more than 5 minutes. We ordered the buffalo cauliflower and meatballs for appetizer. It was very good. For the entrees we had the chef's special french toast and another dish with grits (can't remember the name). Both dishes were very good. Our server was super attentive. Would definitely recommend this place.

I went to Public School last Tuesday night and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys a great meal with excellent service. All the servers were exceptionally well but the one that stood out the most was the manager Tommy. He was so energetic and I could tell he truly enjoyed his job & the company he works for. He was able to answer all my questions about all the items on the menu that I wanted to know more about. Tommy knew the menu as if he wrote it himself. He was very persistent & would always come back to the table to make sure we were doing good. Something most managers in other places don't do. This was the best service I've gotten In a long time. He kept a smile on his face & continued to be extremely helpful. I will be sure to come back here while also advising all my friends to go. If I could give him 10 stars I would, but I guess 5 will do :)

Bland food. Undercooked rice and overcooked bread. The roasted poblano with quinoa was missing something in the flavor department nice kick but the stuffing was missing a nice flavor. The mezze plate with overcooked hard to rear bread. Hummus was lacking olive oil and needed some paprika to kick it up to the standard of good hummus. Service was subpar and the menu was limited. Won't be back.

Cauliflower appetizer excellent!!  Pepperoni pizza loaded with pepperoni!  Bison burgers very flavorful!  Fish and chips excellent-  nice meaty pieces of cod!  The best thing of all was the Brussels sprouts side dish-best ever!!   Only reason not five stars was they forgot one of the items on the pizza. Service excellent!   One in our party said the black house beer was very good!!

First visit &.. Atmosphere is appealing, food great, and service incredible. Our server Katie was very helpful & spot on with suggestions. We will definitely be back & ask to be seated in her section.

If I could give this place a Zero I would. We left before we even got sat do to the horrible looks from the waitstaff, manager and hostess. 
When we arrived after the holiday parade we were told a 15 minute wait for table for 3.  Well 30 min later and seeing 6 other parties being sat before us, getting dirty looks from the wait staff, a hostess glaring at my kids and never speaking to us during the wait, a manager obviously seeing us just wait there and not even acknowledging us with a hi, we just left. 
I will spend my money with  other restaurants in summerlin who have amazing customer service. This place just left a bad taste in my mouth. Felt so uncomfortable there. Was really looking forward to the place too . Oh well!!!!

Can't say enough good things about Public School 702. This is my third time here and everything has been great. 

Fried chicken and waffles with the green chile cornbread waffles are so good. Ahi tuna taco app was also really, really good. 

Brittany is a very attentive waitress and lots of fun. She is smart and very knowledgable about the menu. Trust her advice. This is one of the best places in Vegas.

The crispy chicken sandwich that I ordered was absolutely amazing! The flavors were not overpowering at all! The blue cheese kale salad is also great as a healthy alternative. There is also big chunks of blue cheese that I like! The service was fantastic! The environment is very open. Next time I go I want to sit outside on the patio! Anyways enjoy and always have fun while you are out!!

Food is great, especially the chorizo mac and cheese. Yummy cocktails and nice beer selection. Unfortunately, both times I have been here service has been slooooow. Took almost 20 to get just our drinks...

It's like dating someone really pretty with no substance. Attractive on the outside, but super disappointing on the inside. Service sucks- super slow, rude and did I mention they're super slow? The food and drinks were decent when we finally got them, but not enough to bring me back. We had to walk up to the register to pay our check, then we walked over to CPK where they had excellent, friendly and attentive service. Take notes, Public School.

Crispy cauliflower. That's all you need to know.

Great cocktail and craft beer selection as well.

Live music and patio games round out a perfect evening in Vegas.

After my previous review where I walked out, i received an email from their corp office wanting to talk about the experience. I gave them my email address and never heard from them. Again proves my point - bad management.
Public school obviously showed how basic the service and food is. Invest your money in private school people, lol!

Came for brunch for our first time here and had an absolutely amazing experience!! $10 all you can drink brunch cocktails and beer is the best deal in town and the food was equally as good. Had the watermelon and tomato salad which was delicious and refreshing and also the white bean breakfast toast which was amazing!!! Our server Sean was great and brought me my next drink without even asking for it. Overall an exceptional experience and I can't wait to come back. My boyfriend was also super impressed with their eclectic beer menu.

The place: Public School 702

Clean and well lit with equal parts natural light and soft bulb illumination. The staff was great and responsive and the place was clean. Everything you might expect from a place in the center of the the newest place in town, Downtown Summerlin.

Food: C.C.B Burger and fries

The burger was amazing with every ingredient showcased in ever bite. My only issue with the burger, it is crazy wet. Quite the pool that left my hands sticky from the balsamic and my bun nearly disintegrated for the final bites.
The fries are pretty standard in design and implementation but the way they compliment the burger is fantastic. Whatever they did to make them work so well is a mystery since they appeared to be very normal fries.

Drinks: Coffee milk stout from Stone brewing

Excellent lightweight stout with a dark complexion and a dark chocolate finish that is pleasant with every sip or gulp. If you like Murphy's or Guinness this stout should put you right where you want to be.

The food is so reasonably priced for how unique and delicious it is. They have an amazing happy hour menu. Everyone who works there is so polite, patient, and strangely attractive... I love sitting outside because it can get a little loud inside, especially with the music.
Decent neighborhood place in Summerlin. Convenient location. Food is ok, but limited menu.

Their "happy hour" or as they call it "recess" is a great deal!


Explore their cocktail menu or the extensive draft list! Either way you will be happy! 

Great hidden treasure in downtown Summerlin!

The food was very good. Overpriced though. The service was horrible! We were ignored for the first 10 minutes when we sat down. Our waitress never smiled once... It looked like all of the waiters were zombies with no emotion and not friendly at all! I hope management reads these reviews and can take note that your waiting staff sucks!!
Just had the best dinner,  Vanessa V was the best.  She made great recommendations, had a trainee and still didn't miss a beat.

The food here is absolutely amazing. We had my birthday planned for a different place, but immediately switched to Public School after eating here once. The food is out of this world, and the beer selection is amazing. I recommend the jidori chicken with jalapeno cornbread waffles. Make sure to ask for Vanessa as your server. She walked me through the extensive beer menu and even provided me with samples of her recommendations. Best service ive had ina  long time.

We tried a wide range of items from the menu, and nothing stood out at all. You'll notice that most of these reviews are about the staff and decor - and yes, the service was good, and the decor and theming is outstanding. It's still a restaurant though, and the food sucked.

We didn't try any of the cocktails though... Maybe that's where they shine.

Went on a Friday night.  Approached the host stand and were quoted 40 minutes.  After some thought we decided to put our name down and have a drink at the bar.  Keep in mind we almost left because of the long quote.

We sat down at the bar and were given menus immediately.  After the menus went down the attention went away.  It seemed the staff behind the bar was more interested in sampling the beers on draft than they were servicing the patrons.  We finally were asked if we had been helped and put in an order for 2 glasses of wine and ordered a cheese platter.  After 10 minutes at the bar we were texted that our table was ready...??  definitely the door needs help quoting parties accurately.  We had to cancel the cheese platter and went to our table outside.

The outside and inside are 2 different animals.  The inside was very loud and reminded me of a college bar atmosphere.  The outside was much quieter and enjoyable.

We ordered the cheese platter, the hummus platter, and the chop salad.  All dishes were great and portions were more than enough.  The server was very friendly and noticed my wife from another visit.  Only issue I had was that she spent too much time chatting with other tables and it hurt the refills of our wine and ordering process.

There seemed to be A LOT of staff at the restaurant.  All in all I loved the food and the concept is unique.  If given the choice and the weather is favorable go for the patio booths.

Jaimie was friggin awesome!!! This was only my second time here & the experience was phenomenal, everyone here carries a genuine smile, the food is amazing, and the mimosas are incredible! Jaimie, thank you for taking care of us!

Great atmosphere, great food, reasonable prices. A hip and trendy place to go with friends.

Went there for a working lunch. The bacon & cheese tater tots and the deep fried cauliflower were delicious. Sauce complemented both appetizers well. I ordered the Lamb burger; it was cooked perfectly and well-seasoned. It was delicious. The side salad was a little bitter, and a blemish on an otherwise excellent meal.

Bottom line: make it a point to go back to School. You'll be glad you did.

I would typically NEVER give a 5-star review, even if I was really impressed by a restaurant or server, but I strongly feel this place deserves it. Being a beer lover, I was stoked about their selection of craft beers on tap. My server Colby (like the cheese, lol) was very knowledgable about the food and drinks and sold me a Dawn of the Red brew that I really loved while I chowed down on ahi wanton tacos--also delicious. I would have never considered putting ahi in a crispy wonton but it was magic. Despite the fact that I'm a beer loyalist, they had such an interesting selection of craft cocktails I had to indulge while I was finishing up my meal. Colby said that the crushed velvet was very popular so I gave it a try. Nice refreshing take on a Moscow mule. The fresh lavender was nice touch. I can't wait to go back and work my way through their great tap selection, and I'll definitely ask for Colby's section because I've never had such great service at a casual concept.

Came here last minute date night with wife.  It has a cool casual vibe.  Our wait staff was very attentive and gave prompt service.  We had fiery calamari and ahi tacos.  The tacos had sweet bitter contrast which were nice.  Calamari was not spicy but had a good taste and crispy.  They had wide selection of beers.  My Hawaiian beer was refreshing.  

Over all, it is a perfect place to chill with a love one.  Call ahead for a seat outside over looking the fountains.

Good service, really good food!

I highly recommend the chicken and waffles!

Terrible service.  I was told it would be an hour to eat outside and 20 minute for the inside.  There were many tables in both places. So I asked the hostess what the problem was,  she said they were short in the kitchen.  We went somewhere else.
Been to Public School twice.  The service is great and food is exceptional.  We will definitely go back!

The food was pretty good, there is this awesome citrus beer. But what makes this place truly special is by far one of the best wait staff that I have experienced in Vegas.  Grace is soo attentive and knows the menu backwards and forwards and certainly gives wonderful recommendations!

Food was good enough to warrant a return in the future. Service was ok, the two of us stood for a few minutes when we first arrived and the restaurant was not super busy, but they had us seated within 5 minutes. The hamburger was awesome. Ground chuck, super tender and juicy with an egg. Can't beat it. Beers are a little on the spendy side, and I didn't like the one I ordered, so probably won't be doing that again. Not for 8 bucks anyway. The bacon cheddar tots were really good, don't even tell me what the calorie count was! Don't need to know!

Wanted to try this place on HH. Cauliflower was over breaded & unmemorable. Server charged me regular price for HH wine , which is a %50 mark up. Asked other bartender to fix my tab which she did promptly. However, the ladies sitting next to me had the same problem of being charged double for their drinks as well. Server just blew it off by saying "oh you wanted happy hour? You didn't say that".
Eh on service. Ordered 3 appetizers, got them all separately. Had to ask for napkins. I've had better service and better food but the drinks were good.

Really good food & unique atmosphere! Brunch menu is great - three of us had different dishes & all were excellent. Came again for Happy Hour which was a great bargain! Try their Gin & Tonic drink because they make their own tonic water, which is different but delicious! We had small plates - edamame hummus, Mac & cheese, tuna poke - all were super good. Note that the popular deck is usually full. Love the schoolhouse decor! Waitstaff are great.

I came here for my birthday with my family we had a reservation , they greeted us at the door and said it would be a minute. We were seated with in 5 minutes. After that the trouble began, 15 minutes later they asked if we have been helped. He took are drink order and never asked if we wanted apps until the drinks came.
After taking our order for apps it took 35 minutes for our food to come out. My pizza came out cold and sent it back. My wife had the chicken and waffles (very good). My son had the fish and chips (ok). My pizza finally came out and it was the same pizza warmed up and dry.

Would I come back??? I will give it another chance.

This place is so cute. It's literally like a school. The theme is carried out throughout the restaurant and even down to the menu. Talk about paying attention to detail.

We meet up with one of my fiancé's friends here during the afternoon of New Year's Eve. This restaurant is baby  friendly and provides a steady high car for children (her baby was 1). 

We ordered a decent amount of food. They were cooked well and there was plenty. The price was reasonable. I ordered the appetizer and I ate it like a main course meal. The calamari and crispy naked wings were great. I enjoyed the ahi tuna poke & this is the only place that I felt provided enough chips for the ahi tuna (I usually ask for more at other places). I highly recommend the brussels spouts... I never had it before but I totally enjoyed it. 

Drink meal, they have a variety of choices. I ordered the ace beer and that is the only beer I could really drink.

I went here for the first time for a company holiday party. I was kind of bummed because the menu for it had no vegan options. When the waiter came to take my order, I said I'd not be eating since there isn't a vegan option and he said he'd see if he could fix that. The chef made a wonderful poached pear salad with arugula and candied pecans. Then, for desert, I was completely surprised to be delivered a lovely poached pear sort of taco with fried pastry dough as the shell and chocolate and powdered sugar. It was my first time having pears and it was absolutely delicious. I really appreciate them going to far to accommodate my dietary preferences and not just for the entree, but dessert - it was really sweet of them, and they are lucky to have such a stellar chef! Many places are nice and modify what they can to make recipe's vegan, but pretty much none make a vegan dessert.

My coworkers really all loved their meals, especially the buffalo cauliflower. Give this place a shot! The atmosphere, staff, and food are wonderful.
Food decent. Prices decent. Good beer. Ok mixed drink options. The it place right now.  Very friendly staff and servers.

The ambiance is really neat.  They really go all in on the "public school" theme.  The service was really, really slow. The food was ok, but bad, just not amazing enough for me to tell my friends to come check it out.  It might be a better spot to meet for drinks or happy hour. Marilyn didn't know the menu. I ordered two things and she came back with corrections both times.  I asked specifically if the salad came with romaine or spring she said kale and romaine.  She later came back to say it came with shredded cabbage.  I ended up getting the Salmon which was good and lite and my friend got the Chicken and Waffles which was different. Not bad though, just ok.
I've only had an appetizer once. We usually come for drinks. Nice patio. Just found out they have a brunch.

This is one of my favorite social eateries. If you're down to pick off each others' plates then bring some friends and order a lot of different items because most are good. Tonight was chorizo Mac n cheese and the pb&j burger. The burger was AMAZING. Recommend for sure.

I only give the restaurant four stars because they seated us in an area without a server. We were ready to leave but our server Tyler saved our evening. The restaurant gets four stars but Tyler gets five stars. We were not in his section but he ensured we had a wonderful meal!

Fun place and some different menu options... It always seems to be very busy.... Service is pretty good... 2 downfalls... #1 Music in bar area is like being in a Rave and it's so loud the last 3x I was there I left with no voice from trying to speak over the music... #2 they don't seem to have enough glasses because I've been served wine 5+ times in a hot glass fresh out of the dishwasher... Glad it's clean but not very good for the wine.

Well we found a new favorite dining experience. We had the buffalo cauliflower, tater tots, speck and deviled egg, chicken and green chili waffle. It was awesome. I now have a new way to eat cauliflower. 
Sheena our server was really engaged and knowledgeable. 
We actually came back today to try other menu items.

Labor Day. Expected it to be crowded, and it was. The great thing about Public School 702 is its size. Even while busy, like today, you can't tell it is because the tables are spread out nicely to not give the appearance that it's  bustling.

I've been here a handful of times since its opening and have never been utterly disappointed with the food. It's just good bar food but does not blazea trail of culinary excellence or originality. Service always seems to start off a little slow but due to team service model, once the order is in, food and drink get out at a good clip.

That being said, this is a review for weekend  brunch service. The brunch menu is more interesting that the regular menu, and we enjoyed it much more. Flavors were bold and serving sizes were huge.  We had the jidori chicken and green chili cornbread waffles and the chicken sausage with cheese grits. The chicken and waffles was one of the better interpretations of this classic dish. The waffle was more savory, and the slight heat from the green chili offset some of the heaviness of the dish. The chicken sausage and grits were good and plentiful stuffed with wilted kale, cherry tomatoes, and topped with an over easy egg. The menu didn't indicate that it would be spicy but there was definitely some heat in the vegetable mixture, which I appreciated.  Paired with the grits, it was a very filling meal. I would've appreciated a biscuit or some piece of bread to sop up some sauce, but then again, I may have had to wear a biscuit since I was so full.

For those with kids, this is a good place to eat some grown up food and appease some kids' boring palates. They have a kids menu with the standards - mac and cheese, pizza, chicken, cheese burger sliders, etc. Portions are large (a couple of young kids could share a pizza) but it's not the cheapest kids' meals either. Noise level isn't too much of a concern because there's always a game of shuffle board where the banging of the pucks sound like large wood planks slamming against each other. 

It's a good choice for the whole family and especially if you're walking around DT Summerlin. Cool inside dining and if eating outdoors is your thing, they have a nice patio, but most of the view is parking lot and a little of the water feature at the north end of the mall.

3rd time coming here but there's new management and it's night and day difference. The service is soooo much better and the drinks/food came out quickly and tasted amazing. Lissie was our server and was just delightful, will come again :)

A great spot. The decor reminded me my school days. Great food and drink menu. I really enjoyed the spicy breaded cauliflower. Great view of the Summerlin Mall from this second story location. I'm anxious to go back. The only thing keeping this from getting five stars was the slow service. It took forever to get  drinks after  our order was placed. We had several orders & each one was slow arriving.

I like this concept of Public School but think it needs to be fine tuned. The food is ok. I tried about half of the dinner menu and I'd say my favorite was the cheddar bacon tots or the buffalo cauliflower. The pizza was mediocre at best and the wings and chicken fingers were extremely salty. My favorite thing I've gotten here was the Earl Grey Juniper cocktail (gin based) it was yummy! Aside from those, the food and service were just average.
I didn't realize this was a large chain....  the happy hour specials were a good value... but the food was not amazing (just average).

You can't seat a party of 10 because you are out of silverware? 
But you can seat the next two groups of 4?
Give a better excuse next time.
Great find. I had the salmon entree. It was one of the best cooked dishes that I have tasted. The edamame hummus with flatbread was fantastic.

The menu is fresh with a great selection of beers and a rotating list on tap, the food is good and the decor is fun and unique but what stood out the most was the customer service. We had two beers and two appetizers and one beer was a little late and so was one appetizer (30 min late). We didn't complain but when our server realized what had happened she immediately sent the manager over who came to make sure we were having an ok time. And then he comped our entire bill and even asked our server to offer us free dessert. We declined and were impressed at the efforts they made to make the situation right. This is a place you won't be dissatisfied with.

I went to Public School in downtown summerlin with some friends on Saturday night and had a great time. The place is huge! It is decorated by old public school relics and there is definitely some interesting history pieces of Las Vegas as well. We sat ourselves in the bar which is open seating and was great since we didn't have to wait. Our server was a comical and energetic gentlemen named Jared. Great personality for a server. The craft beer menu is daunting but he got us some samples of recommendations and we all found something we liked. We ordered food family style so we could all try everything. We ordered the tots, Mac and cheese, pepperoni pizza and the Tuscan salad. Everything was awesome, it came out staggered so we're able to try it all hot and fresh. We would have tried the cookie sandwich but were stuffed. Well come back and try it next time as well definitely be back. If you're going see if Jared's working. He said there were two of them though so ask for Jared Smithe.
Amazing breakfast and even better service from Jordann! She made sure food was good and consistently filled the bottomless mimosas, highly recommend!

Christian was our bartender and he was absolutely amazing !! We're super indecisive and he was able to make us some delicious shots. 
This place has changed since it first opened and I love what it's about now. The new Gm is very pleasant as well

I stopped by with my cute little girlfriend Kim because she was being a hungry little baby, and it was beyond my expectation.  The business gave off a similar vibe as other public house themed pub/bar but had better tasting food, better quality cocktails, and more interesting theme than the others.  I expected something like Yardbird, but it was much better.  And the bartender, Kallie, was proficient in her mixology. Well done. I would definitely come back next time I'm in the mall. 

If there was something that bothered me, it was the fact that they had on a TV channel on surgeries, the nasty kind. Puss popping and liposuction. Disgusting choice for a place that serves food.  My little baby had to run away to the bathroom while all patrons were screaming.  I gave four stars as Kim said it was "unforgiving" for a restaurant to make such mistakes. I would change the review if no such thing occurs next time.
What a cool place. We just had drinks, but a great selection of craft beers on tap.  The second story patio is great on a nice day overcast day not a ton of shade.  The food looked incredible.
Sunday brunch menu is small, food was adequate but not spectacular. Great selections of beers and drinks. Loud, service was slow.  It someplace I would go back to.

This was a great experience from the very beginning when we were greeted with so many smiles! The entire staff were so friendly and accommodating and the food was so delicious, everything we ordered was perfection! Love the vibe too, awesome view outside at night also!
My daughter picked this for her birthday dinner and so glad she did, we'll definitely be back:) Wished I would have gotten the names of our server,host, and other staff so I could commend them for a wonderful experience, Thanks So Much Public School 702!!!!
Amazing food. Amazing Service. Great ambience! Try the buffalo cauliflower! Vegan options too, bonus!

Do not eat here if you want to be able to converse with others at your table. It is club loud up in there. Not sure why they do that. You have to scream to communicate with anyone. I'll never come back because I like to actually interact with my dining companions. Food is ok. Service is barely acceptable.

This place is seriously legitimate.

$4 Craft beers!
Shuffleboard!
Outside Patio with Beer Pong
Shrimp and Grits that you will die over
Cool atmosphere!
Downtown summerlin!

This place HAS IT ALL!

Being a frequent visitor of Downtown Summerlin, (Sephora....need I say more?) when I first noticed this place my boyfriend & I decided we needed to eat there ASAP. We came here on a Friday around 5:45 or so for happy hour. It was packed & we were told happy hour was in the bar area or outside on the patio. We chose the latter. It wasn't too hot & each booth had a fan. I absolutely LOVE the theme of this restaurant. The menus look like the old school composition notebooks. The managers walk around dressed like teachers  I mean, it's adorable. 

When we sat down it took a while for our server to come over to us & ask for drinks, but it was super busy so it wasn't a big deal. By the time he came over we already knew what we wanted to order from the happy hour menu (which has really good choices!) so we put in our food order as well. 

My boyfriends beer came out first, and about 10 minutes later I finally received my drink. I ordered the crushed velvet which it's their spin on the classic Moscow Mule. It was REALLY good, and I'm not much of a drinker. It had the distinct flavors or blackberry & lavender. Super yummy. 

Our food came out pretty quickly. One by one. We ordered the speck & eggs which were really good! The ahi street tacos, also good. The farro & Brussels sprouts salad wasn't all that great, only because it's not my kind of thing. After receiving all our plates our server went to another table. We decided almost immediately that we wanted to order a couple more things before happy hour was over (at 6:30). I looked at my phone & saw it was 6:10 or so. I knew our server would be back before 6:30 so I wasn't worried. Also as a side note, when we got our first plate, my boyfriend ordered another beer. 

But here's the thing...our server didn't come back. Not to check on us & see if we liked the food, not to drop off my boyfriends beer. Nothing. Finally another server or runner brought out his beer....20 min later. Yep. 20 MINUTES! What? That's just nuts. 

So from 6:10 or so to 6:28 we waited for our server to come back so we could order more from the happy hour menu. Finally he came & we told him we'd like to order one more beer, and another dish from the happy hour menu (PB&J sliders) and something off the happy hour menu (shrimp & grits). To which he responded..."well happy hour is actually over right now. But I'll try & see if I can get it in." I responded with "but it's only 6:28. I thought happy hour ended at 6:30." And he replied with the same thing: "I'll try to get it in". I didn't bother telling him that if he had come back to check on us before 18 minutes...we could've put in our order sooner. I knew that if he couldn't "get it in" then I was going to speak to a manager. 

So he left our table & went to the table directly across from us where a group of women were eating & they too ordered from the happy hour menu. He told them the same thing, that happy hour was over, but he'd "try" (like he's doing us all a favor. -__-) and they said what I didn't want to say. "Well we wanted to order sooner but we couldn't find you. You never came to our table again. If you can't do it, I'd like to speak with a manager." He replied with "I'll try". 

Alas we all got our food at the happy hour prices, and it was bomb. Our server was a SUPER nice guy. He just needs to work on spot checking his tables more often. 

I have to say the shrimp & grits were delicious, but the star of the show is the PB&J sliders. We weren't expecting them to be a mind-blowing revelation. But they were. They have a beef patty, crunchy peanut butter, and habanero jelly. They are DIVINE. if you've made it this far into my review, (I applaud you.) and you take away only ONE thing from it, please let it be this: ORDER THE PB&J SLIDERS. 

Carry on, fellow Yelpers.
This place never disappoints. The pepperoni pizza had jalapeño pepper - best addition to a pizza. I was a little leery at first but it was fantastic! The service and atmosphere was perfect.

Great locations coz it's at downtown summerlin but I have a felling that this restaurant will close down in a few months. The place is ok, not inviting. Music is not good, not cozy I guess!
