The food is ok, calamari was too salty, the meatballs were not so good with linguine, we were told it's spicy and we said it's ok but the flavoring and the consistency of food does not go well with too much spicy. Cute coke in a bottle drink, fried chicken waffles were OK, I've tasted better! Dessert is ordinary and simple. So all in all nothing to look forward to, I don't even like beers and most of their alcoholic drinks are beer and wine, I wish they have fruity mixed drinks as an option!! I gave 2 stars for location. Will probably not go back here until they upgrade their menu and music

I have been to the restaurant and had good experiences but ordered food today online.  Asked for them not to put bacon in something and it came with bacon.  I just gave it away as I can't eat it.  Contacted the restaurant and they gave the delivery service a bs answer about getting the request but not being able to do it.  Because not putting an ingredient in is evidently complicated.  As many people have dietary restrictions or food allergies, they should inform people when they don't want to do something.  Very disappointing.

Great space, cool atmosphere, a bit slow on service and horrible bar service. Red haired girl bartender is so flipping slow it was ridiculous...almost got up to leave. Not even close to being a busy night. Each time we ordered a drink it took FOREVER to get it.  Be sure to order two beers at a time.   Music outside, not too loud which is the only nice thingabout it; DJ'S suck...choice of music is terrible.The booths outside attract the bugs due to hanging lights above table, really nasty, would never eat outside at night or evensit at a booth with a beer. They need to figure that bug issue out big time. With that being said, I would go back for the mushroom pizza all day long, really good pizza, and will just expect bad bar service, and eat inside.

Initially I was impressed with the modern Decor sadly that is where it stopped. I have made reservations through yelp and there was some sort of corporate issue with the website and I had no reservation even though I had received a confirmation. I had brought guests from out of town to try the new restaurant out expecting it to be amazing. Everyone disliked their food. Including myself. It was bland tasting and  not worth the trip out to downtown Summerlin.  Perhaps an unrefined to pallet would find this delicious.

What a great place for a incredible meal, a relaxed atmosphere and fantastic view
Michele, our server was wonderful and fit in with the entire atmosphere 
Have found our new favorite place to eat and can't wait to return and try all the appetizers and don't forget deserts. The main menu is so diverse everyone can find something to eat

Went here in a party of 4 this Saturday night. The place has very cool decor that sticks with the school theme. The menus were cool how they looked like composition books. We sat in the communal dining area because there was a 45 minute wait for the private tables and the bar was full. Our waitress was very friendly however we were waiting on our drinks forever. I ordered a steak salad and our friends had a burger. The atmosphere was social but the music and the loudness of everyone's conversation was definitely clashing. Our friend's got their food about 5 minutes before us... I thought this was very unprofessional as we were telling our friends to go ahead and start eating and they felt awkward eating in front of us. We had ordered medium-well for both the burger and the steak salad and when we got our food, both cuts of meat were very pink. I almost sent my steak salad back but I knew it would take even longer to get it and we had already been waiting a while. The salad lacked flavor and I ended up asking for lemons and vinegar to season it myself. I would still go again here but I would choose something else on the menu and order well-done to avoid having an almost still mooing cow delivered on my plate.
Jamie was awesome ! Thanks for the great suggestions ! We'll be back again for sure !

This place is generally good. The only things  I will complain about is that is sort of half upscale sports bar and half casual fine dining sort of weird but it works for them. Also because of the half sports bar atmosphere there are tvs which play sport and loud people screaming at the tvs and it gets extremely obnoxious especially since I'm paying $60-$120 to have a meal there. The pricing is IN NO WAY in line with the atmosphere they have crated. Although the theme is cool, I'll give them that. 

 I think the food is good but overpriced for sure (probably because it's downtown summerlin) but I'd say definitely worth trying out be prepared for a meal for two to be at least $60 that's the minimum. I had the salmon succotash it was good but it was a bit too lemony for my taste and it said "grilled" and I though it was more blackened but maybe my definition for grilled is different. I finished my meal. I paired it with a red wine cabernet which went nicely with the salmon. 

My boyfriend got a huntsman burger which he enjoyed but he said the ketchup it came with was weird and too spicy for his taste (mine too) I tried his burger it tasted good and was seasoned well (not $20worth though)

All in all its good but no better than like yard house or something and way pricier too.
Good food. Good ambience. Amazing server! Thank you, Elizabeth for making my first visit to Public School a wonderful one. They're lucky to have you!
Met some friends here for a get together. Michael was our server. I had the Thai Noodle Salad and the crispy calimari. Very tasty. I'll bring my husband next time.

Public School 702 is always a great place for a quick bite, dinner and enjoy a few beers. We also like Public School 818, 213 and 805. The menu is pretty standard but sometimes they switch things up. The kids menu is great and the portions are quite generous. The Brussel Sprouts are amazing!

The food was good, but the soda comes in glass bottles with no refills. The Diet Coke bottle is a mini bottle, while the Coke was regular size and they were the same price. When I complained, they gave me a free Diet Coke to go, but just be aware that they are in bottles , with no refills.
The food was pretty tasty. Had the Dragoon Short Rib over priced. The bartenders are all KUHL. We will be going back for sure.  I approve this message JK KUHL...
Fun decor but very loud.  Buffalo cauliflower good but salmon-over cooked and dry served on not fresh vegetables. Will not go again.

Went here on an incredibly hot day for lunch. It was really loud inside, so we opted to eat on the patio despite the heat.

The gluten free menu, available upon request, is not extensive. But that is my only real complaint. The food was excellent. I ordered steak tacos in lettuce, and my husband had salmon. Both were good. I wasn't asked my preference for the steak, but I would say it was medium to well cooked.

If you are averse to noise as I am, I would recommend going when it is less hot outside. They have misters going, but it was still pretty hot. The fans were unfortunately out of order, but we were told they will be fixed soon. Perhaps I will update if we return. But with the limited gluten free menu, I won't want to go back for a while.

The decision to eat here is the best "Las Vegas decision" I've ever made. Our server, sister Katie was knowledgable on every item and wasn't afraid to make recommendations based on what we were looking for. Just like a real sister, except we are not even related. 

Lauren also stopped at our table to make some drink recommendations and helped us decide which dessert to choose (ask her how they apply the Nutella....it's a treat. 

I'll be back with friends for sure. Oh and try the steak with the Mac and Cheese.

Let me start by saying I have eaten here several times. And while no meal was ever perfect, some were definitely better than others. When the service has been great, the food has been mediocre. When the food has been awesome, the service has lacked, and ultimately, I think the service in general leaves alot to be desired. The past few times we have dined there, we weren't greeted promptly, had to wait an unusual amount of time for drinks, or been left without refills for the entire meal, and the food has been a solid three star rating. We do have our favorites on the menu, like the buffalo cauliflower and the charcutterie platter, which have been consistently good. The chicken and waffles, however, has been consistently bland, and sometimes downright bad. The fish and chips is a safe choice, and usually pretty good. The burgers are always hit or miss, and just tonight, we ordered the shorty bowl, which was pretty good, but the egg was cold, and cold runny egg yolk is not my favorite, by far.

I want this place to be better than it is, and at this point, given the cost of the entrees and the lackluster food and service that feels like the staff just doesn't care, I don't think it will be in our rotation any more.

Has a very cool atmosphere, brings you back to school . Happy hour menu was good . There beer variety was great, different flavors and great taste. We tried the fried broccoli and it had a great flavor. Also tried the sliders from the happy hour menu and they had a really nice flavor. The spicy ketchup was a plus!

I came in today for Happy hour.  Happy hour prices are fair. HH beer is $1-2 off on select pints. Beer selection is good, but not necessarily for HH price ! HH food is still on the pricey side in my opinion. HH Ahi Tuna Fish Tacos $7, 4 smaller than average street tacos; taste decent. HH chicken wings $6 very good, worth it! 

HH Chorizo Mac&Cheese $7 (normal $10). TERRIBLE! WORST MAC&Cheese ever. Cheese is runny and bland, like they thinned in milk. Was served in cast iron dish, but some how the cheese is still runny, did you forget to bake it?! Chorizo is Spanish style and cured; I was expecting Mexican style, but menu doesn't clarify. Salt and Vinegar lays potato chips on top added for crunch, but was not fully crumbled and made the dish difficult to eat. Kale is added, so I can pretend that the dish healthy, but does nothing to taste. 

Our server Mark was great, truly understanding, and helpful. 
My recommendation for this place go for the beer and atmosphere only! Food is so-so, but pricey.

Great spot for brunch. They can Handel a crowd, trust me we had a table of 9 and they were able to handle us easily with no wait. The waitresses were super nice and very informative about the menu and the best way to utilize the Bottomless drinks 
Had a great time can't wait until next weekend

Lovely restaurant with friendly staff. Our waiter Julian was the best part about our experience. Everything about his service was top notch. Now let's get to the food. Extremely disappointing. The carving board is above average. Was not disappointed in this selection. Fried calamari ?? Wow. One of the worst I've ever had. Dry .. sauce was sub par. When I requested marinara it arrived ice cold with zero flavor. For $12 we received $1 worth of product. Three of us ordered and each dish was just ok. I had the poblano peppers with rice. Just ok. My friends had shrimp with white cheddar grits and fish and chips. Well .. I think nice plump shrimps would be the way to go not medium sized average shrimps. And the fish and chips ... really greasy while the breading was extremely larger than the piece of fish. Very disappointing. Not thrilled with the Pinot Noir selection. Looks like the girls night out needs to find a new place to spend $150 plus tip.

I really liked this place - I went in on one of the very first days. I enjoyed the unique food combinations and we tried a lot! The service was very friendly and accommodating. 

My favorite thing about them is the very large patio. They have spots for beer pong, oversized Jenga, oversized Connect Four. I like where it's located also. Hopefully they do well! Attached is a photo of the beer pong area.

I would love to give this restaurant 5 stars, because not only do I love the food and the beer selection, I love the atmosphere. But I've gone there on three different occasions and have had rude, rude, rude extremely rude service. Not only by a server, but a bartender and a manager. I will definitely start logging names because as an employee in the service industry myself I can't believe how entitled the employees are when a customer isn't happy with their meal or is just asking questions. My fiancé and myself had a manager laugh in our faces when we had a question regarding the menu and wanted the price to be adjusted based on how it was described.
There really needs to be a little customer service training for all the employees and managers. Employees, guest and customers alike need to understand quality customer service comes from quality customers and severs. I hope sooner than later the quality of service changes because it's actually a great place in a great location especially to have such shitty service and managers!!!

Pounding club music, tattooed hipsters, and marginal food. This restaurant caters to the 10 years- behind -San Francisco scene.  Looooong wait- over an hour- & bartenders who do not scan their section but rather focus on who is sitting directly in front of them. During a busy service, scan your section to check drinks and serve anyone who looks like they need service, and then hustle! Wouldn't go back.

We really love this place -- have been here quite a few times and always have great food and great service. Tonight was no exception -- our server was Rachael!  She was sweet and efficient. She handled many requests with no problem and was sincere in her service. She checked on us the light our meal and got everything right!  
We will definitely be back and we hope we get Rachael again!

The customer service was horrible. We sat down at the bar and the bartender handed us a menu with half of the items that expired. I ended up getting a Jack and coke and the bartender filled up the portion shot and ran out of Jack while it was half filled and didn't bother opening a new bottle it was strictly coke. We sat down and received water out of a vase to distribute out for the table ourselves. After we received our second bottle we noticed a lot of food floating around in the bottle. We had already drank half of the bottle! We brought it up to the server and he responded let me get you another one. We expressed our disgust with what had happened and he said he would talk to his manager. Once he returned with a clean bottle we asked what the manager said and he responded with "he didn't say much". We were appalled! The manager then finally came by and asked "what would you like me to do?" It was like pulling teeth for good service. The only reason I'm not giving this one star is because they took 20% off the bill. Over all the food was OK and the menu was confusing the entire table ordered the same thing. Be careful.

Stopped by for dinner again. I love the cutting board and mushroom pizza! Perectly cooked and service was amazing! Wasn't a fan of the smoke on watermelon but they replaced it with the crushed velvet. Super awesome! I love it here and will be back soon!

Bartender was nice and helpful, but almost every time we come in they are out of certain beers or something has been discontinued.  Our bartender recommended two beers, then came back and said they were out lol.  No surprise anymore.  That is my main complaint.  However, thanks for putting the PB&J sliders back on the menu amen!

Had a great dinner here last Friday night with family. Tyler was our server and he did a fantastic job. We had a party of 11 with 4 little kids and Tyler handled it well. His recommendation of the Huntsman's burger was spot on. Very tasty. The chorizo Mac and cheese was awesome too. I just wish they had more IPAs on tap.
Great atmosphere. Love the "recess hour" especially with the recommendations of our awesome server Vanessa! Love truffle fries and ahi tuna tacos.
Came in for happy hour, dead. Bartender zero personality or attentiveness. Only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because of the beer list.

This place is a breath of fresh air in Vegas. Great happy hour, rotating beer menu, interesting flavor combinations. 

Our service was fantastic. Tyler made sure our drinks were filled and our food came out super fast. We gobbled it up. 

Happy hour prices are top notch. I highly recommend the crispy cauliflower and the Parmesan truffle frites. 

In the main menu we also enjoyed The Cutting Board meat and cheese selections. 

I don't know where the find all the bearded hotties but I like it.

The atmosphere is cool and classic. Not the best place to watch the big game considering there aren't that many TV's. The food/drink was basic and boring and way overpriced. The staff was friendly and took care of us. Overall, the experience was lame

Just had an amazing dinner here with 2 friends.  The waiter(Noah) was amazing.  Everything he suggest was absolutely mouth watering from beer to food, and he worked with us to accommodate a friends special dietary needs. We had Frito pie, bangers and mash and Jidori chicken after our deviled eggs appetizer.  The patio is beautiful. Can't wait to bring family from out of town and coworkers here!!!  Keep up the good work!!!

Ok, I've been here a few times (meeting friends etc) and I always have the same experience... Terrible service. They are completely disorganized, most servers have an attitude like they are doing you a favor. Summary : I avoid this place unless absolutely necessary. There are lots of great options nearby.
Valerie made our night the best night ever as our server. Very out going and most personable server I've had. Food was great and the draughts were on point
Nothing jumped out at me while eating here. The food was average and the servers were attentive. The atmosphere and furniture are wicked though. Not a bad spot to stop for lunch!

Great new restaurant at Downtown Summerlin. Food is good, nice craft beer list and unique spins on the traditional cocktail. The atmosphere inside and out is fun with beer pong, big jenga, shuffleboard and TVs. Service can be a little slow at times and if you sit by the bar it will be loud.

Cool atmosphere.

Waiter who looked like Sam Smith was kind of annoying. Kept coming to the table trying to rush us or get us to purchase more cocktails. I could understand if it was a full house and you wanted to turn the table ASAP but it was half empty dude. Relax.

I ordered the Cauliflower Buffalo bites which were very delicious. Crispy, hot, tasty dipping sauces. I also got the Grapevine cocktail which was also on point.

I would return here at some point and/or recommend it.

Public School has my attention. We had the Parmesan Truffle Fries, Margherita Pizza, PB&J Sliders, & the Chorizo Mac n Cheese. 

Walking in it was louder than we expected it to be. Classic cafeteria chatter echoing throughout. They didn't do the best job explaining how/where to sit, but our wandering caught the eye of someone who ended up being helpful. It's a "Make Friends" atmosphere which grew on us. 

The pizza was our least favorite & luckily it was also last. Not quite sure if it's simply because it paled in comparison to everything ahead of it. PB&J sliders are a must! That habanero jam MAKES it! Chorizo Mac n Cheese was good the vinegar crunch was the best touch. The texture of the chorizo set it off a bit... tough & chewy. Not sure if that was just ours or how it is, but good enough to go back and try again!

We also had the Dawn of the Red by Ninkasi Brewing Co - slight hints of pineapple, mango, and papaya. An adventure for your taste buds!

I was on assignment so I had to check out Happy Hour Items only but I was eyeing a watermelon dish that I will update w/ name later.

Overall good time, good taste. Atmosphere gives you something to automatically talk about a
I love the Mac and cheese. I haven't been here for a while, too bad Julian doesn't work here anymore. Alexis was an amazing server outstanding work! Jordan was cool too, very go getting!

Our server Amberlyn made our experience great and when we were a little thrown off by the menu changes the manager Vinny came over immediately to address it and of course pitch us on all the new amazing stuff! Thanks guys see you soon!

Visited this new spot last night for beers with my buddies and was really excited to see variety on the menu, some new craft beers, authentic cocktail mixes unique to public school, and fabulous views of downtown summerlin. We sat inside because of the muggy/hot night but once it cools down, the patio will be a nice chill spot to hang out!!

I had the bison burger medium rare with house made fries and it was amazing. Perfectly done to order. 

Can't wait to come back and try out more on the unique menu here!!

Went for dinner with a group of 7 for a friend's party. We had a reservation and were promptly seated to our table inside. The restaurant itself is huge and has a fun schoolhouse vibe to it. 

Our server was very attentive. As soon as we sat at the table, she greeted us kindly and offered to take our drink orders while we waited for our entire party to arrive. Throughout our dinner she continued to check in on us and kept the drinks flowing. 

The FOOD!!!! Because many in our group were first timers to PS702 we decided to order everything center-table, family style. So glad we did, we were able to taste a good portion of the menu and leave with full and happy tummies! What we ordered...

Appetizers:
Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower - My favorite out of the apps. Breaded and fried to perfection with a side of blue cheese aioli and buffalo sauce.
Crispy Ahi Tuna Tacos - While they were good, there really wasn't anything special about them. One order will give you 4 tacos.
The Cutting Board - A very generous sized charcuterie board with a tasty selection of meats and cheeses. One board was large enough for our entire party to try. 

Entrees:
Shrimp & Grits - One of my favorite plates of the night! A ton of flavor and a nice portion.
Short Rib - So tender and paired with horseradish mashed potatoes.
Flat Iron Steak w/ Truffle Butter - I love anything truffle, but I didn't really taste it. The plate did come with chorizo mac and cheese which was the highlight of my night! 
Jidori Chicken & Waffles - The entire dish was so flavorful! The chicken was juicy and cooked perfectly. 
Lamb Bolognese - My least favorite dish of the night... Don't order, try the above entrees instead! 

I will definitely return! Maybe for their brunch!?!!
The service isn't great and it's a pretty noisy restaurant. The food looks hopeful on the menu but the taste doesn't deliver. Its overrated in my opinion and is more trendy than anything else.

I eat at Crave often and always see this restaurant  up above. Today I decided to come try it out with my bf. We came in around 12 on a Saturday and were seated right away. Pretty busy but our waiter Zo was very attentive, and friendly. He gave us a thorough overview of the menu. I chose truffle steak because I'm truffle anything addicted!!! I'd probably be willing to eat crickets if they were truffle soaked. Anyway,my bf orders pepperoni pizza and I'm disappointed because it doesn't sound exotic. When it arrives it looks delicious and I'm no longer upset with him. My truffle salad looks amazing too but I'm let down because I really hardly taste the truffle :( his pizza was amazing. Though! Simple as it was, it was very impressive!!

I can't wait to eat here again! The school theme is so fun and cute. I loved that our table had an outlet with a USB plug (my phone happened to be dying so that was great).  Our server, Zo, blew me away with his knowledge of the menu as it was our first time eating here. He also made it fun with the "quiz questions" which tied in with the whole theme of the restaurant. We ordered the mezze plate, chicken sandwich, adobo tacos, a soda, and a glass of wine (the Tempranilla). Everything tasted amazing, was filling, and did not take long to come out after ordering. Our grand total was $46, which was super decent for everything we ordered. After our meal, Zo took the time to tell us about the happy hour and brunch menus, which I can't wait to come back and try. I have eaten at places with a similar menu for less but the theme/decor and service really sets this place apart.

Genuinely disappointed with this place. Came here for HH and sat on the patio. We sat at one of the low tops with the brown circle chairs. Very  uncomfortable. We sat down at 6:30 so HH was almost over. It wasn't very busy at all. We were ready to order basically right when we sat down. Our waitress introduced herself as Courtney. She came off very sweet, but wasn't great. We ordered the truffle fries, calamari, Margherita pizza, and the tuna poke. The calamari came out really quick. Less than 5 minutes after we ordered and it was out. It was great! The aioli and the calamari itself was amazing. With this as our starting dish, we expected the rest of the food to be great. More than 10 minutes later our truffle fries came out. They were HORRIBLE. I loveeeee anything truffle. Truffle oil, white/black truffle, truffle aioli, basically anything truffle. They had no flavor, the lemon aioli was horrible, and to top it off, they were not even remotely hot. Our waitress didn't stop back by to check on us for a while so we weren't able to let her know. The pizza followed a couple minutes later and was good. Nothing spectacular, but not bad. Finally, once we were done with the calamari and pizza, the poke came out. Very surprised it took over 25 minutes to receive. It looked like it was pre made like all the cooks would have to do would be scoop it, put it in a bowl, and grab some chips to put on the plate. It wasn't bad, the passion fruit in it gave it an odd, but unique flavor. 

Overall it was a very disappointing experience. We had higher expectations of the food and service. I get it. If it's busy, I know you will not be at my table all the time, but would've been nice if she did a quality check once we had our food. It was not busy at all. Especially for HH business. We were ready to go before we even had our poke. We assumed she forgot to ring it in since it took so long. We took two bites of the poke and asked for the check so we could leave. 

Did not see a manager present in the venue, but the hostess in the blue dress with boots was very sweet and sold us on the restaurant. 

With so many options in DT Summerlin, we might stop by to grab a cocktail at the bar, but will not be dining in.

Want to take a break away from the strip, come here!  We were greeted with a smile and seated immediately in a comfortable booth. They have a nice selection of beers and will give you a small taste if you can't decide.  During brunch on Saturday they have $4 beers, making it even better! 

I got the steak salad which was Delicious!  The steak was tender and cooked medium rare, the way I like it. The salad had both red and yellow beets, making it tasty and healthy.  It was so good, that I didn't realize until I ate it all, that the bacon was left off. I told our waitress and she was so nice about it and offered us a free dessert!  My son got a burger, which was huge and juicy. It came with fries, which were also delicious.  He said he would get it again. 

We decided to try the ice cream sandwich made with chocolate chip cookies.  It was large enough for us to share.  It was yummy!  Then our nice waitress,  Katie, surprised us with the banana pudding in a jar. She said we had to try it and she was right. It is so smooth and creamy and made with vanilla wafers. May be the best banana pudding I ever had!

The place is clean and has plenty of seating both inside and out. I will sit outside next time when it's a bit warmer.  I love the menu that is made to look like an old composition notebook from the past. The decor is wonderful, with old Worldbook Encyclopedias on a huge bookcase.  There are more things on the menu that I would like to try and more beers to drink! I will be back!

I really liked this place. I went yesterday afternoon for brunch with old and new friends. There was 6 of us and we sat in an area of the restaurant that wasn't too crowded and had enough elbow room at the table to be comfortable. The service was good, and she was able to accommodate 6 different orders. I had the sausage and grits, which was very interesting because the grits were in a loaf somewhat, and not the country time grits style that I'm used to. It had corn, bacon, sausage, kale, tomatoes, eggs and that loaf that came together nicely. 

I changed the egg from fried to scrambled because no matter how hard I try fried egg just doesn't work for my taste buds. Their "almost bottomless" is a good deal, you can choose 4 drinks individually, or 4 of the same drinks for $10. The bloody mary came with a chicken wing, which I actually wasn't ready for and slightly confused, but it gave it a nice kick. Overall, this was a great place to meet up with friends, have a couple drinks, and eat good food.

The food is good and the service is great but who is washing the dishes?!?!? Every time I've gone, I've had either a plate, glass or silverware be dirty. I will go but I will ask for to go boxes and plastic ware.

I really wanted to love this place. We live near downtown summerlin and were so excited to try out a new restaurant. Sadly, this place was beyond disappointing, but considering they are still working on getting the kinks out, we may be back.

Positives:

1) great setting, fun ambiance, great outdoor space with games, and fairly large space to get seated quickly.

2) Variety of interesting food and drink selections on the menu at a good price; good happy hour offerings

3) The ahi tacos and calamari were great. The blueberry lavender drink was tasty, but did not come with the sprig of lavender as pictured. Think it needed more lavender.

Negatives:

1) I ordered the ahi tuna tacos on the appetizer menu and asked that the tacos and slaw salad I ordered on the side come out together as my entree. The taco came out first, even before the appetizer we ordered and my salad came way later.

2) My husband ordered a burger medium. It came out literally raw! It could have made him sick. They made him a new one and took it off our check.

3) We ordered the Nutella Ice Cream sandwich after reading all the great reviews. There was WAX PAPER in our cookie which was used to put the ice cream on the sandwich. Additionally, the cookie was extremely hard and inedible. 

4) A manager came to talk to us only after the food critic seated next to us told him what a bad experience we had. My only problem with this is that the server did not tell the manager to come talk to us after we received poor quality food. We talked to the manager who did not seem very apologetic but did give us his card if we wanted to come back. They should have comped us our meal based on our experience, but alas no offers. 

I am understanding that the restaurant is new. Unlike Lazy Dog which is around the corner and trained their staff for two weeks prior to opening, Public School 702 seems to be lacking in food and service. I am hoping this will be worked out in the future. As I stated above, its a great spot and a shame if things don't pick up. It can only go up from here!

Public school indeed with cafeteria like food. 
This review is being written by a person who comes from a food and beverage background. 

Pros: The restuarant is aesthetically pleasing. We were seated promptly and the hostess was friendly. 

Cons: We went there last night for dinner and while it was crowded we couldn't understand why. Our server was unbelievably rude. I wish I had gotten her name but she never introduced herself. She seemed fine at first but we managed to get on her bad side. She served us luke warm water (I'm not sure if that's their thing but I prefer my water cold). I asked her for cold water and she seemed irritated - but I thought maybe I was reading her wrong so brushed that off. We ordered food. Appetizers were calamari and wings. My father got the steak tacos, my boyfriend got the bison burger (medium rare), and I ordered the fish and chips. The apps were okay probably the best part of the meal. My fish was overcooked in old oil and the fries tasted frozen. We told the server that the quality of the fish wasn't good because of the old oil and her response was "is that not okay". Uh No? Im paying for quality food right? I asked her to take it back and if it's possible to get another item on the menu (steak tacos). The tacos were mediocre. The tortilla tasted old but the steak was cooked well. Now on to the burger. It was well done. When the server came by to ask how everything was, we stated that the burger was well done, not medium rare. I supposed she just took that as a statement because she didn't care to do anything about it or apologize. So now it's the end of the meal, the manager comes over to apologize for the fish and chips. We explained what was wrong and her excuse was that they didn't have an executive chef or su chef in the back, therefore the food isn't consistent. Did she really just throw her restuarant under the bus? Okay lol. The bill came out to be a $100 and some change for 2 apps, 3 entrees, and 4 beers. Not too bad but not worth the quality to be honest. The service was slow and she gave an attitude at every request. We were originally going to give her 15% tip even with the bad experience (because hey, she didn't cook the food) but changed it to 10% when she gave us a dirty look and scofted as we left. Terrible experience. Train your servers over customer service. Get someone to expedite the food. Train your manager on how to pacify a complaint without throwing the restuarant under. 

Would have been 1 star but I gave them 2 stars for the atmosphere, the apps and the friendly hostess.
Great food and friendly service. We waited age for the mains to come out and the restaurant wasn't that busy. We only ordered salads so I'm not sure what the hold up was. I would still recommend.

Back again! I live in Henderson so Public School is a destination for me/us. That being said if I/we lived closer this could become an issue~ and my server has been Sherrie (just a coincidence) and she is polite, knows the menu, checks back in after your food arrives ~ She just knows her job functions which as basic as it sounds, many in her perfection DO NOT ~
   I can't imagine coming here & not ordering the Buffalo Cauliflower or Speck & Eggs~ I would feel cheated as these 2 items are consistent, DEEELISH not to mention remarkable!!!!
    Today I ordered the Grilled Watermelon & Tomato stack  with feta cheese, mint & basalmic glaze~ Beautifully presented (I posted a pic) and very delicious to my tastes. I am NOT a feta  however this feta was SOOO thinly sliced it complemented the watermelon perfectly & the addition of some nuts on the plate as a garnish supplied that needed crunch that would have been missing~
    This is a casual spot with seating in & outdoors both are lovely ~ However I will warn you it is loud so IF your looking for quiet, this is NOT a good choice especially after 5 when the bar is filling up. Conversation at our table for lunch was fine as it was sparsely full.

Went there for the first time on a beautiful Monday evening.  The location was fairly easy to find, especially given I had never been there before.  It was busy, but not jam packed, and the atmosphere was slightly upscale, yet relaxing.  I didn't feel out of place walking into the restaurant, and my party and I only had to wait about five minutes at the bar before being seated outside.

The patio was a great place to sit and talk, while noshing on some apps and drinking some specialty beers.  Their selection of beers was plenty fine for my liking and both the hostess that sat us and the server who waited on us were kind and attentive.  My only qualm was that the food we ordered seemed a little sub par for the price point paid.  I have no issue spending money on good food, it's one of the indulgences that's completely worth it.  But the Tuna lacked flavor, and the calamari seemed a touch overdone.  

Still though, as I only had appetizers there, I would be more than willing to go back once again and give some of the entrees a try and see how they do there.  It was a fun little place, and it was just the right combination of fun and classy in my book.

I was pretty disappointed yesterday because I have been in the past and have had some amazing experiences. I poured a whole bottle of wine, and every single glass of water, and waited and waited and waited. Short staffed? Probably, but that's not really the proper solution to deal with what I delt with over 2 hours. But Ill cut them a break because the food is always amazing hahaha! You have to stop by here and have the Chorizo mac and cheese is out of this world!

I've heard a lot of great things about Public School 702, and I have to say they did not disappoint. The venue itself has a wonderful theme. There's memorabilia all over the restaurant from generations of different schools. The bar area is reminiscent of a gymnasium with bleachers and a scoreboard. There's also shuffleboard, beer pong, and extremely large Jenga. Right off the bat, I was impressed.

We were greeted promptly by our server, Jared Smith. He gave us a tour of the menu and went over the craft beer list. There are about 40 of them! He recommended the crushed velvet for me, as I'm not much of a beer drinker, and the tenaya brown for my husband, who is. The crushed velvet was delicious! It's like a blackberry Moscow mule. Next we ordered the mezze plate and the crispy cauliflower, based on Jared's recommendations, and both were delicious.

For dinner I ordered the salmon with succotash and my husband had the fried chicken and waffles, also Jared's recommendations. The salmon was fresh and paired delightfully with the succotash. The combination of the crushed velvet and the salmon was so good I had to order another one. My husband raved about his dish so of course I tried it, and yes it was delicious. A bit too many calories for me, but if that's no concern to you (and it's not too my husband), then this is the dish for you!

All in all it was a great experience and the bill was extremely reasonable. The atmosphere is light and fun, and the food and beverage are delightful. I was very impressed with Jared and his recommendations. We loved everything he picked, and he made the experience even more enjoyable. Public school - we will definitely be back!
The decor and service are awesome. Went during brunch. $4 for draught beers. Got a smothered burrito. Looks fancy and not that much but its tasty and filling. Solid.

I am really not a fan of this place and have given it three tries because all the reviews seem to love it. Let me tell you, it is overhyped. The beer is okay at best, and the food is really mediocre. I couldn't find anything that looked good to me on the menu, and the food took so long to come. I would say not to come here for the food. The ambiance is pretty and because the drinks are okay I could understand why people patronize this place. But for those who just want to come for the food, dont waste your time.
Kristina very nice bartender makes great cocktails  trendy spot open floor plan creates great open ambience and I love the pizza!

This place looks like a classroom/cafeteria. The host recommended deep fried cauliflower, it was delicious! I had appetizers only and a cider. The waitress was equally nice and talkative when asked questions about the menu. Most of the employees were very friendly and smiled when talked to. 

I plan on coming back to visit again. This seems like a good place to have drinks and hangout with some friends. This place would have five stars but there's was something missing from my visit. Maybe I should of tried dessert?

Atmosphere is alright. Food is so-so. However the buffalo cauliflower is super good!! Drinks are good. They only have a select few beers and they are all craft. Service is pretty good. Probably wouldn't come back, nothing will make you want to choose this place over the other bajillion bars and amazing places to eat in Vegas.

I am sad to report that my second visit was not as amazing as my first. I really hope this was just an off night at Public School 702, because I really love the ambiance and live music on weekend nights. 

I was feeling like pasta with a meaty red sauce, so I ordered the bolognese. But it had a very strange flavor and atypical meat sauce. I think the only reason I ate it without complaint was due to the utter mortifying food experience and all around bad day my friend was having.

The chef made things right though by making me an off the menu light salad. The poached pears with mixed greens and prosciutto salad topped with candied pecans and goat cheese was really really good!! I would come back just to have this salad.

For dessert, I had the lemon meringue with a graham cracker bottom. The dessert looked absolutely scrumptious. The meringue was super good, but the lemon custard was way too sweet for my palate. I had to cut the sweetness between sips of my dark roast and otherwise bitter coffee.

The restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly. Because my two experiences were very different from one another, I am sure I will come for another visit in the near future.

Went here for dinner on a Saturday evening. They got us in pretty quick (we didn't make reservation) I understand that it's called "public school"  tables and chairs were probably more uncomfortable than actual public school. Not a fan of cold hard metal chairs. It was really loud too. Having said that, food was really awesome. Their buffalo cauliflower bites are really good. Beer selection is good too. It's pricy for the very ok ambiance. $9 for kids meal is steep. They were out of Root beer. Wine by the glass is pricy, starts at $9.. they are out of Pinot Grigio. Looks like they were out of a lot of things. Our server Melissa was terrible, rude and slow.

OMG they introduced a new entree to the brunch menu. Pecan crusted french toast it is indescribable. Not to sweet, but the grilled peach with a sweet cheese is amazing to finish the plate. I love how the chefs use their creative  imagination and in depth palate to make such a dish. Two thumbs up!! I am looking forward to the winter menu. Matt was our waiter and he made the brunch a blast. He was attentive, on the ball with everything we needed. He really enjoys his job and his new home in Las Vegas.

What can I say about PS702? We always have a great time here! From the food to the drinks to the service.... It's always on point! I especially love brunch... What's not to like about an eggs Benedict pizza or stuffed French toast? And they always have the best selection of craft beers! Every time I'm there, there is something new to taste! And most times I'm educated (see what I did there? Lol) on a new beer I haven't even heard of. Also a fun night out with the live music! Last time I was in, one of the performers was from the Voice!!!! Do yourself a favor and check it out!!!! It won't disappoint!
The cocktails here are pretty good however the food is just blah. The staff is friendly and attentive. I wish they had a better happy but definitely would come back for drinks.

My wife and I came for brunch and was very happy we chose his place. The just about bottomless brunch beverages that you can mix and match are seriously on point. We decided to start with the calamari appetizer but told our server we are not fans of mayo based sauces. She told the chef and he sent out three different sauces with our calamari that all tasted amazing. Roos to the chef for being accommodating. I had the chicken sausage and grits and my wife had the roasted veggie and hash with tostadas and Adobe sauce. The grits were super creamy and the cheesy sauce and vegetables were a fantastic texture variance that made the dish so good. The roasted veggie hash had a great freshness and subtle earthy favors that were enchanted brilliantly with the Adobe sauce. We will most definitely be back.

I would have loved to try this place, however, we were seated last night for 20 minutes without so much as someone even telling us they'd be over to take our drink orders. We were completely ignored so we left

I love this place! Conner was an awesome bartender, he knows all of the brews like the back of his hand.  Brandon was pretty darn cool too. The bison burger was cooler than both of them. I'll be back!!

Service: walked in, and the hostess doesn't even greet us. We had to look through the crowd at the entrance to determine who it was. They had the hostess at the front, and looking straight down at her tablet for their seating. We had to approach her in order to initiate any kind of conversation.

Service after we sat down was ok. Just make sure to get order what you need when you see the server, it takes a minute for them to get to you.

Food: I read a review below that indicated nothing really stood out. I agree with that review. Nothing really stood out, which is not necessarily bad, but also not good. Restaurants need a specific dish or two to stand out and make guests think, "I want to go there again!" 

Watermelon tomato appetizer was mediocre. I've been to places that were able to use a balsamic dressing to complement the sweetness of watermelons perfectly. Here, I believe they are trying to do too much with the dressing. The yellow tomato was kind of confusing. The first piece my girlfriend and I had were bland, the second piece on the bottom had more flavor. 

Charcuterie board was nothing really special. I would prefer to go down the street to hearthstone for a better selection.

Chicken and waffles was also missing something. Perhaps the thick cut bacon is what never does it for me. I'm more a crispy bacon kind of person. That bacon made the gravy really chunky, and not as appealing as it could have been. The corn bread waffle could have use an extra minute in the waffle iron. They serve the chicken on top of the waffle, and slightly covered in the gravy, and an extra side of that same gravy. I would recommend getting that gravy on the side so that your fried chicken doesn't get soggy.

This was our 3rd time eating here and our last.  1rst time was a decent experience, 2nd time awful experience and 3rd time a repeat of the 2nd.  

The last 2 times have been very consistent though.  Slow and indifferent wait staff, undercooked food, and frigid  ambient air.  Make sure to bring a Parka as management likes to keep the temp to the point that you can see your breath.  In addition, if you are so lucky to be placed at the tables with the uncomfortable aluminum chairs, you get that extra chill literally to the seat of your pants.  

Service has been very slow last 2 visits, even when they aren't busy and my impression is that this restaurant already has outgrew it's "new coolness", but for some reason continued to feel that they are special and thus not open to suggestions, My impression is upper management likely feel customers will continue to return no matter the experience and this feels to me very reminiscent of the restaurants of the 80s who felt big and bad, refused to change, and thus are nothing but a memory on the internet search pages under "top ten 80's chain restaurants that failed in the 80s" Nothing has changed between our 2nd and 3rd visits (spaced about 4 months apart) and that usually means nothing will.  

I unfortunately will not recommend The Public House to anyone who lives in or is visiting Vegas, as there are many better options with staff that care about you and do not act like they are the "in thing", and that you are lucky to be sitting there, as well as food that taste better with a better price.  The menu tries to be original in choices but comes off being bland and flavorless.  

I always give a place 3 chances and this one unfortunately will not get a 4th.  I estimate this place will not last beyond another 1-2 years.

Another great place for food. Enjoyed the setting - place looked good, and it was casual enough that I wasn't intimidated at all. The staff was also friendly and efficient. 
We got there while they were serving brunch on Saturday afternoon around 1PM, so I got to splurge on their Beermosa. Pretty yummy for my first beer cocktail. What else did we get... Umm...
Appetizers: Speck & Eggs and Chorizo Mac & Cheese. I, myself, definitely liked both. The boyfriend also had to admit that this was one of the best deviled eggs he's had for the hint of spice they add for flavor. 
Entree: House Pepperoni Pizza for the boyfriend, and a Crispy Chicken Sandwich for me. LOL. Boyfriend enjoyed the pizza, but he was peeved that I told him we'd be having spaghetti for dinner with my family... "I'm having Italian twice today?!" XD My sandwich was awesome! Chicken was cooked very well, and I appreciated the crunchy exterior for texture, plus it looked good. Real good... Also enjoyed their version of aioli sauce to the last drop. Oh! I also have to add that the ketchup has a small kick to it. I seriously thought my taste buds were outta whack until I had my boyfriend confirm it wasn't just me drinking too much. 
The cool part was the Banana Bread Pudding. Hehehe... Dessert ended the meal on a really good note. You have to ask your server about their dessert menu though 'cause it's verbally described to you.
Not including tip for everything we had, it came out to be around $63. Worth it...!
LOL. Now I know why my sister and brother-in-law keep coming out here without me.

If you're going to claim that you service brunch, serve more than just a few items.   Disappointed to get here and see only a handful of items.   No omelette, no pancakes, no fruit, no granola.    Curry chicken and waffles is great I'm sure - but you've gotta offer some basic brunch items.  I may or may not try this spot again for lunch or dinner.   Seemed like a nice place...just don't go for brunch.

Love the ambiance super cute. Doubt we will be back prices are super high for a hamburger $17 is crazy. Maybe if service was up to par it wouldn't have bothered me so much.  Food is good but overpriced.

Disappointing. We waited for 702 to open for a very long time after trying the public school in California first and absolutely falling inlove with it. Let me start this review by saying we really tried to love this place. We have gone at least 10 times ( all for the love of craft beer).

PROS: Atmosphere is very cool. And of course the #1 reason anyone should go there is for the rotating tap. The managers have tried to make our experiences a little better by sending out a few comped meals, very much appreciated but tasteless.

CONS: Food is nothing special. We have had everything on the happy hour menu +. The only thing worth eating our the chicken sausage, which they have been out of the last 3 times I tried to give this place another attempt. You get a very small portion of chicken sausage for too high of a price for happy hour. And they are only available on happy hour boo (thumbs down) Everything else on the menu is really really uneventful. 
Bartenders are not very knowledgeable about the beer which is just plain saddening. 

Let me share our brunch experience. The mimosas are a joke. If u want good bottomless mimosas I suggest Echo and Rig and DW Bistro. The mimosas at 702 come premixed for u, which is ridiculous I'm an adult and will choose how much champagne I would like in my mimosa thank you. When asked if we could have our OJ on the side the answer was no. When we went to order our waitress told us those particular items would not be ready to order for a 45 mins.. um excuse me? So we waited and 45 mins to put in on order and another 40 to get our food, which of course was tasteless. Brunch was a complete joke and the waitress wasn't anything special either. 

If we return it will be for beer only. That's all they got going for them. So sad.

I expected a lot more sincerely. I heard about this place a while ago and I thought I would drop in with my wife to try it out, we were both excited. 

The establishment itself was nice and clean. Off to a good start. The restrooms were clean also which was great! We were greeted and taken to a table. 

Our server was polite and had good customer service.

The food. My wife ordered steak fritz and it was not a good experience. Her steak was really rare, no flavor, and it was cold. She ordered a side of asparagus and it also had no flavor at all. 
I ordered a PB and J burger. I like to try new things so I decided to try it. It wasn't that great it was literally ok but it's something I wouldn't care to try again.

Other than the food, the staff was courteous and this place was clean of what we can see.

Was looking for a hip brunch spot in Summerlin to catch up with a friend.
Menu looked pretty hip-ster, so we thought to give it a try.
Food was 3.5
They have a combo of multiple bottomless cocktails - thought that was cool.
The bloody mary was disgusting - it was 90% pepper, 9% vodka, 1% tomato juice
Thankfully my friendly waitress noticed that I was not into it and swapped me with a mimosa
This place is huge and there was no wait for early morning brunch
Patio was closed, but it looks like a cool place to grab drinks in the evening

Literally just walked out- we came in for a late lunch with my aunt, Wife and baby. My wife had to change our sons diaper and went into the women's restroom to use the changing station. According to the very incompetent girls up front there was a puddle in that specific stall and they refused to unlock it or clean it so that my wife could use it. When my wife politely requested that they open it they refused again. When my wife asked for another location to change our sons diaper we were told "about a block that way."

We have eaten here before and the food is decent but the service has always been mediocre. This sealed it. Won't be back and will make sure our friends with families know how this place accommodates parents with babies. Suggestion, get a staff that actually cares and knows how to unlock a stupid door or wipe up a puddle.

Ate some shrimp and grits here last night.  WOW.  Pretty dang good.  Service was incredible.  Upon arriving I told them I was trying to catch a movie at the Regal close by in the next 45 minutes.  They happily catered to my crazy schedule and I was out of there with time to spare!

I was bummed about our experience, especially since I've had coworkers talk about this place. The two hostesses looked and acted like we were bothering them when we walked in. Took our server 5 min to come get our drink order, even though he was standing 2 feet away, chatting with the other servers the whole time. Plus, the restaurant wasn't very busy. (Management should probably send people home when you have a group of 5 or so standing by the bar chatting the whole time we were there.) I'd probably go back to try some other dishes cause the food was good, but rude employees really deter me from returning to a place.
Cool menu, great service, wine and vibe.  Easy and laid back place to chill for lunch or dinner!

Really cute theme. I love the atmosphere very upbeat.  Beer options in the abundance. I on the other hand only found two out of the four times being there that I liked.  Food is good and service excellent.  Located upstairs in downtown summerlin mall very close to main entrance with vallet parking.

It truly hurts me to say this...the excellent food and drinks did not make up for the absolutely pitiful service our group of four received.  It was 40 minutes before we were served our first round, plus another 40 minutes for the second round.  I should also mention when I asked our waitress what their house red wine was, she replied "chardonnay."  That should have been my exit move.

Two additional confused servers tried to give us other people's food (which looked amazing, BTW). 

When I very politely and discreetly inquired as to the receipt of our drinks, our server, who shall remain nameless, blamed me for coming in for happy hour.  Ouch.

The decor and ambiance of the restaurant was excellent, inviting and a place to relax.  The food selection doesn't seem like there are many options, but as you read through the menu there are actually quite a few.  Had the bison burger with the kale & brussels slaw.  The quality of the food combined with the taste was superb!  Pricing is very reasonable and not over priced.  Service and friendliness of staff was great!

Went for my birthday, ordered cauliflower and poke for starter. Both were fantastic. Had the moody burger and pbj burger, ordered mid rare and it came out mid well. Luckily our server  celine sprang to action and gave us a free dessert and birthday shot. She was great and very friendly. They made a mistake and then made it right. Never had a bad meal here and will definitely come back

Cabbed in from the strip with a couple of friends.   Well worth the fare.  The beer selection was phenomenal as was the cuisine.  The servers answered our questions and took care of every need quickly.  We had 4 appetizers and 3 dinners, all prepared to order and presented quickly.   One of the best places we've been to in the Vegas area.  Another plus is the proximity to Bear's Best Las Vegas.  Thanks Kyle and staff.

First visit and WILL come back! Excellent service by Sean!  Loved the calamari, steak salad and fish and chips. My friend thought his fish was the same as he'd eaten at Remedys but cooked more well done (a good thing). 2 jungle juices later and still sober so just a heads up-don't order for the tingling feeling, just order cuz it tastes good!

I like the idea of this place. The atmosphere is great and the food is good; really good. They have a great selection of beer on tap, some locally brewed. As well as a unique selection of whisky and spirit. 

The staff can use some improvement and some training in hospitality. In general they are okay.

Why two stars? It's because of what I saw at the bar. A patron ordered a drink that required a large ice cube. These cubes are made by hand in a silicone tray. They are removed by hand; literally. 

I watched the bartender use his unwashed fingers to place the cube in a glass and then prepare the drink. What's more is he handled other people's dirty glassware and not from the stems. At no time did I see him wash is hands. In fact he was moving glassware from the rinse sinks to the dishwasher, then handling tickets, food plates and drinks without washing in between. It's disgusting! 

It might be time to call the health department.

PS - Their service is slow.

If I could give zero stars I would. Terrible terrible service. If you're sitting outside they want you to order at the bar...but then they have no clue who ordered what. The manager came out and said "what do you want me to do, the kitchen is backed up."  Super awesome public school! Never again.

Definetly a good spot i woudl come back to. They have a great deal if you sign up with them you get a free app. So i definetly did that. Also the Calamari was very tender and tasty. The portions were perfect and the service was great. Everything i asked for they had. Even the baseball game. So yeah... i'll be back here again. That "Hot Mess" is the bomb. Hahahhaa

There's always time for recess!

Came here with a friend during happy hour and was not disappointed! 
The decor is nice, I like the school theme and their menus look like composite notebooks. It's a nice theme without being tacky.

Drinks are reasonably priced and they have a great selection of brews. 
The food was great, but I wish they had more options. My friend and I shared the chorizo mac n cheese, margherita pizza, parm truffle fries, and the mini cheeseburgers. 

Overall, the food was good, wasn't a big fan of the mini cheeseburgers, nothing wrong with it, it was just a little bland, I would've preferred to have gotten something else. The pizza was great, fries were crispy and well-seasoned, and the mac n cheese was delicious!

Our server was great, she was very friendly and helpful in helping us pick some items. I would come back again though!

First let me say that the service is fantastic.  We had a party of 6. Emily B. Was our server.  She kept a great eye on our table and her food choices were just as good.   I will go back just to sit in her section and try other choices.    Outstanding service!

We also met Jason.   Wow!!! Amazing dishes.   We plan on going back Sunday!   Thank you so much for a great evening!!!!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED***

Weekend brunches here are great.  I love the location and is friendly for the whole family.  The outside patio is open and has oversized games like Jenga and Connect Four to play.  Great drink menu and food as well!
Great place. A little loud on Friday night but feels like a great dining/social spot. Appetizers and waitress were very good and timely. Bison burger was good, not so much the Jidori chicken.

My friend and I came in on a Friday for lunch. Not too many people in the restaurant. We opted to sit outside since it was a nice day. The service was the absolute worst. If you have plenty of time to spare I'd recommend this place otherwise don't waste your time.

I had a great dinner here the other night! It was such a cool and fun atmosphere - and the food was amazing. Lots of variety and options for everyone and everything delivered well! Our waiter was Zoe and he was great! Very nice and gave us on point recommendations since it was our first visit. He was friendly and attentive. Loved it! Will definitely be back and will sit in his section! Great time.

Ugh.  Food was pretty good.  Ahi Poke bowl and Taro chips were very good.  Beer selection was decent but they poured my wife a beer in a glass with a very dark smudge that she didn't see until a few drinks in.  So they bought the first round.  Fine.  Ordered the Hot Mess and the Bison Burger both with fries.  Server made sure to ask if medium was okay on the Bison and I agreed.  It came well, but was still okay.  The place is big and they were not on a wait.  Our server was nice, but very busy apparently.  It started to get weird waiting for my next beer order to be taken and waiting maybe 15-20 mins with just my water.  Then we sat longer with empty plates and waited way long for a check that was promised twice during the wait.  Not sure the food outweighed the experience.

Another welcome addition to Downtown Summerlin, recently opened a couple of weeks ago, they sure got it together pretty quick. It is a huge restaurant and has a very large outdoor area with booths and even ceiling fans as well as beer pong, it appeared. I didn't go outside because it is an oven here in Vegas. I was shocked that people sit outside and eat, there were like 5 tables of people when I went sitting outside. Go for it, if that is your thing. 

We sat in the bar area which I felt was pretty spacious but it filled up quick. My friends arrived at 3:30 when it first started and said a couple tables were available. When I arrived around 4, the place was filling up quick. I think we left around 5:30 and I saw a wait, about 6-10 people outside. If possible, I suggest coming early to reserve a spot for happy hour "recess." This restaurant is really cute on the details without going overboard on the school theme, but if you look close you will see flashcards above the bar and all kinds of little fun cool details everywhere. I am a teacher, so I don't need to be reminded of school please, but for me the decorations were cool not annoying or cheesy. 

We ordered:

Crispy Cauliflower-served with buffalo sauce and bleu cheese  sooo good!

Farro and Brussel Sprouts Salad-delicious!!

Dip Duo- not so great, The bread was not crispy nor soft, it seemed old and had a strange feeling to it, dips were just ok, nothing special 

Speck & Eggs- I enjoyed this. It was salty but good. 

Crispy Naked Wings- I am not a big fan of wings, but these were really good. 

Crispy Ahi Tuna Tacos-I enjoyed these too!

Parmesan Truffle Fries- I have to say I have been unable to find a place that does truffle fries just how I want it. To me, these were just right! Loved the lemon aioli dipping sauce on the side

My hubby had beers and he did not complain. I wish they had some girly cocktails on their happy hour menu, not just well drinks. That is kind of boring. 

Service was good, plenty of workers everywhere, and I am happy we have a new good restaurant to go to, especially with such a good happy hour.

food was good ... service was terrible to say the least. bartender totally distracted and not interested out server talked way too much about his life story...we had sirancha tator tots...yummy but the poor service dominated the evening
The food is affordable, fresh and most importantly delicious!! Love it here and I love the outdoor giant games!

The costs are definitely a few dollars more than normal but the food and drinks are pretty good. Normally I would probably like to see a $5-8 beer and a $7-10 cocktail, so if you're looking for that be prepared to pay a couple extra each. We took a seat at the bar as we were told it be a few min to get a seat outside on the patio even with a bunch of open seats. A little odd but it is what it is. I always like a good patio on a beautiful day but it's nice when it isn't in the desert. Had the sangria, the mezcal drink and a beer. All great options. The cauliflower appetizer and the poke appetizer were both nice little snacks with a bunch of flavor. All in all I was impressed with the options and offerings, not to mention the giant Jenga, connect four and beer pong tables, but just be prepared to spend extra cash if it isn't happy hour.

Fun atmosphere and interesting spins on some traditional food.

This space is a lot of fun and themed! Who doesn't enjoy a fun back to school moment? 
There's books, note pads, globes and so many fun decorations. The noise level is really loud so I wouldn't recommend coming here for romance or good conversation. 

We ordered some liquor and the jungle juice got me a mild buzz, thanks bartender! I love it when you can't taste it but you can definitely feel it!

We decided on their take of deviled eggs which had a kick to them. I prefer good ol traditional ones which I can't seem to find anywhere I go. Next came the margarita pizza which again had a kick & again I prefer a traditional approach. I have to comment on the nicely done thin & crispy crust which I really enjoyed. And now we get to the charcuterie board...pretty damn great! Cheese with crackers or bread and jam or honey is my thing! I can't help myself and they offered a really nice balance of mild, sweet & savory items and I enjoyed them all. 

Our waitress was awesome tonight and overall we had a good time. I'm very interested in going back & trying more items. 

Note - they have a very large outdoor patio area but we couldn't do it tonight because it feels like hell outside.

The beer is good. The food is ok. I went to have a drink with a friend. We sat in the bar and started playing table shuffleboard-again in the bar. Two little kids came over from the restaurant side and wanted to play. We told them no and that kids aren't allowed in the bet area. They came back again and we told them no again at which point they went back to their mother and said we were mean and she started yelling. At this point there are so many things wrong with this situation. First ITS A BAR! you shouldn't want your kids playing with "mean people" in bars or in a bar period. The worst part is that at no time did a manager come over or anyone to rectify the situation. One of the waitresses told the kids it was ok for them to play , the bartender said no an argument ensued with no manager in sight and no offer to make things right. What the hell? If you want to drink and relax like an adult go somewhere else

I am giving this place 3 stars just because some of my friends suggested it and it would seem like a disgrace to give them any less. 
Let me just start by saying that this was my first time here and the expectations were set really high. My friends and I went here on a Saturday for brunch. The place wasn't busy at all. I ordered breakfast burrito which was meh (2/5). It had no taste but I ate it anyway because I didn't want to be THAT person. (Btw I ended up taking half it it to go and it tasted way better cold). 
We also ordered bottomless drinks. BE WARNED - drinks are not bottomless. You can mix and match from mimosa, Bloody Mary and beermosa but you only get 4 drinks total for $15. It wouldn't have been a big deal but we called before we went here and asked about the price for bottomless drinks and it was not mentioned that they are "almost bottomless". 
It left us disappointed and we will not be returning.

We have been back several more times and each time it only gets better! The food, the service, everything! We decided to try their brunch today and it was awesome! Derrick was our server and he was great. We knew from the moment that he introduced himself that we were in good hands. The chicken sausage grits were great!! We will definitely be back!

I've been to public school a few times. Every time I'm quite impressed by the bar.  The beer program is great And seems to be getting better.  Lots of great rotating taps, and bottles for beer lovers like me.  

The food is decent.  Honestly the best thing I've had was the hummus.  It's clearly been perfected,  and the flat bead you get with it is perfectly crisp on the outside and fluffy on the inside,  like a light wood fired pizza crust.  

The service could use a little fine tuning.  Whenever I go,  I always feel like I'm walking into a place that I wasn't invited to,  where everyone  (aka the staff) all know each other and don't really want to add a new person to their friend group.  When the bartenders aren't distracted by the other staff members in personal conversations,  they have always been attentive and friendly.

Decor is fun. Menu is just okay, nothing I have to be back for. I had the Buffalo Cauliflower, it was a bit heavy to be honest, too much breading. Then I had the Bison burger, it was bland but juicy, their fries however were crazy salty and the drinks were disappointing. Their banana pudding was not bad but I enjoyed the whip cream more than the actual pudding. I'm glad I tried this place but I probably won't be back any time soon. 

They also didn't have the guava beer my date wanted or ranch. What restaurant doesn't have ranch?
Great place! Great food! Great Service! My favorites are the appetizers. Meats, cheese, bacon tater tots! Steak salad with truffle vinaigrette! Delicious!

Great atmosphere,  beautiful restauant, we sat on the patio and will definitely request that for the future. Inside was loud and full of energy... not my style but fun for some. The beer was great and the food was flavorful and delicious, my husband particularly enjoyed the stuffed poblano pepper.  We went on a Friday night and the place was packed, i reccind making a reservation. Despite being very busy, our server Brad was awesome and very attentive. Overall great experience.

Im shocked at the reviews Public School has. I really enjoyed this place. The server we had was super friendly and VERY knowledgeable about the menu. We had 1 person in our party with certain allergies and she suggested a few options that would work for her. What she didn't know she found out quickly and brought the info back right away. For appetizer we had the ahi poke tuna which came with taro chips. The chips were so good but I wish there were a few more. The poke was fresh and sweet. Super tasty. I ordered the bbq bison burger and I ate it all. The sauce wasn't over powering so you could still taste the lean meat and the char on the burger. I am giving Public School an A+!

This is a cool bar, they have decent service and good drinks - but they are a bit expensive.... I give it 3 stars since the service and drinks were good. I'd come earlier before they get too busy and also they may have a happy hour =)

We were in downtown Summerlin looking for an informal inexpensive place to have dinner. We came across Public School 702 and felt that it would fit the bill. 
Ambience: this is one huge restaurant. When you walk in, on the right is a fairly good-size bar. To the left has to be one of the biggest restaurants I've seen in a very long time. The noise level is quite High. If you find that kind of buzz to be high-energy and invigorating, eating indoors would be right for you. I don't. Fortunately it was a lovely night and we chose to eat on the patio. The patio is also huge. And it is very nicely laid out with many booths and several couches.
Service: our server, Brandon, was at our table almost immediately after we sat down. A winning smile and a really Pleasant  attitude . Made us feel very comfortable immediately . We got there just two to three minutes before happy hour ended. He was able to rush our order in so that we made it under the wire. He also made a couple of recommendations. Overall, very high points for service.
Food: we started the meal with white bean hummus. A small appetizer size portion on the happy hour menu for just $4. Absolutely delicious and just the right size to start the meal. My wife ordered the happy hour sliders. 3 small hamburgers cooked to perfection. She found them to be delicious. I had the Margarita Pizza. This was just ok.
Value: outstanding Ambience on the patio ( would not have wanted to eat indoors due to the noise level) and excellent service with satisfying food at happy hour prices. Very good value - dinner for two for about 25 bucks

Super fun atmosphere (I'm a teacher, so I geeked out over all the teacher stuff.)  Food is great, with some fun, unique choices.    Nice variety of draft beer.  But the 5 stars are because of outstanding bartender/server..DREW.   He was friendly, very knowledgeable about beers/wine and led us to some fantastic drinks, by offering samples..and explaining each of them.  A great place to bring people who are visiting.

I'll be honest the food is a bit pretentious for me and not really my style. But I love the venue and the ambiance. It's a great place to grab a drink with friends and relax on the weekends. Or even during the week!

Traveled all across town to try this place! The atmosphere is very cute and well put together. Makes u feel like you are back in high school.  From the science room all the way to the locker rooms! 
Service was good and food was great...a little over priced though but all in all it was a good time.
This place was really good. If you go, get the fried cauliflower, I crave it everyday!  We just had to wait a long time for a table, but it was still a great experience.

Went with a group for happy hour last night.   The food was great!  The drinks were great. If not slightly overpriced if you don't get something on the happy hour menu. The service left a bit to be desired, once the food came out we were checked on once. Our plates sat empty in front of use for at least 10 minutes and to get the check felt like an act of congress.

My husband and I came here after shopping in downtown Summerlin. I had heard a lot about it so we decided to try. We arrived just before happy hour ended, we had about a 15 min wait for an outside table on a weekday. The food was decent, we tried the margarita pizza, Mac and cheese, PB&J sliders and truffle fries.  The pizza was the best, but with a very soft crust, Mac and cheese was good but the chorizo had an off taste, truffle fries were soso and the sliders were just weird. The service was sub par, with smaller glasses I kinda feel like they should come back to check more often. I had my iced tea empty for over half the meal, the server was also MIA for quite a while, I don't know if he had tables inside toot was just inattentive. Lots of hype and I can't really see why.

This teacher loves recess... AKA, Happy Hour at PS702! I dig the school theme, which carries throughout the restaurant décor (math flashcards clipped up around the bar) and menu (shareable portions are in a section called "study group"). They're a theme restaurant without being tacky about it.

FARRO & BRUSSELS SPROUTS SALAD: surprisingly filling, this could be a late lunch. The sweet curry vinaigrette is interesting and there are a lot of contrasting textures.
CRISPY CAULIFLOWER: The breading is super-thin and slightly spicy, with buffalo and bleu dipping sauces, served in a mini cast iron skillet. One of the better versions I've had, not greasy!
PARM-TRUFFLE FRITES: You know you want them. They smell great, but let's get real, everyone has fancy fries these days, right? These come with a spicy ketchup and lemon aioli. Get 'em.
SPECK & EGGS: Another dish everyone has, with the PS touch adding crispy prosciutto and a kick of spice.  Nicely creamy filling.
CRISPY AHI TUNA TACOS: You can't go wrong with ahi. Tiny wonton shells filled with avocado and ahi, lightly dressed in ponzu. One of the lighter options, pairs well with the salad above.
PB&J SLIDERS: The dish I was most excited about and the only one I was underwhelmed by. Menu only states "blackberry habanero jam with smoked bacon" and for some reason my eyes interpreted the word "slider" as a mini sandwich, most likely heated, on a thick challa-style bread. It's actually 3 typical sliders (mini patty and bun) with the two condiments gracelessly smeared on. With less PB and more J, this might have been palatable but dry beef + sticky PB = Nope.

All of this, with a beer and tip, for ~$40 can easily feed three. Service was awesome when it was around, bar staff were constantly busy to the point of being overwhelmed. Our server apparently went home altogether, and after nearly half an hour of waiting around to close our tab, Kourtnie kindly took care of us. 

Not sure I'd come back outside of recess hours, but it's definitely fun. The food is approachable with some innovative twists rather than the standard safe staples I expected.

Went here for the first time on 10/30/15 at around 9pm with a few friends and I gotta say it was great. I liked the atmosphere. I wasnt to familiar with the beers they offered. So I asked Tyler ( shaved head, kinda built, tattoos... just in case theres another Tyler there ) our server, he asked what are my favorite beers. I told him him it was dos equis and blue moon. He said they dont offer mexican beers but they do serve a beer close to blue moon that was called hefenweizen. So thats what I got. I did like the beer and Tyler was great on choosing the suggestion. And he gave great service to us all. Thanks Tyler. I enjoyed my over all visit will visit again. Oh yea... the food was great too. I had the pepperoni pizza.
Food is not good at all and for some reason the atmosphere of the restaurant really off in my opinion . We tried twice to come here and I don't think I will go back again.

Lamb Shank was served cold & was also a bit on the tough side (maybe cook it slower?) Tasty though! They brought me a new one (a bit warmer) and also took it off my bill, so I'm happy!  The curry mashed potatoes are delicious. This place seems a good place for getting yer swerve on with friends & they have a kickin' happy hour & amazing looking bar food appetizers. Gonna have to try that sometime. Cheers!
