Great atmosphere, fantastic food...Lots of different appetizers like grilled watermelon stack which was delicious!  I ordered the lamb burger and loved it!  I just wish I could have a cup of decaf coffee!

This place used to be awesome , unfortunately they changed their menu (getting rid of a few great dishes) and increased their prices. Also the service has been lacking recently. This had been one of my favorite spots when they first opened but don't think I will be coming back anymore. Sorry Public School but school is out for this guy...

I've gone here for three years almost every Monday the menu gets changed up a lot but I always come back. If you like tuna I definitely recommend the tuna poke !! One of the bartenders is really great makes you feel really comfortable and is always positive
A shout out to Janelle, who took such good care of us during our great lunch today at PS 702.

Interesting place with an interesting theme. Decent service. I went on Saturday but the DJ there was absolute garbage and really misjudged the atmosphere of the place. None stop techno / drum and bass for an hour? No thanks. Public School just doesn't seem like the place for that. I would go back to Public School again but probably not on a Saturday. Apparently it's the same DJ every time.

I used to go to the public school in downtown Los Angeles many times since I've lived near it. The decor here is a lot better and more spacious. Happy hour has more of a variety and priced very well!  I wouldn't suggest bringing kids since it's more of a bar scene. Also when I went to visit it was more on the quiet side so no one was sitting in the main dining room.

Just had dinner here. Cool atmosphere and the outdoor seating is very nice and overlooks pretty trees and water and sh*t. Hostess was an airhead, had to get a waiter to actually seat us in a booth. Waiter was great though. I had the bison burger. Not bad but boring. Fiancé had short ribs and potatoes, boring. Ordered ahi tacos after and luckily they were good, more that it was a good concept, not that the quality was the greatest. We ordered a ginger aoli for dipping French fries and that was delicious except really could have added more ginger. Such a neat place, sad the food is mediocre. I'll skip this restaurant next time I'm in the downtown summerlin area again.

First time here today with a group of friends for Valentine's Brunch! The theme of Public School is so darn cute! From the blackboard/chalk writings on the walls, their composition menus, binder paper napkins, and more! Such a fun theme especially for adults, getting that feel of old school memories while drinking some beers from the bar. Anyway, great vibes. I especially love that after eating inside, our group went to their outside patio and played some beer pong, life size connect 4 and life size Jenga! We came in and stayed from 11am-4pm. 

Oh shoot I totally forgot to mention the food!!! Anyway, food was awesome! LOVED their chicken & waffles!! Gotta have that for brunch. Also great to share! My boyfriend got the stuffed French toast so we shared with each other. His order was a little too much on the sweeter side than I prefer, but it was still good! Our whole group also got bottomless mimosas - which carried us onto the outside patio for more drinks to come haha. 

~~~ in my update for my review I just wanted to give a shout out to the service my friends and I received today. Honestly I always feel so terrible whenever I go to restaurants with a large group. I understand how large groups could be difficult esp in a setting where drinks are involved.. well today Emilia was our waitress and the entire time, she was super happy, energetic and just really took care of us (keep in mind our group was about 23 people) even when things were getting complicated, esp at the end when we were handling the check and everyone wanted to split it, she never showed that she was bothered or stressed. I have never experienced that with a server while having a big group before, so thank you so much Emilia, you rock. Don't change! ~~

Got around to dropping in at Public School tonight after having been familiar with the dtla location (612). Casual ambiance and food; don't let the gastropub classifier deter you, this one is pretty family-friendly.

Ordered the Cutting Board and Fiery Calamari to start. The calamari couldn't quite live up to its name as the flavor of the shichimi was a bit shy, but otherwise, passably tasty. The Cutting Board had a fair selection of cured meats and cheeses (as well as Marcona almonds, caramelized onions, etc.) with toasts, large enough to share with 2 others.

For myself, I ordered the Huntsman burger, which was cooked to my liking and came with a generous thing of broccolini covered in an even more generous amount of padano.

The service was attentive even though the restaurant had started to fill up with the dinner crowd. No mark-ups for tardiness since the food arrived at the table in a timely manner.

Public school is a great spot. Are usually stay at the red rock just around the corner, so I make a point of coming by whenever I can. It's a little tricky to find, up the escalators in an outdoor shopping mall. But once you get in there, the food, the people, and the atmosphere are fantastic. They have a great selection of beer on tap, plenty of food options for all different types of nutritional needs, and the general good time! I came here on my birthday back in November, and they were so friendly to me! I've had both the burger as well as several of the appetizers, and all are very good.

Great location right by Red Rock Hotel where we were staying. Big restaurant with a fantastic patio. Bar was busy with lots of energy - nice looking crowd.  Our server was Mindy - Oustanding service, great personality and offered tastey suggestions.  Menu was fun with something for everyone - chicken want waffles- THAT GRAVY!!!!

2 stars because the Food wasn't horrible but the service was TERRIBLE! I sat near the bar area and there wasn't many people dining meaning it wasn't very busy. The waitress was kind of clueless. She didn't know much about the ingredients in the entrees. We had no silverware on the table before being seated so we had to ask her for some when our food first came out, but we had to remind her that we were still waiting for silverware the second time she came to drop off the other meals. I ordered a Drink & I could see the Bartender making it..... Then it just sat there- for like 10 mins...... And I can see all the other staff just standing near the bar, taking shots of Beer???!!!?? And the waitress finally bought it over. :-/ Management needs to up their team or train their young staff to be more professional. Probably don't plan on ever returning to this joint. It's too bad, the architecture of the place really fits the name which makes it a cool hang out.

Very cool spot, great for dinner or late night drinks/snacks. We got there shortly after 9pm on Saturday night and it was busy! We sat in a booth near the bar and there were outlets and USB outlets on the wall (every restaurant should have this!).

Ordered the crispy buffalo cauliflower, which is possibly the best vegetable I've ever eaten, and the bacon cheddar tots. In an attempt to be healthy, I got a tomato and watermelon stacked salad. It was just okay. My hubby got the steak, which came with chorizo mac and cheese. The mac and cheese was fantastic! Not too cheesy, not too greasy, and still very flavorful. 

I often feel like a 70 year trapped in a nearly 40 year old body, so it was a little noisy for my taste, but if we were there at 6:30 on a Wednesday night instead, I'm sure it would've been a slightly different experience. But overall great food and I'd definitely go back!

Met some friends up for brunch on a sunny Saturday morning. Since it was such a nice day out, we decided to dine outside. The outside has a few games which include giant size Connect Four and Jenga. The theme of the restaurant is cute. Their regular menu is designed to look like those composite notebooks and the brunch menu is a scantron(brings back memories doesn't it?). We all ordered bottomless mimosas...which turned out that meant you get a maximum of 5 (or maybe it was 6?) medium carafes. I guess it's good that they put a cap on how much you can have but should it really be called "bottomless" then? I mean, don't get me wrong, it's still plenty and I got a good buzz from all that we drank but still. However, a plus is that they have beermosa, michelada, and bloody mary and you can switch it up if you like. Anyways, on to the food!

Crispy buffalo cauliflower: lightly fried cauliflower that came with a side of buffalo and ranch sauce. I liked this one and would recommend. The cauliflower wasn't mushy at all. 

Chorizo mac and cheese: this was probably my favorite. It had a lot of flavor and I enjoy the pasta that they used. 

Fried chicken and green chili cornbread waffles: this one was just alright. I wasn't a fan of the texture of the cornbread waffle and the green chili sauce was forgettable. 

Fire roasted vegetable hash and eggs: this was my least favorite. It didn't have much flavor and was too bland for me. I felt like they literally put a whole can of black beans in there and that's just too much for me. 

Eggs Benedict pizza: this was pretty tasty. Prosciutto gave it a nice, salty flavor and the crust had a nice char to it. You can tell it was cooked in a brick oven. 

Stuffed French toast: this one was good! It was filled with different berries. I thought it would be really sweet by the way it looked but it wasn't! It had a nice sweet flavor without being overwhelming. 

Our waitress was great! She was knowledgeable on the menu and answered any questions that we had. She also did a great job of keeping our drinks full. 

Overall, I feel the food is just okay. I'm not in a huge hurry to come back anytime soon but glad I gave it a try.

Menu looks good, will be back for food. Pretty nice beer selection, we definitely enjoyed several. Server Michael did a great job describing and recommending based on our taste preferences, not easy as we're a pretty eclectic group. Happiness all around.

First time here tonight for Happy Hour with two other couples.  Our waitress, Jordann was super nice and very attentive.  Gave us all sample of beers with no hesitation.  Happy Hour menu was good.  The buffalo cauliflower is fantastic.  The margarita pizza, eh, just okay.  The beer selection was GREAT.  Ended up with a Brainless Belgian, high octane, smooth finish, really good.  Love finding new beers when we go out.  The place was dead.  It was a Tuesday, so might be the day?  But really surprised that no one was at the happy hour.  Huge place.  Big balcony, nicely done.  Prices were great for happy hour.  I would have to come back for dinner to give it another rating, but for happy hour - job well done.  Would be a great place for a private event.

Note: This review is for drinks only. (The mac 'n' cheese looked crazy good!) I sat at the bar during happy hour. There are some decent food deals. Some drinks specials, but never, of course, their best beer offerings. I paid $11 for a pint! While a good, unique beer, $11 was too too much. And it took over 10 mins for me to be approached by the bartender (though, to her credit, she seemed really busy). And it nearly as much time to get my check. Not cool. (But again, the bar was under-staffed.) The space itself it nice. The beer offerings are good. There are plenty of TVs to watch the game. There's a nice outdoor area. The food looked tasty. But the staff are...underwhelming and unattentive. No one greeted me upon entry or exit. I can't say I've ever had that happen before. But the sour apricot beer was excellent. Though, not sure it was $11 excellent.

Worst.
Service.
Imageable.
On two different occasions; tried to give them a redo and more of the same.  Just an overall lack of service.

I've been wanting to try this restaurant so I was happy when I was invited to Sunday brunch with a group of friends. When I first entered the restaurant it was a bit awkward. I stood at the hostess stand for about 30-45 seconds while three employees walked past but none of them acknowledged me. Luckily, my party wasn't seated too far away so I was able to spot them from the door. There were six of us and the server was great. Also, the seating was comfortable. I ordered the chicken waffles. I'm weird and don't like eggs so I passed on the fried egg that that the dish is served with. The chicken was good but the waffle was pretty dry. I wouldn't order it again. The almost bottomless drinks are a good deal - 4 for $10. I had mimosas and they were tasty.
The food was really good and our server Venessa  was wonderful and made our experience extra special!!!

Great bar, easy to get in and grab a seat. Server Kane was great. We were a little bummed they took the Chorizo Mac n Cheese off the menu, but the Pokè was awesome and the beer selection was great. Great outside area as well!

The patio is quite enjoyable with its oversized Jenga game that we played. I recommend the Speck and Eggs, the cheddar bacon tots and the huntsman burger. Like I said, everything I tasted was good!! The service was great, everyone was so friendly and the food was amazing! We ordered so many things and ate them before we could take photos! Haha.  We were a large party of about twenty and the accommodated us extremely well. So well, we even returned after our movie for another drink!

Great atmosphere. Good beer selection. On weekends they have bottomless Mimosas. Ruth our server was fantastic constantly checking to see if we needed anything. Highly recommend going here if you are in the downtown Summerlin area. Get the cutting board, it is an excellent varied selection of meats/cheeses/etc.
Bangers and Mash is DELICIOUS ... But they need to hire servers who are more attentive and deliver food promptly!

Aurelia was a great server came here for happy hour to get some drinks and apps. Enjoyed company of an old good friend of mine. Aurelia helped us out from the moment we sat down. Gave us a rundown on how the menu is and gave us tips on some of the favorites. Our server was very knowledgeable on her beers and spirits. Definitely recommend this place great experience. Oh and also I believe in the weekends they have live music

Aurelia was amazing!! Very attentive and sociable!! I would request her to always be my server when you come here. Food was also amazing and great atmosphere! Seriously can't say enough positive comments about Aurelia!! She has a new regular!

I found the food (buffalo cauliflower, edamame hummus, and Brussels sprouts) to be too salty and oily. I've had buffalo cauliflower at other restaurants, where it was fried but still light; that was not the case here. The dish was also overly salty. The edamame hummus was also terribly salty but had no other flavors; if it had tahini, it was completely overpowered by salt. The flatbread that came with it was okay, but the za'atar on it was too strong. The Brussels sprouts were okay, but again too overpowered by oil. It was the kind of side dish that comes with about a dozen Brussels sprouts, but after three, your palate is done. I was also surprised that two dishes that could be vegan-friendly actually aren't because the cheese is already incorporated. For example, the quinoa salad sounded great, but the feta is already mixed in with the quinoa, so getting the salad without feta can't be done.

We have been here a number of times since it opened and this time was the best. If it wasn't for the so so to bad service and food varying from great to barely edible on other trip I would have given 5 stars. This time the food was perfect, beer list was strong and nothing we tried to order was gone and our waitress Rachel was perfect. No complaints this time at all. You can also reach 2 poke stops and they have usb plugs at the table.

BFF dinner date: great spot in DTS, we sat on the outside balcony as the sun was setting. Great views. we had the ceviche and deviled eggs, which were perfect for 2 and the shrimp and chicken noodle salad to split. Everything was super fresh and just delicious. To top it off, our waitress Rachel was amazing: she knew the drink and food menu like no other and really helped us decide. The menu has so much variety! What a great experience.
Been here many times and tonight was the first time we've had excellent service. Mandi was the best!

This place has a pretty cool vibe. The food is delicious and they have a great drink selection. The only negative was their inability to seat our large party last time. They wouldn't open the outdoor area so we were all spread out inside the restaurant. Otherwise, I always enjoy coming out to this place.

Came for their Dogfish event. Was pleasantly surprised by all the varieties of craft beer they had, being a craft beer enthusiast I must say they have one of the best selections in town. Caught the tail end of happy hour and the food was AMAZING! Will definitely be back in.
Katie the server and Sheri are so fun! The food was great as always but they make the experience top notch!!! I will always ask for one of these 2 when I come in.

We went here with friends this past weekend and had a great time. Their beer selection is wonderful and their food was delicious. I had their bottomless beermosas...try it. You get 4 drinks for around $15 which in this area is an amazing deal. If you want to have a little fun in a great environment, try them.

A great evening celebrating my husband's birthday. The craft beer was delicious. Our server even brought us a sample if we couldn't decide between two beers. There was a wedding reception at the same time as our reservation and it did not impact the quality of our food or service whatsoever. We truly enjoy the atmosphere and food of this fine establishment. We will be back soon.

So I asked for a Stoli tonic. She looks at me with this weird puss and tells me no Stoli, and that the tonic is brown. It's like an old school bar - no soda guns, juices are squeezed from scratch, and the Coke's Mexican. Five stars right there for effort. I ordered the Margherita pizza. Not sure why, I suppose the woman next to me had one that looked amazing. Fresh basil, tomato,  yummy sauce and crust. Well done. We had such an ass next to us who changed his order, ordered a "lamburger" rare, then sent it back because it was rare... I almost kicked his ass for being a jerkoff, but jail ain't worth it. The decor is amazing. School references everywhere. Drinks are amazing. Service was fast and friendly. We'll definitely be back.

This restaurant was average. The decor is cool and they really take the theme to a new level. Our food was ok but under seasoned....I am a New Orleans girl :) There was nothing that really exceeded my expectation honestly I could have went to California Kitchen.

Great gastro food. And great service! Been here a few times. Large dining & selection of beers. Their menu changes on occasion. I've had the scallop salad which they no longer have. Recently I had the lamb burger- excellent. And the chicken salad which is pretty good but the chicken didn't seem like anything special, and I'm not sure if they even made that chicken in house. All together tasty and a great spot in Vegas/Summerlin!

I've decided to make it my mission to try all of the restaurants in Downtown Summerlin, and next on the list was Public School 702!

This restaurant was very cute and charming, with a schoolhouse theme throughout. It appeared that they were training new employees when we visited for lunch, as both the hostess and the servers were shadowing other employees. Everyone was cheerful and pleasant, and aside from the newbies asking a few questions of the more experienced, it didn't detract from the service at all.

We settled on an appetizer of the cheese and bacon tator tots. They were yummy! Deep fried tator tots, with bacon and cheese inside, served with sirracha ketchup- how can you go wrong? 

For my main course, I got the CCB, which was their version of a Cobb sandwich. It was a chicken patty, served with lettuce, avocado, bacon, and onion, with their own special sauce. It was yummy! I loved the bread too, although it didn't hold up too well by the end. Their fries were good, not great (thin fries), but again, that sirracha ketchup helped add a little kick.

My friend enjoyed his burger as well, but I didn't get to taste it. They have a vast selection of beers, if you are into the brews, and what looked like a really fun outdoor area.

Another Downtown Summerlin restaurant checked off the list! I wouldn't mind getting detention here, though!

1st visit was great, girl bartenders were cool. 2nd visit, sat at the bar and was just looked at by the male day bartender without a greet or acknowledgement. I just got up and left. Won't be going back anymore.

Had this place bookmarked and was excited to try it out with my sweetheart. We went right at the top of happy hour and sat at the bar. It was a Wednesday and we were easily able to choose our seats. By the time we left, I was glad we came early, because the bar and the restaurant were really filling up. Ladies, there's hooks to hang your purses at the bar. I swear bars always get points from me for this! 

I had the Mule kick for my cocktail...tasty but heavy on the ginger. For our food we ordered only from the happy hour menu which they call, Recess. 
The deviled eggs were sharp in their taste and yummy.  I will get those again. I'm not usually one for the tastes of fried food but the fried cauliflower was awesome. It was light and tasty-I'd get these again as well. We also got the hummus with quinoa; the flavor was on the light side with a healthier feel. I'd get these again. 

My favorite, which came by a complete surprise because I'm not the biggest fan of peanut butter, were the PB&j sidekicks. These mini burgers with a touch of peanut butter were so delightful that I'm having to rethink peanut butter again

Absolutely mind blowing and Amazing. Super fresh, everything made in house, service was A1. Beer was crafty and well priced happy hour was a hit. I recommend everyone try this place out.   Had the wings, fried cauliflower (on the house) the meatball and linguini also the Thai noodle salad. Everything was beyond was I was expecting.  Thanks PS702 ill be back

Located in The new shopping district of Summerlin...Public School 702 makes it's home in Downtown Summerlin. A very modern and hip restaurant at that, themed after school/education like atmosphere. Everything from their menus to decorations sets the place off right. This huge place located on the second floor also has an outdoor balcony area that almost rivals the inside seating of course depending on weather. This casual yet up beat restaurant provides quick and friendly service by their staff who are also dressed casual. Not quite sure, we came on a weekend and noticed a weekend menu...so there might be a separate weekday one as well. They also have happy hour which they call recess which plays to the theme. Menu choices were kinda small but quality and choices were there. It is a bar and grill brewery type of restaurant so expect the usual burgers and custom beers and alcohol. Choices of even Lamb and Bison burgers which were tender, juicy and mouthwatering delicious. Still Public School 702 is family and kid friendly & very refreshing. As casual as it is, it still gives you that classy feeling with fun elegance. Prices are average and maybe slightly a little more for casual dining...but service and ambience make up for it as well as the food. Definitely recommend this place, at least to try out once or twice if you are in the area or after a long day shopping in Downtown Summerlin.

Cool little spot in Downtown Summerlin. We went on a Friday around 7:00 to go play a game of beer pong outside. The outside sitting area is really chill and there were a ton of people having happy hour drinks. It took about 10 minutes to get a drink waiting at the bar. Bartenders just didn't seem to have any sense of urgency. Beer pong was fun, but you have to drink their house pilsner which is the worst. You have no option to change or upgrade/downgrade your beer. Because of that, we only played one game and high tailed it out to Red Rock for some gambling.

I just came here to have some drinks and those were for the most point pretty on point.  The bar and restaurant were very well designed and modern, the bartender was personable and seemed to know his stuff, and the waitresses were pretty.  What more could you want?  I wanted to try the food though so I will definitely be back at some point for that.  I just wish it wasn't so far away from me!

Went for happy hour, and our server Victoria was amazing! I'm usually used to servers kind of coasting during happy hour, which is understandable considering how busy it can be. But she was awesome. Great recommendations and attention to detail. Thanks Victoria!

I came in for brunch the other day and it was great! The service was quick and food tasted great, thank you Vanessa! My favorite was the eggs Benedict pizza. The atmosphere was bright, clean, and the public school theme was fun. We even planned to come back for brunch next week!

We ordered wild mushroom pizza, ahi tuna tacos and the cutting board which is charcuterie. Loved the pizza but it was too crispy for me. The tacos were amazing. The cutting board was nothing special. Because it being new, service was just okay. They're still learning. The outside terrace is amazing to hang and have a drink.

First time today and it went very well! Went around 230, wasn't busy, so we got seated quickly. Unfortunately we were too early for RECESS (love that)/happy hour.

Interior: very cute motif, loved the menu! 

Waiter: didn't catch his name but he had a ponytail and glasses, haha, but he was awesome! 
One thing though, although I LOVE the ketchup and sriracha dip that came with my food, he should have asked if I wanted regular ketchup or the ketchup & siracha, you know, just in case ppl wouldn't like the combination (but I mean... It's siracha! Jk... Maybe that's why he didn't ask..who'd reject such a thing!?) 

When I told him he should hook it up on more sauce, he did AND suggested a bbq mustard sauce that would go with my food but I thought it tasted better with my brother's pizza, but I appreciated his incentive.

Food: I got the Colorado Lamb Burger medium rare, omg. It melted in mouth. I thought it was delicious! Loved the savory from the lamb and the sweetness from the jam together. 

My brother got the pizza which I thought was okay. 

A friend got tortilla soup and sliders, didn't get to try the sliders but it looked dry and she said it was ok. I got a taste of the tortilla soup and the flavor was light where I've had tortilla soup blasting with flavors, I mean, it wasn't bad, but just not what I'm used to? 

Pro: They have dishes with kale, quino, and cauliflower, and other things if you're feeling something more healthier? I 'preciate that too :). 
+ they have a children's menu

Con: I kind of wish there were more selections for nonalcoholic drinks though, but I understand that it's more of a pub kind of thing, but I was craving strawberry lemonade or other fruity, carbonated drinks. I mean, since they do serve burgers, maybe shakes? Haha.

This has become one of our new favorite places. The menu is not to overwhelming but the choices are a nice change from the norm. "Recess" aka Happy Hour is great!  They have a decent amount of drinks and appetizers at really good prices. The large  patio looks over Downtown Summerlin and  the staff is always friendly!

I would like to get zero stars but that's not an option. I came for dinner with some friends. Literally...the worst service and food ever. The waitress kept forgetting our drinks, the food was cold and not cooked well, and we had to keep sending things back. For our troubles...we received a free dessert that was just okay. I definitely won't be coming back here for a while.
Chef Jeremy killed it! 10/10 fish and chips. Definitely would recommend Public School! Try the Cauliflower Buffalo appetizer
Andrew and "girl" Ryan are amazing ! Fun, friendly bartenders, GREAT FOOD! Soo many beers to pick from!  I love the "school" atmosphere. The prices are great!! One of our new favorite spots !

***edited***
Two years later, and I wouldn't go back EVER AGAIN.
Everything we ordered was wrong on our most recent trip. Service was AWFUL. We had to get our own silverware and napkins (asked several times for them and I finally gave up and got them myself). After my food finally came out, the second time, they brought half of my meal & it was still raw. We had to ask to speak to a manager THREE times. On the third time I started a timer to see how long it would take. It was almost 10 minutes before my friend just went and found her. I'll never go back***


2015:
Seriously impressed. We came in for Fathers Day as a last minute decision, and I'm very glad we did.
The service was rocky at first, but quickly turned a corner and I was very pleased.
We ordered the pancetta deviled eggs, a Bloody Mary and a draft beer to start. Everything was great. The Mary's are SPICY, so if that isn't your thing- be forewarned - I believe the spicier the better. It comes topped with a chicken wing (would have preferred bacon and olives or something else).
My husband ordered the adobo tacos with rice and I ordered the CCB with brown bag fries and sriracha ketchup. The first burger came out slightly raw. When I let the server know she was so wonderful and the manager came over and let us know how sorry he was. They sent out a new one and it was better than I expected. The sriracha ketchup had just the right amount of kick- I really liked it.
Even though we were stuffed, we saw a Lemon Meringue pass by and I couldn't help but order. I'm so glad I did. It is probably one of the best lemon meringues I've ever had.

All in all, I highly recommend this place, and I'll definitely check it out for Recess soon with my friends.

Came here for a friends birthday. Friendly service food was mediocre. Nothing really great about his spot. We ordered margarita pizza, Hummus dip & tuna tartar with taro chips those were all descent. The chicken soba Thai salad had no flavor at all how can you mess up a salad. Chicken Cesar salad was just ok & my husbands lamb burger was plain. We may give it another try during happy hour because it's located in DT summerlin

This is a very eclectic environment. If you want to reminisce regarding your middle school or high school environment while you dine on delicious food, this is the place for you :-)
Each dish varies in price and quantity. But I've tried nearly everything on the menu and the chefs there do a phenomenal job. Their beer and wine selection is pretty extensive so be prepared to Peruse. 
They have indoor and outdoor seating. The indoor seating can be very lively. The outdoor seating provides a wonderful vista of the shopping plaza and is a perfect getaway for a date night for a dinner with a group of friends. They do have some outdoor games like chess, checkers, and oversize Jenga. Overall a wonderful place to eat in the staff is always professional and provides top quality service... As well as some details from your childhood civics class that you still may not know the answer to.

An amazing theme to the restaurant. Highly recommend happy hour, really good good and amazing atmosphere. As for regular menu, prices are a little high but good selection. Only issues was the amount of salt in my fries that came with my burger. I thought it was only me, but apparently it was the same issue with those that ordered fries in my party as well.

I like it! The service was pretty good. The build out and space is awesome. Ambiance is a little loud but lively. If you like beer, their selection is pretty good too. Bathrooms were clean and overall it was a good experience. 

My only reservation was that although the food was good, it could've been better. I think the recipes lacked flavor, even though they were cooked well. Desert was just OK - you could tell it was store bought cake and ice cream. I had the deviled eggs and bison burger. Kale salad is good!

I'd definitely go there again and try more of their menu.

This place just opened a few months ago and I love it here!  They have really good food, especially for "bar food" and the night life is awesome too.  I totally would check this place out for dinner and drinks or just late night drinks!

Brussel sprouts and farro salad with scallops was on point. The lemon meringue was outstanding like I'll probably have dreams about it.  I loved my Crushed Velvet cocktail.  Overall a bomb outdoor patio. Fantastic service.  Cool vibe. I'll definitely be returning.
Expensive. Food was decent, kinda loud inside. I like the gimmicky decor - super cute.
Super fun place, the bomb hamburger, tons of beer on tap. Had a clueless, but very sweet, waiter.

Check out this spot! From the service, theme, food, drinks and culture this is a must visit. 

We arrived and were told it was going to be about 30 min but were sat in about 15. The hostess was friendly and even though she was talking to someone she was able to still look at us, smile and let us know she would be with us in a minute. Simple acknowledgement goes a very long way!

The menus were like black notebooks which immediately caught my eye and the beer list was typed on notebook paper. Very original.

Started with a vanilla, blueberry canned beer called the big blue van and surprisingly it was really good! They specialize in a lot of crafted beers so if you like beer I recommend this spot. Next we had the tuna nicoise salad and then the short ribs. The food was prompt and very good. 

Service was 5 stars. Even though we had one server many others touched out table to make sure we were ok or to check if we needed anything. I will be back for sure!

Side note: cool spot for group gatherings that have a oudoor patio area with its own bar AND.... A beer pong table!!! Lol

Went there for lunch today and the service is absolutely horrendous.  They were slow taking our order, slow bringing our food, slow bringing our check.  This is the 3rd time service has been slow but the worst part of it is that the servers kept propping the door open and it was cold outside with a breeze.  The customer across from us asked them to close the door.  It was closed for a minute until it was propped open again by another server.  After the 4th time the door was propped open I asked for a manager.  15 minutes later, he never came.  While we were addressing the issue, another customer walked up to the server at our table and asked for the door to be closed.  We explained our experience so she asked the server to point out the manager and she walked into the kitchen area to speak to him and he asked one of the same servers to shut the door.  Our server wrote on the receipt that the next time we come in, her manager who wasn't there would give us a free appetizer.  In other words, the manager on duty didn't care about the customers at all and didn't offer anything or take the time to come over and address the issue that all the customers in our area were complaining how cold it was.  At least the people outside had heaters.  Needless to say, I'm never going there again.

This review is for our bartender, Amanda who was knowledgable, prompt and super pleasant during a high-traffic shift. Thanks!

On a side note to the kitchen- slight foul. Foil mixed in to my burger - eep! Pulled it out and didn't make a fuss because that Colorado Lamb Burger was ridiculously good. Keep an eye on your stuff, fellas! No worries- we'll keep coming back. :-)

Great place! Love the decor and food. They executed the school theme well with the composition book menus and homework togo boxes. Very clever! I had the bison burger, and it was delicious ! The meat was tender and cooked to perfection! The side of fries were excellent as well and i really enjoyed the siracha ketchup. I also recommend their house pepperoni pizza. It has a thin, crunchy crust, and is topped with fresh jalapeños and incredible pepperoni. This is great place to come with friends, especially during "recess" AKA happy hour. Definitely will be returning to public school 702!

Food was okay. I had such high expectations since my husband raved about it. I will come back to try more things.  My favorite thing was the chorizo Mac and cheese minus the chorizo.  Chorizo pieces were too hard for my liking but the hubs said that's how it's supposed to be, that real chorizo.  Loved how it was topped with salt and vinegar potato chips. That way yummy. I kept going back for more! I had the short ribs which was very tender just not enough flavor for me. I needed salt. Nutella cookie was good but I prefer soft gooey cookies, this one was a little hard. My husband said you could ask them to warm it up. 

Next visit I do want to try the shrimp pasta, bison burger and lemon dessert :)

I did also find it strange that reservations over 6 need manager approval. I never got a callback to confirm. Luckily plans changed and it was just a party of four so I was able to reserve on line.  Service was good once we got there. Waitress was nice and helpful and apologetic when dessert took some time. Overall cool new spot, just have to find some favorite dishes.
Too crowded.  Not very good service from the servers and foods okay.  Love the atmosphere though.

While poking around Downtown Summerlin in search of a late-ish dinner, my husband and I stumbled upon Public School. The patio looked fun, and I love the kind of look and feel they were going for, so upstairs we went. 

We were seated immediately, which wasn't surprising as it was nearly 9pm, and the dining area and patio are both pretty expansive. Our server was friendly and let us know that it was their opening day. 

We were tempted by several of the appetizer choices, myself the the buffalo cauliflower, and my husband the bacon tots, but we exercised self control...mostly because a picture of their Nutella cookie popped up on the slide show at the bar, and my husband's eyes glazed over.

He decided on the shrimp and grits, and I went with the farro and brussels salad, subbing roasted chicken for the scallops. It took quite a while to get our food, but we understood it was opening day and there were still service and kitchen bugs to be smoothed out. Nearly 40 minutes after we ordered, our food arrived. 

He was very happy with his portion of shrimp, although the they were slightly overlooked. The grits...which were prepared like seared polenta, were tasty, and he liked the greens and grilled corn. 

My salad was excellent, the chicken was really flavorful, and that M word I hate, that rhymes with hoist, or joist. I love the texture of farro, and it was excellent combined with shaved brussel sprouts, butternut squash, pecans and dried cranberries. It was extremely filling. 

We shared the nutella cookie sandwich, which was two huge chocolate chip cookies, served warm, slathered in Nutella with vanilla ice cream sandwiched in between. By shared, I mean he let me have a couple bites without cracking my knuckles with his spoon. 

I deducted a star because even for an opening day, 40ish minutes was a an excessive time to wait for our meal, without any interaction from a server. We both agreed we wanted to try their brunch menu, and saw other things on the dinner menu we wanted to try. As long as they get their service issues ironed out, I see this place as being very successful, and a great addition to Downtown Summerlin.

This is such an easy go-to restaurant when you want to have a fancier meal. If you're terrible like me, bring your charger and ask to sit in a booth in the bar section. There are outlets. My favorite app is the crispy buffalo cauliflower, which I just can't quite imitate at home (though I try). The eggs benedict pizza is a good brunch choice, but the chicken sandwich (the brunch one) is friggin good, their normal burger is *elevated*, and I love their bangers and mash. I always try a drink, but I normally don't like alcoholic drinks that much, so I'm not a good guide there. I like that it's seasonal! 

The servers are so nice. One did Nevada trivia on our first time there with my boyfriend. Before that though, I went with a tinder date - and he ordered me a second glass of wine, but I was super uncomfortable, so I poured most of it down a drain on the patio when he went to the bathroom. The waitress saw, I explained to her that he was a creep, and then when he didn't pay for the wine that HE had ordered ME, the waitress took the second glass off my bill and drew a smiley face on it. So yeah. Good place.

My husband and I just went to this restaurant for lunch. It was absolutely phenomenal. We had some delicious beer and some amazing food. The red quinoa salad is amazing have a need to be a little more seasoned aggressively. We had the meatballs which were also a little spicy but very good and the Buffalo cauliflower and however I wish it would have been grilled instead of fried it was really tasty with a little blue cheese dressing in buffalo sauce. The breading was not heavy I just don't like fried food to much. I would recommend this restaurant for sure to my friends or anyone else who is looking for a good variety of foods.

They have a large beer menu. Some of the menu changes every week while the major beers are always available. I've been here 4 time now and I sit outside every time. Describing the outside seating area as humungous is an understatement. It just keeps going and going... 
Since public school 702 is on the second level u get a very nice view of downtown summerlin. It's also located at the prettiest spot next to the big water sculpture and cactus gardens. 
The view is cool but the jumbo sized games are the best reason to sit outside. They have a huge version of connect 4 and Jenga along with beer pong. 
On my last visit we tried the pbj burger sliders which were fairly good. The meat was a little drier than we liked but the bacon was good and peanut butter and jelly on a burger is better than it sounds.
Our waitress was fantastic.
Best food and drink in Summerlin! Great place to sit and meet new people. The Bartender, Scott and the Manager, Tommy are very friendly and provide great service. Highly recommended to all!

Chef Jeremy was fantastic! Special ordered the best fish tacos yet! Our server Courtney was very friendly and suggested her favorite cocktails for us as well as the buffalo cauliflower appetizer! Don't leave without trying it out!! Thanks public school!!
Ok drinks are excellent food is not a do over.  Service is below the norm. I like the concept however too many other great restaurants in the downtown summerlin area.

Mini Yelp gathering with some of my favorite yelpers in Vegas. Most of us was the first time dining at Public School 702. Including me never been but for the most part only heard great reviews! It one of many restaurant in Downtown Summerlin. Off topic say love love the fact Downtown Summerlin finally filling out all of the retail and restaurant spaces. I still remember first open walking around like is anything open. 

Back task at hand. So we had big party so got to see decent amount of food off the menu. No reason but good one for us. The kitchen cooked up extra appetizers so found home at our table. I got try the devil eggs, and bacon cheddar tots. Not sure if extra or someone on the table ordered it but Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower. The presentation not only for all "For The Table" or appetizers thought was well done. I like the incorporation of cutting boards. To the little cast iron servers for both the Tots and Cauliflower. I think both of them use the same breading cause looking the same. It nice golden brown outside, hot on inside, and fried goodness. The tots admit enjoyed the best out of the three. I enjoy the combination of bites of bacon and the cheddar all combine in one bite. The other two never ok but nothing special. The eggs really liked the presentation the most out of the three. 

My entree went with the Fried JIdori Chickem & Green Chili Cornbread Waffles. It been while since had Fried Chicken and Waffles. The last time was down south in Atlanta, GA. it was pretty darn good. Public School 702 took Fried Chicken and Waffles another level. The fried chicken not your normal wing and thigh pieces. I enjoy mixed it up then traditional. They incorporated chicken tender meat with the breast. Still have the wing/drumstick. One of the things that stood out for me once got the dish. The hot sauce had on top of the chicken but not completely soaked in it. The batter they use fan of BIG TIME. I love the crispy crust. It has ton of flavor and the meat inside on all the pieces was cooked perfection. The waffles adding green chili not just plain waffles. Yay! f could would order each one separate just double the amount. When put both together then throw some of the bacon sauce or whatever in side dish. Unreal delicious. Memorable. Hearty. No doubt heart attack. Once in while want indulge heavy not good for your health dish. This is the way to go. 

I wanted to try the sirachi ketchup/ mustard sauce with the brown bag of fries. The fries are just that fries. The sauces are devine. The honey mustard sauce that could use for spread on ANY sandwich. The sirachi one of my stable condiments and fan of. It was tasty. If want take fries another level make sure use both the sauces. 

Everyone else dishes on the table looking good. I got try the Truffle Mac and Cheese. I like it!!!! It had nice balance between the truffle and cheese. It came with the steak dish I believe. I know your can order for side. 

The staff is awesome. Our server she was amaZing. There was nine of us she on top of it. Explained everything for the first timers like myself. Made great suggestions on the menu. Friendly. I know lot of times big parties restaurant reluctant split checks. She said not problem at all. Think two or three appetizers lucked out got for free. Thank you Public School 702. I will be attending class again sooner then later............Good stuff!!!!

Decor: Very hip and modern, with the schoolhouse theme in mind. Scoreboards and globes straight out of geography class adorn the ceiling. There's even a ceiling made out basketball/volleyball court hanging above the bar. The place looks great for happy hour, especially with the NBA Finals going on. However...

Food and Service: I wish I had the opportunity to try some food. Hell, I wish I had the opportunity to even order food. My girlfriend and I sat down in the bar area tables during happy hour. We literally waited 15 minutes (I timed it) and not a single waiter or waitress stopped by and asked if we wanted water, drinks, food, etc. 

We walked out, with insult to injury added by the hostess telling us to "have a good day", seemingly unaware that we literally sat at the table staring at each other for 15 minutes.

I would absolutely love to come back, enjoy drinks and take in a sports event, but I shouldn't have to ask for service in the process.
The food, service and atmosphere was awesome! I loved the school theme and had a great vibe. I would recommend it!!

Went to Public School for the first time recently and had a really great experience. The public school theme was really cool. The menu was great. It had a lil something for everybody. The food we ordered was wonderful. Our server was extremely attentive. Our food came out super quickly. I ordered a guavalajara cocktail and it was one of the best cocktails I've ever had. My only criticism of the whole experience was that the bar took FOREVER to get our drinks to us. However, our server ended up comping a glass of wine to make up for the wait so I can't be too annoyed. I will definitely be going back and recommending to friends.

This isn't my favorite place in Downtown Summerlin to eat on the regular, but it is home to a pretty amazing happy hour. I also like the atmosphere here which is one of the best in Vegas for groups. I'd bet their long, raised wooden tables can fit ten people on each size. With eight or less you can easily talk to and see everyone. 

My partner and I had been dieting all week so we wnt a little overboard when we came by here last and tried the following:

PB&J Burger: too much P and not enough J for my liking. I fixed this by asking for a side of Jelly but I don't think I would do this again. 
Chorizo Mac & Cheese: Probably the best thing I have had here. I loved this!!
Bacon Cheddar Tots: YESSSS, finally cheddat tots that are actually tots and not just fried cheddar
Burger Bites: A regular burger, was good but not amazing
Margarita Pizza: Will do this again! Was good. 
Side of Fries: So unmemorable I don't even know what they were called. They has some kind of spices on them though and I ate them all. 

The only thing I recommend NOT on happy hour would be the velvet crush. It's like a raspberry Moscow Mule and it is delicious.

Me and my husband really liked this place. It has a nice vibe, we both were saying how it would be a nice place to bring out of town guest. The food we had was delicious too, I had the watermelon tomato stack salad, absolutely delicious and so refreshing for this Summer heat. My husband had the best tasting chicken and waffles made of cornbread and bits of fresh corn with the most flavorful gravy with bacon (just put the diet aside for this, Lol). We also shared the lemon meringue pie in a jar, yummy. My husband had a beer he really liked that had a fruit flavor to it and I had a watermelon mojo that was good too. Our food suggestions were, thanks to our awesome waitress Kaila, she was really helpful. I just love a well informed server when it's your first time at a new place (this is especially since my husband can take awhile to figure out what he wants, Lol!). So Kaila saved my tummy, she was so enthusiastic with her suggestions on the food my husband could make a quicker than usual decision. All I can say, is that you won't be disappointed if you stop by, and yes we'll be back.
Horrible experience. Service was extremely slow plus the food isn't good. Way too pricy for what they "offer."

After reading the reviews, I'm hoping we just caught them on a bad day. We got seated right away, server came by shortly. I didn't really understand her explanation of the menu or how the "rotation" choices worked but she did seem friendly. 
Our food cam out cold and the service was very slow. Took 15 minutes for drinks. It was 5pm and they were not that busy. 
There are many food options in Downtown Summerlin, we would probably choose to patron somewhere else next time.

Public school in Downtown Summerlin is a good place to go  have drinks and hang out with friends. It's also a great place to get brunch on a weekend. Their menu has different options compared to your traditional weekend hot spot. 

There food options are wide just to name a few :

Kale Ceasar salad 

Buffalo cauliflower 

The cutting board - meats cheeses and grapes 

Bangers n Mash - chicken herb sausages with Brussel bacon mash 

The Hotmess - turkey sandwich with au jus

Chicken & Quinoa Salad 

bison burger  the PB & J burger pizzas etc 

Drinks : There cocktails are constantly changing. They have a descent selection of craft beers as well. 

The bloodymary comes with a chicken wing ! Eat that right away before it soaks in your vodka. 

 I've never had a bad experience here regarding the service.

Great place. My friend and I walked in, sat at the bar and we were promptly taken care of by Bryan. He informed us of the happy hour specials, and made us delicious cocktails all night. He's a great mixologist. Great service at the bar.

Next time will try the food and outdoor fun.

My friend & I visited this place last night. Loved the patio. Great menu. Food was good. I have to agree with other reviewers, the bar service was extremely slow, over 15 minutes for a beer and a Bloody Mary!! Our server made up for that by including an order of the deviled eggs which were good. We will be back. Hopefully the bar will get their act together.

My wife and I tried this restaurant on the 4th of July, and couldn't wait to go back a couple days later. Finally Las Vegas has a great restaurant with great craft beers in a great location! The ahi tuna tacos are a must-have, and every entree we've tried has been perfect, from the andiron steak to the fish and chips to the short rib. It's not a greatly diverse menu, but that is refreshing. Everything they do, they do well. And a shout out to Jared, who took great care of us. I'm a Las Vegas hotel concierge so I've eaten everywhere...and this is my new favorite restaurant!

I have eaten cauliflower many ways but never have I ever tasted better fried cauliflower in my life!!! I can't wait to return for that alone!! The bison burger was extraordinaire! Juicy and beyond flavorful!! Every plate I saw looked like artwork!!

This place is really cool. Star deducted for inconsistency of customer service is all. The restaurant environment & decor is very nostalgic.

Tried the Earl of Juniper, just a  tad disappointed cuz I couldn't taste any lavender (which maybe was overpowered by the Earl Grey). Bacon Cheddar Tots were so good even though the app is small. The calamari was also good with the aioli & it was more generous in portion. Wild Mushroom & Taleggia pizza was delish. I usually get the Shorty Bowl (sooo fkn good!) but today I'm trying the BBQ Bison Burger & Fish/Chips with the bae.

Oh & there are games like giant Jenga, beer pong & Connect 4! That's always a plus & would make any dinner date less boring.

I'd still come back.
Amazing staff amazing food. The Buffalo Cauliflower was out this world. I Highly recommend and will definitely be back next time I visit Las Vegas.

Food was great.  The buffalo burger was delicious.  I would recommend golden monkey for the beer.  Service for drinks was a bit slow.  Hayley, our server, was the best though.  She was very attentive and make sure we were taken care of.

Love public school! I've been here over a handful of times for brunch and happy hour. They have a great selection for beer and food has always been good. My favorite is the buffalo cauliflower and veggie skillet for brunch. :) we usually sit at the bar and Ryan is always our server! She is great, sweet and very attentive! We have sat in the restaurant area  and I have to say the service has been a bit slow(just being honest) Sitting at the bar is our go to if we are lucky to get seats!

Fantastic craft beer and food destination!!!  Get off the strip and golf Bears Best then head there for the best food around!  Owner and staff are as phenomenal as the food.  Great prices, perfectly selected beer and wonderful atmosphere. Will go back any time I can!  Other reviewers..... Not sure what you're looking for or taking about, this place is perfect!

Good food
Service is a little slow
Sat on balcony, great views is downtown summerlin
Not happy they no longer have lemon meringue pie!

Went in for lunch. Their lunch menu is really scaled down, which is understandable. 
Had the Mac and cheese, which is one of the better recipes I've tried in town. Their fry sauces are one of a kind and delicious. Also tried one of their specialty lavender cocktails, which was delightful for the senses. My companion enjoyed his hot dog and complimented the beer selection. 
We sat for quite some time before our drink order was taken and it seemed they had a brief staff meeting as we were trying to get our check cashed, so my lack of one star on this rating pertains to speed of service. Luckily, we weren't on a time crunch, but if we were, I would not go back here for a quick lunch.

Went to Public School 702 the day after Christmas. A few friends and I went out for late dinner and were suggested to try the Chorizo Mac and Cheese and Shrimp and Grits. They were both phenomenal. The shrimp and grits is one of the most amazing dishes I've ever had. Perfectly cooked shrimp, amazing plating...kudos to the chef. I'll be back for more!

-Chris Chan

Ok so I've been dying to try this place and finally took my 16 and 18 year old kids with me for our family day outing (which we do on Sundays). We were not impressed with the menu....very cool decor and atmosphere. The beer was warm and our food was cold. Just awful. My son didn't even eat his food and luckily my daughter didn't see anything on the menu that sound good so she asked to just try my food. It was edible. Dry but edible. We ended up eating at the Italian place afterwards and it was great there! So bummed I didn't enjoy this place. Even our server was pretty blah. But oh well!

Service was very inattentive, late might food offerings were minimal and although excellent live music was far to loud. Hummus was fantastic, Burger was OK. Pizza technique was OK just really under seasoned. A little more time maybe, certainly has potential.

This place was very cool. I love the school theme, down to the Menu having a cover of a composition notebook, the napkins looking like lined paper, and the drinks on a clipboard. The bar area resembled cafeteria style seating too. The lighting was soft but brighter than most which made for great pics (at least at the bar seating). It was definitely packed. Their menu wasn't very extensive, but had unique items. Prices were reasonable. You could order appetizers for under $10. Speaking of appetizers, we ordered chicken wings, edamame hummus, buffalo cauliflower, bacon and cheddar tater tots. 

The cauliflower was SO GOOD!! I didn't know what to expect honestly. I thought it would be steamed cauliflower. But these were breaded and fried. Considering it is a veggie that can get very soft, they were actually very crunchy and flavorful! You couldn't tell there was cauliflower in there. And they gave you enough to share. It was my favorite thing there. 

The chicken wings were ok, I didn't have any but my family did. My family also LOVED the Bacon & Cheddar tots. I expected them to be smothered, but they weren't. They were literally tater tots with bacon and cheese inside. So good! I personally also loved the Edamame Hummus. My family liked it but not as much as the tots and cauliflower. But the hummus was my 2nd fave. The flatbread was grilled what seemed like on an open fire, because pieces of it were charred- which to me added to the flavor. I love charred pieces! I was very surprised at the hummus and bread, I would order it again for sure! 

My brother had their pizza, which we were not impressed with. I wouldn't order that but I'm glad I tried a slice. Something about their crust.....

But guys....I tried their PB&J Burger.....split it in quarters. Crunchy peanut butter with a blackberry habanero jam (house made). On a real piece of meat! I was scared! I love me some burgers so I was very skeptical....and sharing it helped ease my fears LOL! BUT it was actually very good!!! I feel like the jam could be spicier (wish it were) but maybe it would be too spicy for some and also, you can never tell how hot a pepper is until you taste it. Also, the jam was very runny- almost like a syrup. But overall I would order it again and NOT SHARE. 

Service was ok. The pizza came after we all finished eating- they must've forgotten? They served us our appetizers but didn't give us any plates or silverware- we had to ask for those. That's why I deducted 1 star. 

Overall, I would recommend this place and plan to go back!

Heard about the place, so we decided to try it out. We went in about 8 PM tonight.  Had to wait a few minutes for a table.  The lady that helped us was very nice.  Sadly she was the last staff member that spoke to us.  Sat at the table waiting to have someone stop by and maybe take our drink order but we never had a wait staff  member stop by.  Had several wait staff walk by but they never said a word or made eye contact with us.  They waited on the tables on both sides of us.  I can't recommend the place.  When asked I will let everyone know how bad our experience was.  Don't waste your time, we had dinner at another place close by and it was great.

Really cool concept for the whole restaurant. The decor, the white boards, and the menu made you feel like your were back in elementary school. I just wished the service and the food was better!

FOOD
Nothing really special here. We tried a number of the appetizers (the bacon cheddar tots, the buffalo cauliflower, and the calamari) along with a couple of drinks, but they were all pretty basic. The appetizers and the drinks were around $10 each. Nothing that I would rave about or come back for. The drinks were good and I did like the fact that they have a variety of beers on tap, but other than that I would not come back solely for the food.

SERVICE
This is the main reason why I am only giving them a 2 star rating. Our waiter didn't really seem like he knew what he was doing. He would take our orders and then come back to ask what they were again because he didn't write them down. When he had brought the water bottle to us, he also didn't pour any of it initially and when he saw our glass was empty, we were the ones to ask him to get another bottle of water instead of anticipating our needs. The other waiter delivering food passed us because she too was unsure where the food was to go. I felt like their system was clunky.

LOGISTICS
There's never really any issue for parking when we go here. There also wasn't a wait to get in, so that was good. They have USB/regular outlets where you can plug your phone in so that was cool.

This place isn't bad. It looks nice and modern, but the service is poor. The managers need to retrain the staff if anything. I wouldn't recommend others to go here. Try another place with better food and better service!
Fun atmosphere, especially when they have music on the patio... A great new place to go out to in the city.
My experience of this place is that it's too loud, and the food is overpriced. It's not bad food, just not worth it. Service was pretty good.

We have a winner! Summerlin residents, we have tried every new restaurant in Downtown Summerlin several times. Right out of the gate, this was very good. Beer selection is amazing, I had the best beer in my life, Thai chili, best apps and an amazing chicken and waffle entrée. Excellent layout, tons of outdoor seating and on the East side of the building, smart play.

Laid back environment but very weak bar drinks, ordered 4 fireball shots but looked like 1 shot split 4 ways and then all 4 drinks we ordered tasted like they were non alcoholic.  my long island ice tea was more like an arnorld palmer.....leaving now, on to the next bar

Came here for GNO for appetizers and drinks and food was amazing!
The school house theme was interesting. 
Ordered Calamari and Cheddar Cauliflower, and wow one of the best places I've had Calamari. Super crunchy and the sauce it comes with has just enough spice. 
The only let down is there's no flavor mix for my margarita! I usually like to drink mango margarita and I the were only able to make regular margarita. It was delish enough, but not enough liquor. Still it was good. 

The price however was pretty pricy. Just 1 appetizer and drink was almost $20. 
Still I would come back again just to hang out and pre game

So my wife and I went here. When we walked in, it was really loud, I'm thinking it was going to suck. The staff was great, and when we got our food, Holy Crap!!! It was Awesome. I had the PS Burger, it was probably the best burger I've ever had. They have alot of beers, didn't try any this time, but we will be back many other times to try all the different beers. Definitely try this place, you won't be sorry.

Food was great!! service not so much. 
Entertainment was great and and enjoyable.. 
I recommend this place just for the food, but please be patient with the servers, because they are very slow .. It took forever for me to get my drinks forever for me to order a new drink , and when I did finally get a chance to order a drink about 10 to 15 minutes to get back from the bar !

We decided to check this place out and heard a few good things about their food and great beer selection.  Upon arrival we were greeted by the hostess and quickly seated.  The beer selection was very extensive including a limited rotating selection of beers that disappears pretty quickly.  We were lucky enough to try the Deschutes Abyss Imperial Stout, as this is one of their flagship beers that is very limited.  They also have a brunch happy hour with a great selection of beers at happy hour pricing $4 a pint.  These include the likes of Left hand milk stout, Duvel and First Amendment.  We decided to try the hangar steak salad and it was excellent.  We had a great server, Katie.  She took care of us and brought us a dessert to try, as we were missing the applewood smoked bacon in our salad.  We tried the ice cream sand which with two chocolate chip cookies, Nutella and vanilla ice cream. Delicious!!!!  We also had their banana creme pie in a jar. This was absolutely amazing and was just recently added to their menu.  Thanks Katie!!! Spot on!!!  I will be back just for the desserts and maybe even for a beer or two.

This is my new favorite place. I love the atmosphere and the creative decor with the schoolhouse theme. The outside patio will be fantastic in the spring. It's very roomy and has a gorgeous view. They have fun drinks and good prices and their buffalo cauliflower appetizer was fantastic. I had the tortilla soup and one of their salads, both of which were very very good. We had a great server and a super fun time enjoying the bottomless drink brunch. I'm really excited to go back and eat and drink again very soon.

We were quite excited to eat here, the menu looked right up our alley and it's a Gastropub.  The dining area is very loud, if you want to be able to hear each other sit outside.  The outside area is very nice, great view. There's misters and fans.  The music needs help, but I just blocked it out with good convo. 
The service here is good, we didn't get utensils but they came after we asked. The guy seemed new to serving, which is fine, we got the right order and drinks were filled.  
The food was pretty good, not slammin, but delicious. We had the tater tots and chorizo mac and cheese to start.  The tater tots were very greasy, hardly any crunch and lacked the bacon flavor they were supposed to have. They missed the mark on that one, but the idea was good, if they could execute it they would be great. The tots just fell apart and were mushy. 
The Mac and cheese had a sausage chorizo, and had big kettle chips on top.  It was cheesy but I love that crunchy bread crumb topping on mac and cheese, and it didn't have it, the chips just fell off and were useless. I wished they also used ground chorizo, that stuff is excellent when mixed with gooey cheese.  
For the main courses we had the Shrimp and cheddar grits, this was really good.  Great sauce, it was light, and the grit patty had a nice crunch to it.  They did that right, awesome. 
We also had the short ribs.  They were a bit fatty, but the meat was very tender and great flavor. It reminded me of a meal you'd have at home on a holiday.  The mashed potatoes were sitting in a nice gravy, and they give you plenty of meat.  They also put some crispy brussell sprout chips on top.  They were really good.  Nice and salty with a slight char. 
All in all it was pretty good, they have some kinks to work out, but it's a great place to eat outside and have drinks and food. If they play some good music it'll be a hip hang out. I'd go back for sure.

Just had happy hour at Public School.  It was nice and easy and the food selections were decent and good.  Drinks were reasonable and service was excellent.

Don't know if this establishment will make it at this location.  It was not very busy and this area seems to be craving family type businesses.  Also, a lot of locals in this area seem to crave just really simple food choices and this may be a little different for some.  Just my opinion....

Came here with a big group of friends after we left Pkwy tavern since they were charging a fee to get in if you didn't reservations due to the rousey fight.  

Service was great.  Our waiter was very attentive since there was like 14 of us.  The drink were really good, I recommend the pear necessities. The food however wasn't really up to par for what they were charging.  The pizza was greasy and pretty bland even for ordering 3 different types of pizzas. French fries were good, the hot wing like cauliflower was okay. 

The decor and theme was interesting. Totally forgot about the solar systems we used to do for class. Overall, place is very hipster but it made for a good back up plan but closed too early for being a Friday night.  We ended up hopping over to dave and busters.

Public School has been on my list as a place to try since opening in Downtown Summerlin. When given the chance to dine here on Wednesday, I jumped at the chance to have dinner at the cool spot perched on the second floor of the "Dining Arroyo" at my favorite shopping center in Vegas. Although Public School did provide a unique, modern dining/lounge option with great views, the service and menu fell
short of my expectations.

Upon arriving, we were seated immediately in a comfortable booth. The decor is modern and hip and I was excited about the experience. The server took a while to greet us (I saw him and another server arguing who was taking our table), but when he arrived, was friendly. We ordered a couple of beers and the Hummus as an appetizer.  The Hummus was excellent, with fried chick peas on top
And served with excellent grilled flatbread.  For
Dinner I ordered the Thai noodle salad and he ordered shrimp and grits. Although I was looking for a cold noodle salad, this one fell short. There was a lot of dressing and the ingredients were just ok. To be fair, the shrimp and grits were supposedly excellent.  The beer was also ok, mine being a little hoppy and his not matching his favorite ciders he usually orders.

My gripe with this place is it seems to want to be pretentious and have an elevated menu, but the staff seems unmotivated to convey these ideas to
The guest. I would have loved a better recommendation for my beverage or maybe some ideas on special and unique menu options. Instead, we were asked if we were ready to order and if we wanted dessert, which is cool unless your intentions are to provide a more chef driven casual menu.

P.S. There is nothing worse than opening a menu after arriving at your table and it being stuck together with food and whatever else. This is a particular annoyance at a supposed upscale-casual restaurant with the prices to match.. just saying..

My wife thought the food was okay but ended up with food poisoning. She has been sick all night now I am home from work taking care of our boy. I would expect something better from a restaurant in downtown Summerlin. Go at your own risk.

We kept procrastinating about checking this place out....and finally had an early dinner here.

Here's the deal...the food is good, the beer selection is good, the menu selection is ok and would rank 3-1/2 to 4 stars on their own. The layout and theme of this place do rate 4 stars as well...but when you take a good restaurant and have excellent waitstaff, it kicks it up a notch.

Our server, Victoria, was certainly the highlight of the evening. Wife and I totally appreciated her suggestions, her great attitude, and attentiveness.

We had a few appetizers, deviled eggs (with crispy prosciutto)..a little underseasoned but very tasty. (hey chef...salt and pepper are your friends in the kitchen)

Meatballs Al Forno...these were perfect (some of the best ever) with a little heat to the sauce and grilled levain...which is an ostentatious way of saying tiny pieces of grilled sourdough bread. Chef...more sauce and a couple more pieces of bread...uhhh...levain.

For DInner, wife had the Pan Seared Salmon which she loved and I had the Skirt Steak Tacos with a side of Bacon Cheddar Tots. Tacos were a little on the dry side but tasty and the tots were amazing with the sriracha ketchup. 

All in all, for the menu, they have a little room for improvement. You guys make it fun so we'll be coming back to school for more lessons.

I love this place! Really great drinks (their lavender Moscow mule is my favorite) and their food is good too, haven't had anything I didn't like. Industry night is Monday and everything is half off, which is great.

My boyfriend and I have been wanting to come to Public School 702 for some time. Saw great things on the website; creative concept, great craft cocktails, and an amazing beer list. That would deserve a 5 in itself. Although, unfortunately our service could have used a 1 star. The bartender made our drinks, gave us our bill, and went and sat down to dinner. Not once were we asked how our drinks were or if we wanted another. We took our drinks down, left some cash at the bar and walked out. Didn't hear a single goodbye or thank you come from the three staff members huddled around each other.

Kyle D was the biggest Dick to us first of all. Second, we had to ask for glasses of ice water separate from the 3 filthy water bottles that were brought to our table, and will not be supporting PS in the midst of all the other, better food and beer joints.

Had an awesome meal here last night!  The crispy buffalo cauliflower was totally craveable, and my farro, Brussels sprout and scallop salad was delicious!  The scallops were perfectly cooked, and the combination of flavors and textures was awesome!  Wish I could make vegetables this delicious!  Cocktails were fantastic, and the decor was lovely and creative. Will definitely return soon!
Great drinks, good service, but a little pricey for what you get. The atmosphere is top notch. Its definitely worth a try if you're looking for a new place to eat or drink in downtown summerlin.

Came here for the opening day and again a week later. Everything was delicious. Food came out quick and the servers were very friendly! Cocktails and beer were exceptional. Loved the atmosphere and the interior design. Many people here are complaining about slow service and I'm not sure why. Public School is a band new restaurant they are still settling in so its expected to have a hick up here and there. Will definitely be back!

Food and service was really good! I wished they had more of a selection of food for the lunch hour. Will I be back? Yes. But I will need to come and check out their dinner menu. I also loved the location of this restaurant. Prices are affordable too which is a plus in this city!

Place is pretty awesome! Spacious with a laid back atmosphere and the patio is beautiful! Staff is friendly and were always smiling. We ordered all apps: Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower  the best I ever had! Parmesan Truffle Frites and Ahi Tuna Poke! Topped it off with "Just About Bottomless" cocktails! Got my vote!

3 1/2 stars

Great atmosphere. Very fun and great attention to detail. I just feel like I over paid for semi good food. It's not bad, so I don't want to over state it. And, it's priced in line with most similar restaurants. I just tend not to end up at these types of places.

A group of friends and I enjoyed an amazing brunch on New Year's Day . Our server Katie was excellent and very attentive. I highly recommend you try the Jidori Chicken and Waffles they were delicious  . Public School 702 is 5 star in my book

Love this place, cool atmosphere and great food. I don't think there's anything on the menu that's not good. They also have a good beer list and drinks. The only bad thing is it can be a little pricey.

Food is delicious and locally sourced and the beer selection is pretty decent too! My friend was on a diet and asked for just chicken and shredded romaine lettuce, no dressing... no anything but they charged her $16, which seemed ridiculously steep. If the pricing was more appropriate, I would have given this place 5 stars.

Great happy hour, and very good food. They have truffle fries only during happy hour, and it's worth the trip just for those.  Nice beer selection as well. We love sitting out on the patio which has very comfortable booth seating plus some couches. It can get a little crowded and noisy inside. The service has always been very good too.
We had a party last night and Julian was our server. Great guy and he definitely took care of us. Be sure to be seated where Julian is.

The concept and restaurants of Downtown Summerlin have good intentions. Unfortunately, like every other restaurant I've tried in DTS, Public School is a bust. My friends and I arrived at 9pm on a Thursday. We walk in and two people are talking at the doorway. Oh wait, they're not just two people who are hanging out lounging on the doorway with horrible posture, they work here apparently despite their nonchalance toward any potential customers. 

We were seated in a HUGE booth for the 3 of us that was unbussed with crumbs and sticky crap all over. Lovely. When asking for directions to the restrooms, same rude service. So we get our table cleaned, find the bathroom, and eventually order some very mediocre food. Fried cauliflower is NOT amazing like everyone describes. It's exactly what it sounds like. It's just fried cauliflower for $9 or something. I think their mark-up on this is 999981625536% as a head of cauliflower is $.89 at the store.

We ordered the chicken & waffles that everyone raved of and was shown on our menu. We were given tandoori brick chicken instead? I guess our waitress didn't hear us, but the mystery gets thicker... apparently chicken & waffles is no longer on the menu, despite what we saw infront of our eyes! So the host who was lounging at the door is handing out old menus and the server who assumed we said one thing didn't ask again to clarify. So when she brings out the wrong item, she said "is that okay? Do you want to keep it?" Ha!!! If someone ordered chicken and waffles, do you think tandoori brick chicken with middle eastern spices will fill that craving? No. Of course we don't want the brick chief and want chicken and waffles which despite being off the menu, they made for us? 

So we finally get the chicken and waffles. Waffles were good hitting every one of my taste buds - sweet, savory, luscious, crispy. The chicken was disgusting. They were fried chicken tenders, but the tenders were HUGE and cut poorly. Think about a 3 inch chicken tender... The only good thing we ate was the kale Caesar salad which I would order again if someone dragged me to public school 702. If I wasn't bound and dragged, you would never find me here again. 

My review is confusing, but so was our experience. Everything about the night contradicted another. Hosts, servers, and chefs had no idea what was going on and were not working as a team. The restaurant has been open long enough to fix these issues so there are no excuses for our disappointing night.

Yesterday my husband took me to this place. I absolutely loved the concept of the restaurant. This place reminded me so much of something I would probably see back in NY! The menu is short and simple. Their drinks were good. I had the chorizo Mac n cheese as an appetizer with was delicious! And I had the mash bangers for my meal.
