This place is really nice and all the food choices on the menu look good. The staff are friendly and had good recommendations. I enjoyed the crispy chicken sandwich. It was very filling and even though it didn't seem big enough for two, it probably was. I'd go here again.
Happy Hour.. Till 6:30p.. Everything was under $10. Service was good. Great seating on the patio.
The food is awesome and the service was great! We had the tater tots with cheese and bacon as appetizer and I ordered the bison burger ;-) I will def be back here with all my friends.
Great food, great service!  Thanks LACEY, you are good at what you do....making customers happy.  I would definitely come back!  Thank God this restaurant is in my neck of the woods.  :)

The calamari was good,crispy and hot.  Ahi tuna taco's were flavorful and fresh. I recommend the steak salad, steak cooked medium rare as ordered, enjoyed the flavor of the dressing and ingredients in the arugula salad. Service was good, I had a much better experience this time.
Best spot to eat, hang, relax and enjoy in Summerlin. That server Sheena is awesome and definitely easy on the eyes.
This place was awesome.  Really loved the atmosphere its very fun and the food amazing. Bison burger, lamb burger. And adobo tacos.    And desert was amazing

Excellent.   This place has a great vibe.  I sat at the bar and was helped by Connor and Sherry.  They were both amazing.  They know their beers and their cocktails extremely well.  They knew their menu even better.   They were able to recommend plates that were SO delicious.    I had the poke and the Brussel sprouts and some delicious beers.   Thanks guys for being awesome!

We had 7 in our party and we got seated pretty fast. 1st off the service was great.  We had waters and drink orders right away.  The ambiance is really too cool for school.  I love the whole set up which was very inviting.  The menu was very intriguing which I loved.  We all ordered something different and all enjoyed our meal.  They had an excellent beer/micro brew selection.  Excellent experience and I hope to come back try new items from the menu.
Great place. Bacon cheddar tots are great. Tuna tacos, watermelon/tomatoes salad were light and also delicious. I had the shrimp and grits and the best thing I've tasted in a while.
A great place to hangout and grab a bite to eat and drink!  The food and beer selections are very good.  The service and ambiance is A1!  My wife and I now have a favorite place to hangout.
The happy hour here is awesome! Everything is so yummy! The buffalo cauliflower is to die for! I have hear that the brunch is amazing too! Gotta try

I really enjoyed my visit there. The food was really different and very enjoyable. I tend to frequent places because of the bar and this place was superb!  There was a bartender by the name of Ryan that really stuck out. She was super friendly and helpful with drink suggestions. I will definitely be back to see her.

First off the location is so convenient.  The decor and theme is unique and just fun. Our waitress was informative friendly and made great recommendations. 
Now on to the food part..... The food was amazing!!! We had the cheese and meat tray. I'm generally pretty picky! I ate everything on that tray and loved it. The chicken and waffles is an unique spin but absolutely delicious. The ahi tuna tacos another tasty treat.  Other reviews mentioned $5 drinks. We had $10 near bottomless drinks(4 each!!!)

Food and drinks are good but service is beyond slow, especially at the bar. You're a new business step it up and build your clientele! 

Ugh I hate bad service!

I can't even count how many times the bartenders made eye contact with me then just walked right by and proceeded to make servers drinks or polish glasses.

No bang for your buck here. The happy hour "recess time" is decent. We reviewed the lunch and dinner menu while we waited for our food. Not much price difference from happy hour! Like $1 difference. And this is just bar food. We got the crushed velvet. Their version of a Moscow mule with blueberry and blackberry flavor. We got the Parmesan truffle frites, speck & eggs, crispy naked wings, and crispy ahi tuna tacos. The one thing that was worth it we're the truffle fries and ahi tuna tacos. The food is decent. You can tell that they are trying to bring different flavor and style to their menu. The wings tasted like fried chicken and side note - they don't have ranch. It was worth a try, but honestly, I would not be back.
Conner & Mandy were so hospitable. Cocktails & lunch were the best, based on their suggestions. Come down & have some food & drink!!

I ate here for brunch and enjoyed it. The brunch menu is limited, but I ordered the roasted veggie item and it was full of flavor. The have a 'basically bottomless' menu item for mimosas/beermosas/ and bloody marys. The basically bottomless is four drinks from the menu. It was a good deal but it took way too long for us to get out drinks. I would recommend ordering two at a time. If the weather is nice, sit outside, it's a great atmosphere!

The concept of the restaurant is really cool, takes me back to my grade school years for sure.  The food is great and their entire menu is craveable.  The chefs have a lot of technical skill - we ordered the salmon, which they placed on top of the brussel sprouts instead of in them, which is great because then the salmon didn't absorb the flavoring of the vegetables, it kept its integrity.  I highly recommend the tots and the chicken and waffle.  Their brunch menu is fantastic and I wish that they offered more of the brunch menu on the regular menu.  The *only* thing I don't love is the regular fries - just nothing really exciting about them, and the last time I had them they were overcooked, hard instead of crispy.

Im giving this institution one star because unfortunately I cant give anything below.  This is my first time at this place.  I came with two friends of mine all of us first timers and Vegas veterans and who are well versed with quality and service of food in this town for many years.  We came here for a Saturday brunch , sat at the bar and we experienced intermittent to zero service.  The staff seemed like they didnt care at all.  We ordered the breakfast burritto without cheese and we were told since it was "premade" they couldnt customize it at all.  When the food came out it tasted like it was overbaked, dry, sauceless and tasteless and on top of it it was heavy and seemed deep fried.  Furthermore, we ordered bottomless drinks and we got a mimosa on average once every 25 minutes on average.  This is truly unacceptable from a Las Vegas standard I would expect more from an institution especially since its among several fine restaurants in Downtown Summerlin.  I hope the management reviews this carefully and takes it constructively because they really should step up their game - until then I would unlikely come here again or recommend it to family and friends.  The management did take our entrees off the bill which was most appreciated.

Noticed a few of these restaurants in LA, but didn't have enough time to try. Was happy when they opened one here in Vegas. Great location and a vary spacious area. The decor had a blast from the past vibe fused with a school vibe. The pair of metal strap on roller skates really brought back some memories. Came in on a Saturday at eleven a.m. and the place had about twenty people.  An hour later and the place was packed. On to the food. Started with the spicy calamari. The calamari was cooked perfectly. However, because of the bay seasoning, the amount of salt was overpowering. Ordered the Huntsman burger with extra bacon. Loved the flavor of the balsamic caramelized onions. The downside is that my burger sat in the burger juice and the bottom bun got soggy. The fries were over cooked, but I enjoyed the crunch. Ended lunch with a Nutella chocolate chip cookie ice cream sandwich. Very sweet and is a huge portion. I could only eat half, but enjoyed this dessert. Ambience and service was on point. Food was not so great. I will give this place a second try to make sure that it wasn't just what I ordered. I really like the selection of beers and that they served Tenaya Creek beer. One of the best beers in Vegas. I imagine that this would be a great place to have a reunion or to just party.

Went there for lunch last Friday (4/22/16) after hearing coworkers race about this place.  Was super excited.  I ordered the shorty bowl with an iced tea and my friend had the fish and chips with a lemonade.   First, greeted by our waiter and his trainee.  They got our drinks and her lemonade looked like water.  Tasted like water with a hint of lemon.   We ordered.  I was told the shorty bowl was the best thing on the menu.  Great!  
Food arrived and I was excited!  I couldn't even stomach it.  There was a grit throughout every layer in my bowl, as if maybe the arugula wasn't washed?  It was disgusting.  We waited for our waiter to come by, but the place was filling up with the lunch crowd.  Crickets (for us anyway).
 My friend liked the taste of her fish and chips but the batter was super thick.  She literally took the fish out and showed me the thick shell of cooked beer batter.  
Finally the trainee re-appears and takes our dishes.  Mine was hardly touched and didn't even question if everything was ok, or was there something wrong.   I expected a whole different level of food and service with public school...certainly didn't live up to what I'd heard
Giving 2 stars for just wanting to like the place versus the 1 for the gritty sand filled dish.
A great place to hang out, delicious apps and entrees, fun ambiance, and their watermelon mojitos are amazingly good!

Hhhhhhoooorible! Walked out! First of all, I called to get their address and THE RECEPTIONIST HUFFED AND PUFFED  at me because, she didn't know the zip code or the street address. The wait was 45 min and there was a long line of people. So I thought, "ok,status quo it's a new restaurant" BUT, most of employees are temporary transplants from other public school restaurants. I manage to get a crush velvet & a bourbon of some sort at the bar from the bar manager as the bar is inhabited by couch potatoes nursing their draft beers. I noticed several group of people leave the line and I am now close enough to see there are empty booths in the bar section, empty tables, empty communal tables large enough to seat a party of 5, ( we are 2). I walk up to the menu management gal at the podium and asked if we could sit at the communal tables and I was told, "you need a reservation to be seated." I think to myself, "I NEED A RESERVATION TO SIT IN THE BAR AT A COMMUNAL TABLE?" Why? I quickly scan the dining room on the other side and there are serval tables(besides the booths & tables in the bar) that are EMPTY!i I say to the menu management gal, " I need a reservation to sit in the bar?" Since when? Other Public school restaurants allow walk up sit down at the communal tables. Doesn't that defeat the concept of COMMUNAL? The best part was when a gal, I'll just call her "in charge" asked if I'd like to " sit out side...... "....In 110 degree heat?  Really? Now why would she offer outside when there are several available tables in EVERY SECTION OF THAT HUGE  restaurant. If this new restaurant is trying to create the allure of something out of the velvet rope days of Studio 54 they are missing the mark! You are located in a brand new mall with many trendy restaurants. People can easily go elsewhere and will......and I did.  GRADE: FAIL!

I came  to Public School 702 on a Wednesday night with my cousin. We had just finished watching a movie so we decided to check it out. The restaurant was easy to find and the host at the front was friendly. They have outdoor and indoor seating. We wanted to sit outside but the host informed us that we would have to wait so we opted to sit inside to avoid the wait and check out the restaurant's decor.

Being a high school teacher, I absolutely adored the restaurant's decor. It was decorated with school memoriabilia including trophies, books, etc. They also had an awesome solar system model hanging from the ceiling and other school themed canvases on the wall.The menus resembled composition notebooks which was a cute touch as well. The restaurant stayed true to its "public school" theme.

As far as the food, we were not super hungry so we decided to order small. We asked the server for recommendations and she was able to give recommendations for each category which was nice. However, being that we do not eat pork, there were limited options of what we could get in the entree section. Almost every dish has bacon in it, so if you love bacon, this is your place! The menu also seems to cater to an older crowd and seemed not so kid friendly. I did not see if there was a kid's menu but I'm assuming they don't have one since most of the people in the restaurant were 21+.

We ended up ordering the buffalo cauliflower along with the Irish stout braised  ribs. The buffalo cauliflower was actually pretty great. I am not a fan of cauliflower but it was perfectly breaded and tasted just like a buffalo wing. It was served with horseradish and buffalo sauce. I was okay with the buffalo sauce but absolutely hated the horseradish sauce. I figured they would at least have the option of ranch but the server said they did not serve ranch but they could offer aioli which I politely declined. I'm a ranch type of girl so I thought it was weird to have buffalo sauce flavored food without it. Regardless of the ranch though, the buffalo cauliflower is definitely one to try. The Irish stout braised ribs were also delicious. The runner for our food said it was the best entree on the menu and she was right! The meat was boneless and so tender. It paired up perfectly with the mashed potatoes served under it. I would definitely recommend ordering this dish!

The atmosphere of the restaurant itself is calm and seems sort of like a lounge. Our server was pleasant but took a while bringing us our check after we had asked for it. She stood by another table talking for almost 5 minutes so it was irritating to wait when we had asked for it before that. Once we got our check, we saw that our meal came out to about $30 for the two dishes, which was not too bad I guess. The only issues I have with this place is not having ranch but also the server giving us our check late. Other than those two issues, the place was nice to try and had tasty food! I'm giving it 3 stars because although it was good and a great place to try, I don't know if I'll come back again by choice.
They can't update the tap list online! The food combinations make you think the cook is like Dr. Frankinstein! Get back to the basics the "unique" flavor combinations are horrible!

It's been a while since I've given a restaurant five stars.  This place is definitely worth coming back to, over and over again.  We decided to hit up their happy hour.  $5 apps and well drinks. You cannot beat that.  We had everything from their wings, Margarita flat bread, sliders, fried cauliflower, to Ahi tacos.  Nothing got left behind. We devoured it all.  I'm not a fan of cauliflower, in fact I've hated it since I was a kid.  My friend ordered it without me knowing.  When it came out, I grabbed one, again without knowing what it was and damn it was amazing!   Once you have one, you just cannot stop.  It definitely made me want to go home and make it.  That's how great it tasted.  The wings are awesome as well.  This will definitely be our new favorite spot. Can't wait to go back.

Service was terrible but the food was good enough to come back to. 
Huge beer selection. 
I shared the bison burger and crispy chicken sandwich and both were good. 
I loved the buffalo cauliflower starter.
Love this place! Ahi tacos and buffalo cauliflower is my favorite!! Gets pretty busy for dinner so I suggest going early! Pizzas are huge.. Even the kids pizzas!

I generally meet a friend for lunch once a month and this month we went to PS 702 in Downtown Summerlin.  The restaurant is on the second floor in the dining arroyo section.  I was surprised how large both the interior and the outdoor patio were.  There was plenty of room outside on this nice afternoon and we got a table in the shade.  The theming around a school is a gimmick but it's OK.  That's how you make your brand stand out when the food is similar to what you can get any number of places.

I got the fried chicken sandwich with fries and an iced tea.  Service was quick and friendly.  The sandwich was good and the atmosphere was very enjoyable.  

Iced tea refills were brought without asking and we had a pleasant lunch.  Public School 702 is A-OK.
They took all the good things off the menu, the staff has dwindled down, it started off great but the fizz has worn off

My team and I had a great experience with all the staff!  They attended to every one of our needs including specific dietary restrictions. The staff was kind enough to help me celebrate my birthday and allowed my team to bring in a cake and sing me happy birthday!  Everyone went above and beyond for my team and I and I am forever grateful. I can't wait to go back and visit with the friendly staff when I go back to Vegas.

You have to wear your sunglasses inside to be cool here. I guess I'm just not that guy.

Food is nothing to get excited about. Ordered a the Thyme After Time (drink) which was very good but $12 for six chicken wings? Chicken sandwich and tacos were just okay. $60 and I'll be hungry in an hour. 

Come for the atmosphere and drinks; don't forget your shades, bro.

What a great pick got the family.  Tater tots were great!  I had the shrimp and grits, much different version than i anticipated. ..but well worth it! Wife had the chocken tortilla soup and roasted beet salad..that was well...just that,  nothing special..but ok. Service was great..definitely will be back!

There aren't many spots in Vegas that I give 5 stars to, but every time I've come here I've had a great experience. 

Food: all of the food here is incredible and there is a really great selection to satisfy anyone and everyone. I highly suggest their Buffalo Cauliflower...unreal! There are also some awesome deals during their Happy Hour (M-F 330-630. 

Environment: it's a very cute theme and the restaurant is dimly lit and inviting. They have a great patio for the summer months with fun games
and things. Nice spot to bring a group!

Service: the waitstaff is always great. Our server Mandi was so sweet and very knowledgeable of the menu, offering her personal favorites and suggestions. She clearly took a great deal of pride in her work and invited us to dine there again (which we definitely will!)

5-stars, well-deserved.

Confirmed- gave it another try and it's not anything special and a bit over priced.  Staff is not polite, friendly or helpful and apparently their fans are broken. Disappointing because the patio is beautiful.  This is a great example of potential being squandered.

Went here for brunch with some friends! Located in downtown summerlin, they have a patio overlooking the mall, and on a good day with good weather, it's a beautiful spot to go to for brunch, lunch, or dinner. The food, unfortunately was alright to me! My friends thought the same about their food. I can't really pinpoint what it was about the flavors of all of it... it just kinda tasted bland. Which I hate saying! We went w the Mac and cheese, margarita and pepperoni pizza, and the steak tacos. For the price we paid, I wish we could have gotten more from the plates.

Decided to eat here with friends have heard so much about their drinks and the recess menu that now I am educated about my favorite part of school. This is a great place to visit for and just enjoy the company of friends and alcohol with great food. We were drinking beer and getting ready to go out for the nights festivities. 

The service here was stellar and since we sat at the bar there was no wait time for our party, but two of our party we're already here so that our drinks were at the table when we walked in. Wow, what are friends for! The tele's play the Knights game and that is the only sport currently that I am following, so it was good and we were winning too! We had a great time getting ready to go out for the night here with great beer and hockey!

My girlfriend and I hit this place up for happy hour on a Wednesday. The first impression is that this is a cool place, it's decorated with a highschool motif and all the little details are incredible. Their craft beer menu is excellent, although only a few beers are available at happy hour prices and their cocktails are very reasonably priced, but also not available at happy hour prices. The food menu is one of the most unique I have seen and the chorizo mac n cheese is off the chain! Also, the service was excellent, Tyler and Mark were the kind of servers you usually only get at much more expensive establishments. We will definitely be back.

Came here a couple days ago. I know you guys are waiting for my review. 
This place isn't tooo shabby, it's a nice hipster type of place. But, the food was just mediocre to say the least. I'm not gonna hop on the hype train like everyone else, I'm going to give you guys the real review. Food was just ehh, you know how you tell your neighbors to keep it down. You're just like "keep it down"
I'm like "the food is ehhhhhh"
You know what I mean, rather go Bjs, lazy dog, or anywhere in dts!

We visited on a Tuesday night and sat in the bar to take advantage of Public School's awesome happy hour.

The good: (1) service was wonderful; (2) the decor is very cute, even if it's a little heavy-handed. I love a good theme and I like it when a business really commits; (3) those PB&J sliders are money; (4) huge beer selection.

The bad: (1) the deviled eggs and kale Caesar were no bueno. The eggs were bland and the salad was really sweet. Unexpected with a Caesar and not in a good way; (2) the bar area gets really loud so conversation can be a challenge.

The final word: really unique spot in Downtown Summerlin. It's worth a visit and, in my case, a second visit. I went on a Tuesday night and the bar was a sausage fest. On a Saturday night, this place must be a single lady's wet dream.

Public School has always been A-Ok in my book.  This is great place to visit with larger groups (8+)for dinner or quick casual appetizer time because I'm in the area.  I'm reviewing off those experiences...

Public School service:  Servers have consistently been good through all my visits.  We go during busier times and the kitchen still does a pretty good job with getting entrees to the table quickly.  At the bar, as long as there isn't a rotation in bartenders, you're taken care of pretty well.

Public School cuisine: I've tried the Thai Noodle Shrimp Salad and BLT Steak Salad and both were average, not ordering again.  However, I've had pretty good success with dishes when I'm not trying to be healthy af. ie. the PB&J Burger which is uniquely tasty and prepped perfectly.  The Margherita pizza has always been good to me.  My favorite appetizers are the crispy buffalo cauliflower and Parmesan Truffle fries.

Public School ambiance: Gastropub decor provides for a very cool and casual dining experience.  I dig the solar system model that hangs from the ceiling.  Shuffleboard and giant Jenga blocks makes for a good time if you're hanging for a bit.  Where Public School gets an A+ is their ability to seat large parties with big tables and booths in the main dining area and the patio.

The craft beer selection is decent so pair that up with some dishes meant to be tasty and not so healthy (think greasy fun) and you're going to be A-ok.  They are a little pricey but this is a good place if you want to grab some quick appetizers or need a place to accommodate a big party on short notice.  Enjoy yourself...=)

Surprisingly good food, attentive staff that works as a team ( not common ) , and again, really good food.  The beer selection is solid, and the seating is great. Also have charging stations in the booths.  Study hall, pizza and beer - killer spot for drinking and studying.  The pizza is the sleeper, as well as the Mezze appetizers.  Mmmmm.
This place gets Top rated stars from me because the service here from everyone was absolutely phenomenal ! Everyone was super nice with great customer service.

The WORST service ever by Jessica!!!! 

Horrible server! Took 10 minutes to greet us and another 5 minutes to get us water. Did not write down our order (which is fine if you are a good server, but not okay if you can't remember the order.) She took another 10 minutes to actually input our order into the POS. I know this since our table was next to the POS and she had to confirm with me how I wanted my burger as she entered it in to the system. The delayed effort resulted in her forgetting all about ordering our appetizer. 

I have worked in a restaurant before and understand when it gets busy, and when mistakes happen etc .. but then Jessica had the audacity to lie about forgetting the appetizer and instead blamed the person who ran the food taking the app to the wrong table, then later blamed the kitchen for the problem. Said the "kitchen" was having a bad day. More like SHE was having a bad day. It would have been much better to just admit to making the mistake, then apologize and comp the appetizer.  

The two stars are because of the manager who came by to check on us and apologize for the error. She seemed genuinely apologetic and kind. 

Jessica meanwhile, dropped off our check, and then disappeared. We asked her for a box to take the leftovers home, but she never came back. Had to flag down another person for the box! Guess Jessica figured she wasn't getting a tip so we no longer mattered to her! Customer service at it's best at Public School 702!

My foodie partner in crime aka my husband and I have sat at the bar here at least 5 times.  Our first few trips were just ok, beer selection always fantastic but food was a bit on the average side. Regardless it is always hard to score a spot at the bar.  The bartenders are always friendly and authentic super passionate beer connoisseurs (my man can sniff out a faker).  Tonight we decided to try the salmon which our bartender Conner recommended.  We usually have a policy of never ordering salmon cuz it routinely sucks.  To our delight it was TOTALLY awesome! One super cool detail we discovered; they have usb chargers at the tables and under the bar so if you're like me and run out of juice every night around 8 o'clock you're saved.  It seems 702 PS is growing up nicely and has been paying attention to the teacher's corrections ;)

They have the worst service ever ! Had to ask 4 different workers just to get a salt shaker . The waitress looked extremely bothered every time we asked her for anything, especially when we asked for split checks, she even laughed when we asked. She never came by to check on us and we had to ask for drink refills multiple times before we ever received our drinks and she blamed it on the bar saying they were extremely busy when there was no one at the bar. And the bottomless drinks aren't bottomless you only are allowed 4. Hated it . Will never return.

I went late Wednesday night with some friends, we had Ryan as our bartender and he was amazing! Made excellent drinks and was very attentive. We also ordered some food after partaking in a few shots. We ordered the deviled eggs, pepperoni pizza, and the fig pizza. The food was okay, nothing special but it did the job. I will be back very soon, maybe not to eat but definitely to drink. The whole place looked amazing and was decorated very cool.

We decided to go here for a quick brunch for my mothers birthday. Everything was great in the beginning. We had ordered the bangers and mash which was good. The sausages were okay and I felt the gravy should of been a lil thicker. My chicken sandwich was great. Had no complaints about that. 
Even our pizza was pretty good but nothing any different that I've tried before. 

The only thing that was disappointing was the customer service. This is why I'm giving a 1 star. I would of gave this place a higher review but we had told the hostess in the front it's our mothers birthday and we wanted to do lil something for her. She said they can do a cake and candle and she will let our server know. 
So here we are waiting and waiting for the cake. The server comes grabs our check and here we are anticipating for the cake to surprise my mom. So 15 min later I'm like damn does it really take that long to give back my card. So I'm thinking maybe they're going to give the cake when she returns with our card. But noooo our server comes back and gives us back our card and tells us have a nice day. So we left. 
So upset!! We really wanted to surprise my mom. Never again coming back here. 

Not trained employees who don't give a crap.

Made a reservation here for lunch as I was advised to by two different people.  This was the best advice as when I arrived a group in front of me had to wait. I didn't. :) Upon looking at their menu online I was worried as it didn't show prices. To me, this usually means it's going to be expensive. 

The menus took me back to my school days as their brunch menu was a test scantron and the regular menu was a composition book. Being as it was lunch and I wasn't feeling breakfast so much I went with the Bison BBQ burger. At the beginning the servers were attentive, but closer to the end of my meal, they stopped coming by as much and I waited a while for the bill.

My burger was tasty.  However, I didn't taste any BBQ sauce which I was rather disappointed with. The cheese ratio was astounding! Usually I feel restaurants skimp on the cheese, but here it covered the whole burger. It also came with a side of fries and sriracha ketchup.  The fries were ok, and although I can't eat spicy the ketchup was addicting! 

The atmosphere in the restaurant was nice. They played reggae tunes which made me feel like I was at home in Hawaii.  The decor was eccelectic and kept my eyes wandering. 

I had a great experience here and would love to come back to try other foods and their beers.  I hear they have a great happy hour.

The food was good. The atmosphere was vibrant and crowded. A lot of younger people from age 21-30. Reminded me of a club type place to meet and greet and grab grub in between. 

A little loud and hard to relax after a stressful day of work. But, if you like that kind of atmosphere and want to pound down a couple of drinks, meet some random strangers and strike up a conversation, this is the perfect place for you!

I'll be back to try it again, and update my review. I only had time for a drink and appetizer, next time I'll sit down for dinner with some friends.

I had the Huntsman burger with bacon and was very impressed. Super flavorful and very tasty. Fries were above average as well. They don't offer/carry ranch dressing which is odd...every school in America serves ranch. They were very accommodating with subbing out items for my wife who has special food needs as well. I'll definitely be back.

Customer service is not the priority of this restaurant.  The menu is extremely cool but good luck getting to eat it without an hour wait.  We came on a Sunday night and we had to wait an hour and the place was empty!  Seriously!  I can't even imagine what a Friday or Saturday would be like.

Went here for drinks with a few friends and for it being out of the way, it wasn't really worth it.
As soon as you walk in, you see someone standing by the door, whom I'm going to guess is the host... but doesn't look like one, nor act like one, as we definitely seated ourselves.
For drinks, we had the apple jack, guava something, and then I had asked our server to make us one more drink that doesn't taste like alcohol, but has plenty of it.. and all three of those drinks were disgusting. The ginger in the apple Jack was way to strong, and the tequila in the guava drink overpowered any other flavor in it. Also on a side note, I feel like the bartender was new because when we were watching her make our drinks, she measured literally eveeything.. and it still tasted bad.
So the stars received was for the food! We had the calamari, shrimp grits, mushroom pizza and the bison burger. The calamari was delicious! Had a nice crunch and the perfect amount of seasoning, and the ginger aoili paired really good with it. We also had the shrimp grits. I don't really like grits, so I picked off a few bites of shrimp and that was tasty. I really liked the flavor and the sauce surrounding it.  We also ordered the bison burger. For never having bison before, I felt like the burger was more so plain jane. I've had much better tasting burgers for less money. It did come with fries though. Lastly, the mushroom pizza was a very good choice. You can never go wrong with mushroom pizza with truffle oil. Absolutely delicious. The only thing wrong was that my friend expressed that she didn't want any chili flakes on it, and the server insisted there were none, yet you can literally see the flakes of chili on the pizza. Even after she pointed it out, the server could care less about his & the kitchen's mistake. 
After all of that, we tried to order dessert, but the kitchen was closed. Apparently we ordered the pizza 40 minutes after the kitchen closed, but what good did that do if the server didn't even tell us when last call was??? I thought that was dumb. And mostly the reason for the 2 stars. So we were able to order cookies and milk, which didn't fulfill anyone's tastebuds..
Overall, I wouldn't go back. Even if I'm shopping at downtown summerlin, there are far better bars/ places to eat at Downtown summerlin or closeby.

Went to this place yesterday it's such a great place to hangout with friends. All the food I tried was delicious. Everyone that worked there was really friendly, the manger Tommy was super great with his customer service love this place it is definitely a place I will regularly hang out with friends. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

It was pretty underwhelming on my first visit. Again, I usually don't write a review after 1 visit.. but we were pretty unhappy when we left. 

It started with arriving at 10 pm after being told that the menu goes until 1 am. Not so.. late night menu started at 10 pm appearantly. There was a pretty mediocre selection of food at that point, but we figured we drove all the way out there so we would give it a try. This was after we were given the full menu. But here's how it all went.. 

We ordered drinks and found seats at the bar. Sat in front of a bartender that cleaned her well for literally 15 minutes without even looking up. Like, literally a foot from my face. Nothin. So my friend says, "what time do you close?" 

She says - "it's different every day," and she went back to cleaning. My other buddy says, "but we can still order food right?" She says nothing, hands us late night menus, and a full menu and continues cleaning. Without any other explanation. So we waited patiently as she polished the grate for the well, wiped it down and then walked away. it was bewildering. 

My buddy had to ask another bartender that was passing by if we could order. The bartender said, "well what time is it?" 

LOL! I said i's about 1030.. he said "ooooh let me check..." he says. 

He gave us a thumbs up from the other end of the bar but did not return to take the order. So when he came to our end of the bar again - about 5 minutes later to pour a draft beer, my buddy just started ordering out loud. haha.. I mean we had no intention of being rude.. but we were trying way too hard to order, like no-one was interested in serving us. We all had all worked and were there to eat. Very hungry. There were 3 bartenders, and literally 9 people at the bar.. we were the only ones trying to eat, and just could not get service. 

So now I'm watching the original female bartender that was cleaning her bar well in front of us. She grabs a glass water bottle.. drinks from it, then grabs a bottle of what appeared to be lemon juice from the bar well - and we all watched as she poured lemon juice into her water bottle. She did this by touching the mouth of the lemon juice bottle to the mouth of the bottle she just drank from, then put the juice bottle back in the well. I'm in no way squeemish, though that's just kind of gross, not to mention just wrong. 

So far - wtf. 

So the food.. we finally had a chance to order and were told only the late night menu was available.. after all that  time..we made some decisions and were informed we couldn't order them. This is were an explanation when dropping the menus would have been helpful. 

So we ordered Calamari, flavor was ok, not crispy AT ALL despite being fried.. I mean, literally soggy. Naked wings, all flats, no drums, which was weird but they were crispy and good.. deviled eggs.. good.. but the presentation were those of eggs that had been prepared and set out for a few minutes because the yolks were not looking so fresh, also we ordered truffle fries. The fries SUCKED. Seriously. Luke-warm, soggy, and served with preserved lemon aioli? I didn't understand that, I liked the aioli but not with these fries (that's just me).. They did not get eaten, yet taken away by the bartender without question as to whether we were done or if there was some reason it was over 75% unfinished. So there's that.

Still very hungry we decided on the FIG and Prosciutto Pizza and Taleggio and Mushroom pizza. I'm not even going to go into it becuase both were very sloppy in presentation and just mediocre in flavor overall. Honestly. We ate most of the Fig and Prosciutto and less than half of the Mushroom Taleggio. 

What I will say about he pizzas -  is that the female food runner that brought the food over, literally shoved my drink to the side as I was trying to move the dirty plates from the previous course out of the way, then quite obviously tossed both pizza plates onto the bar and walked away. I spun around like.. wtf? my buddies both just laughed because we were so just over it at this point. She looked miserable, and was taking it out on us! haha.. it's laughable in retrospect, but I mean really?! She then walked to the end of the bar by the service well and started chewing on her finger nails. No Joke. 

Ok, so listen.. I am not trying to just be an angry diner about this.. but i'll say it again: There is absolutely no reason for medocire food, or service in a town like Las Vegas. There are too many choices where people actually want to do the right thing, and serve a quality product.

This experience was a fail, and we are all easy-going foodie kind of people. 

I have no intention to go back to PUBLIC SCHOOL 702, soley based on the service. I would have liked to try the regular menu, but this experience was just a bust for me. 

Sorry - 

Happy Eating to you though!

Haley the waitress is awesome!!
Bartenders are really slow, but she made up for it with her stellar customer service.

A group of new friends joined my boyfriend and I for some drinks and we ended up staying the entire happy hour. Great drinks, awesome happy hour prices on food and bevs and a fun menu.

Cauliflower buffalo bites are phenomenal and the hummus was mouth watering. I'll be back tomorrow  !!

Delicious! Loved the buffalo cauliflower and hot mess sandwich! Had the fish and chips last time and they're my all time favorite dish. Haven't had anything bad yet! Quinoa salad was also yummm! Servers are also very helpful when turn between options. Beer selection is adventurous.

I have been to this restaurant few times and the last night experience was horrible! To start with, there were two host persons at the door, a girl and a boy, (11/21/2015 around 6:30PM). We entered and had to stand behind them for like 2 minutes because the they were seem to be having their own conversations! As a valued customer to the restaurant should I disturb their little private conversations?? NO!!! finally the girl acknowledged that we are standing behind them and she said there is a wait for 25 minutes! And guess what?? We could see from where we are standing that there are so many seats available at the bar, where they fully serve all the menu items!!! And she didn't even bother to suggest that!!! Wow!! Felt like she think "we don't want to be too busy"!!!  And since we know we can sit at the bar, we went there and sat. I ordered two appetizers, two entrees and two cocktails as usual! My pasta was cold, but I sent back to warm it up. During this time someone took away all the utensils assuming that I am done eating, therefore I had to wait another few minutes get new utensils again! And we wish they didn't put too much BBQ sauce on the bison burger! Very disappointed really!!!

Public 702 is located in downtown Summerlin over Crave. The inside is intelligently designed with old, retro school items such as lunch boxes, pom poms, megaphones in display cases and old bleachers nailed to the wall. The menu looks like a black and white speckled composition book and the napkins are lined notebook paper. Very smart marketing. 
Food was quite good, each item ordered was said to be delicious. Appetizers were buffalo cauliflower, Mac and cheese, bacon and cheese tater tots. Food ordered, Huntsburger with brown bag fries, chopped salad, roasted poblano with stuffed veggies and quinoa, fried chicken and waffles. 
So why 3 stars? Our server!! Our dinner took 3 hours. I repeatedly saw her in the server hallway eating and talking to the other servers. She took 15 minutes to come over to us after we were seated, another 15 to come back with drinks, she disappeared while we waited to place our food orders, once other servers delivered our food, then not once were we checked on to see if we needed anything, my husband had no utensils. When we were finished, we kept waving down other servers to get our server for the check. Our server never arrived. Another server finally brought us our check. Our table time from sit down to leaving was almost 3 hours. 
Doubt I'd go out of my way to go back, I'll try other restaurants in the area.

A great place to enjoy a quality brew & unique greasy bits to compliment that beer.  It is a little pricey but the quality makes up for it.  Happy Hour is 4-7pm Monday - Friday.  I arrived 7:30pm on a Tuesday Night and it was very slow which I am not complaining about.  Service was quick and thoughtful.  The restaurant may have been empty but it was very clean.  I grabbed a Vegas Golden Knights Schedule and Toothpick on the way out to a Movie which is just a short walk away.

SO FUNNNNN! It's such a fun restaurant to check out! Everything is school themed. They have the solar system hanging on the ceiling, their menu is a composition book, and even their takeout bag says homework! xD Super cool.
They have a wide selection of beer. I tried their Blueberry sour beer and LOVED IT. Had two in a row. If you like sour beer, please try it!

For food, we had chicken and waffle, shirmp grits, and tuna poke!
All were super good.
I've been here twice now. Fun place to hang out with friends... Good food, but service was VERY slow on both visits. If they improve the service, I would give them the 5 stars.

Food was good..decor was cool ..service .. Not so good. Took 30 minutes to get a beer and this was at 4pm in the afternoon. Can't even image if they were busy. Wanted to love this place but just couldn't based on service only.
Great food!!!!! The only thing, they don't filter their water. How hard is it to get reverse osmosis so that I don't have to bring my own water? Hopefully...
Wonderful lunch experience. Had the cheese board and buffalo cauliflower. Margherita  pizza was fantastic. Service was prompt. Would recommend to friends. View was amazing from the outside deck.
Service has definitely declined on visit #2. Food is still awesome!!! Can't wait for service to return to normal....
Great food and great service highly recommended. Go there for brunch and try the French toast you won't be disappointed
Atmosphere very fun, food is delicious! The almost bottomless mimosas (4 glasses) even better!

I came here last week for happy hour and it was the best in town!! I'm not kidding we had like every app ahi tuna, margarita pizza, speck and eggs, hummus, and chorizo mac and cheese my fav! All the apps and beers were great! Great prices, food, and service. We sat in the outside patio and it's really nice. Can't beat it!!
Great atmosphere, fantastic food. Server Vanessa was not only knowledgeable, fun, and attentive, but super cute as well.  Will definitely be back!

Upon my first visit of Public School, I was not impressed. The service was great, the atmosphere was great, but the food fell flat. 

I decided to give this place another shot, after a few great suggestions from friends. On my most recent visit to Public School I started with a great beer, appetizer, then my entree. I order the bacon cheddar tots and for my entree I ordered the delicious crispy chicken sandwich. I know a chicken sandwich sounds pretty basic, but this wasn't just an ordinary chicken sandwich. It had a special sauce with pickles and kale, it was a mix between sweet and salty. If I go back, I would probably order this yummy sandwich again because it was yum!

I love the decor and the school related theme. How genius of someone to create a restaurant related to school. This is so relatable and depending on the time of your visit the menu change. If you visit during brunch, then you may have a test menu. If you visit during happy hour or dinner, then you will have a cute composition book.

The also offer great outdoor seating that offers an amazing view of local shoppers and the beautiful sky. My favorite is to visit at night and looking up at the stars, while I enjoy a beer. 

This is a great spot for a intimate date with your significant other, or a fun place to catch up with friends.

I liked PS 702 for the most part. We came for lunch which worked out as there was a small wait if you came after 12. We were seated right away and I commented how big this place was. The menus and the napkins definitely fit in with the theme so good job on the details. Now on with the goodies...

I couldn't decide on what appetizer I wanted to try. I ended up picking the Mac and cheese over the cauliflower even though the hubby said I could get both. However, being 9 months pregnant I can only take a few bites and feel full. I already decided before I got there that I would get the Fig and Prosciutto pizza. My other half decided on the bangers and mash. The food came out fairly quickly luckily because I was a lil hungry. The fig and prosciutto pizza was good, but a bit spicy for this preggo. I didn't know there was a bit of a spice factor and I wouldn't have ordered it otherwise. It was good, but I wish there was more of a fig taste. I couldn't see any fig bits or really taste it so that was a lil disappointing. I didn't try the bangers...only the mash. You know me and carbs! It was a good sized portion for lunch and the price definitely was well worth it. It was gone by the time I was done eating so I assumed it was delicious or my husband was really hungry. ;) As for the Mac and cheese I really liked the kale in it. The ladies next to us kept eyeing our Mac and cheese and I told them they had to get it next time. Not a big fan of the chorizo but that's what your eating partner is for!

Overall, I liked this place and the atmosphere. I wouldn't be afraid of bringing my kids because it is fairly noisy so other people wouldn't notice if your kid was talking loudly. Service was great in the beginning and at the end our server was no where to be found. Granted it was the lunch rush so just be prepared for a bit of a wait if you go during a rush.

Place wasn't too busy so we able to add +1 to our party with no problem. 5 orders and 2 came out incorrect. My spouses dinner came out correct 10 minutes later, mine...well 20 minutes later it finally came out correct. Thank goodness I ordered my side order of fries ($6) as i would have starved to death waiting for my order. First and most likely last time at this establishment. Oh and drink refills, don't even go there. Yes they comped my dinner (but since all my party had eaten already) who cares...comps don't equal explanations for poor service all around :(

Great time. Came with three friends for happy hour. 
Menu was wonderful and our server Tyler was amazing. Will return and ask to sit in Tyler's section.
Came here for mimosa brunch and was not disappointed! $10 for mimosas  food was delicious, had the chicken sausage and grits! Connor was our initial server and was amazing! He kept my drinks coming!

Visited this place yesterday for the first time and it wasn't too shabby. We got seated right away. The server was knowledgeable about the menu. Food was delicious. Ordered the baked cauliflower, fish and chips, and the kids cheese pizza. All were delicious and the kids pizza was a huge portion. I recommend and I would visit this place again. :]

I have tried this restuarant now 4 times and each time it loses a star but tonight was my final visit..
1)The inside is so loud it is hard to carry on a conversation so we love to sit outside, but tonight they had a very loud DJ which made the inside seem quiet.  They also kept sounding off a loud horn which was quite annoying.  The ambiance does not reflect the restuarants name; Public School, it seems more like a loud bar with a sub par disconnected menu.
2) We ordered Salmon with  vegetables and steak salad...The salmon was delicious, but the vegetables tasted like dish soap and the lettuce served with the 4 pieces of thinly sliced steak looked and tasted like day old bag lettuce...a little salt and pepper would have been nice to enhance some flavor, but our server never returned until we were done with our meal.
3) We ordered 3 glasses of wine, 1 califlower appetizer, 1 Steak Salad, and 1 Salmon with vegetables..approximately $95.00.  They did take $11.00 off for the dish soap veggies, but the service was challenging and for paying almost $100.00 it was very disappointing.  It's so unfortunate since it is a great location.

Public School 702 is the kind of place for people who like the idea of unique food and drink, but don't really like good food and drink. It feels like a sad rip off of the farm-to-table places serving up memorable meals in Portland, Denver and beyond.

On the plus, I really liked the atmosphere.  Cool upstairs location. Neat notebook style menu and napkins themed like post it notes. Very cool.

The beer list is good. But beware that they don't actually have a lot of the stuff. My first two beer choices were met with a "sorry, we're out of that." This includes Sierra Nevada Killerweis. Not exactly impossible to keep in stock.

The server - who was very kind - forgot to put in the order of the grilled Cauliflower appetizer. Too bad because most of the reviews on her, as well as my companion, raved about the dish.

We ordered a couple of different things. An uninspired steak salad and "short ribs." Perhaps my understanding of short ribs is off. But what we got was a crockpot-style roast on a bed of flavorless mashed potatoes. 

So be it. Probably a good place of a happy hour drink or 3. But must say the missing beers, never appearing appetizers and lackluster main course put this place in the loss column for me.

5/5 for the atmosphere, 3/5 for the food. Unfortunately the food outweighs atmosphere for me. 
We ordered the fish and chips and they were all breading! I'm down for some greasy, but I was still feeling disgusting after scraping off chunks of breading. I couldn't believe I spent so much on such small pieces of fish!
With the prices, I expected a lot more from the quality. I think this would be a good place for happy hour, but definitely not for a full meal. There is a cute patio area that works well for cool evenings! 
If you're sitting outside and doing happy hour, walk inside to the bar to order. 
Park on the opposite end of Dillards. Look for Trufusion/Lululemon.

Service was great. Sat at the bar and bartenders were super attentive and great with suggestions.  Even overheard that one of the people helping was the manager which I think is always great!  They offered us samples when we didn't even ask and they're suggestions were pretty spot on. Great spot!
Great food and great service (Victoria), love having PS702 in the neighborhood.  Thanks for another great night.

This is one of the worst places I have been to in a long time.  Food was not cooked properly and very poor service.  We had several people in our party and two ordered hamburgers.  One well, the other med. well.  Both came out red inside, basically rare to medium rare.  I sent mine back after the server said it would only take 3 minutes to fix it.  12 minute later mine comes back after everyone else is done with their meal. You've all had that happen where it really disrupts the vib.  When it finally showed up, the side salad was wilted and warm, like it had been sitting under a heat lamp or in the microwave.  I sent it back and let them keep it and ate what was left of my wife's salad (which had way too much dressing on it).  The other person at his rare burger and got sick later so maybe I should feel lucky.  

I spoke to the manager but it was some young guy and he just smiled while I was talking as if he thought it was funny.  I even asked him why he was smiling and he said "I am just a happy guy" so at the end of the day, they don't even care.  They are a new place now and crowded, but if they don't learn how to cook or fix an incorrect order 702 will be seeing fewer and fewer people drop by.  Beware.
Love love this place!!! The fam and I came to Vegas to visit my brother and we ended up here. The theme is incredible, the food is yummy and Tim our waiter was awesome!!!! Will defiantly be back!!

Very good for happy hour. Nice selection of food at good prices. Very good beer selection and decent wine choices.  Service staff was a bit overwhelmed during happy hour but they'll work that out. 

Great service for brunch. The regular menu is available plus a too small brunch menu - some additions to that would be welcome. Great vegetable hash. The French toast tasted terrific (but the bread could be thinner) and the Bloody Mary mix is delicious. 

Definitely worth trying if you've not yet been.

Decent little hang out spot for after work or even a mid-day "let's get a drink and apps in the middle of shopping" hang out. Tad pricey for what you get and servers aren't very knowledgeable on items including food and drinks. 

Had the Fish & Chips (I know! Why?!?!) and I don't recommend it.

Great atmosphere and loved the school deco! Service was great. I felt the food was overpriced for what it was. However, my Thai noodle salad and the burger were good. The beet(pink) cocktail drink taste like medicine.
Love this restaurant happy hour is fantastic so far the items that I've chose on the menu have been fantastic as well I've taken client and family there.

The food was pretty good, but the poor service ruined our experience. I probably won't go back because there are so many other great choices in Downtown Summerlin. 
When our server first came over I asked her a question about one of the cocktails on the menu and she didn't know anything about it. We ordered drinks and an appetizer (deviled eggs, they were very good). We had finished our drinks and appetizer and were sitting there holding our menus wanting to order food. She walked past us several times without stopping to ask if we wanted to order. We finally flagged her down and she said "oh, I thought you already ordered, I guess that was a different table". 
We ordered the Huntsman burger and the Bison burger, both were pretty good. When our food came out we asked for a side of dressing, which we never got. Our food was delivered by a runner and our server never checked back in to see of everything was ok. 
Also, don't order soda, it's a rip off. My husband ordered a Diet Coke, it came in a glass 8oz bottle that they charge $2.75 for. 
The need to work on their service if they want to stay open. Hopefully they will because the decor is unique and the food was solid.

Food is delicious and the place has a unique theme. It was fun going through the menu although there weren't that many choices for what to eat. The location is good, downtown summerlin is a great place to shop! Prices are not cheap but not super expensive and customer service is great!

Went to the first time to Public School, tried the Outer Darkness and grabbed Chicken sausage pizza and our bartender at the time Coner had suggested the Tart of Darkness and I fell in love. I had an amazong expeirence and looking forward to coming back soon.. Although the music is not what I expected to be in this establishment.

Went here for lunch today and I have to say I wasn't very impressed. The truffle fries were just okay and I have to the cauliflower which is a House fav is very overrated. Nothing really wrong, but definitely below expectations. We then had the BBQ bison burger which was pretty good but again not memorable. I will say the carrot slaw was really tasty and what gastro pub food is all about! The MAC was super disappointing. The flavors did not go well together at all. The cobbler had the smallest bit of ice cream and blackberries are a bit tart so we weren't impressed there either. The decor is great and well thought thru.

Good food. Good drinks. Good service. We ordered 2 lagunitas and a jungle juice and a coffee flavored beer. 
Ahi tacos 
Tarter tots 
Mac and cheese 
Grits 
Pep pizza 
A burger 
Mashed potatoes

Third visit. Great patio, decent sports bar food but MIND NUMBING LOUD inside!  Not worth it if you can't sit outside.  Also, there's almost always a wait for outside and frankly even on their best day this place is not worth a wait. Not recommended.
Hot server, hot food- request Peter!

7 of us sat on the patio from 9:01 pm to 9:45 pm and were visited by a server ZERO times. Once we realized we were not going to get any service, we went to the bar and when 1 of us asked for a water - the bartender rolled their eyes at us.  This was after we ordered 6 cocktails/beers from them. Very doubtful I will return.

Great place for beer, drinks & food. The beer selection is really great & the food is amazing!! It's not too crowded & our bartenders both times I've come have been very knowledgeable and helpful.  Love it here!

First time we visited PS 702 and can happily say we had a great lunch and experience. We each had a beer and shared a cutting board chucarterie. We loved it. The meat and cheeses with the olive oil bread was excellent. We also shared the 4 mini tuna tacos appetizer. The atmosphere is awesome and we will sit outside next time. Our server Lauren was friendly, knowledgeable and efficient---a sweetheart. The general manager bought a beer for us. 5 stars all around and we will be back with guests and try some of the main entrée items. Kudos to all.

Been here three times now and have not been disappointed. Mellow environment with both indoor and outdoor seating. The Jidori chicken with jalapeño cheddar waffle was delicious. Great choice of unique sides. House pizza is also a solid choice.

Super overpriced on everything 2 little skirt steak tacos for 13$??? Fries tasteless   Overpriced beers. Undereducated staff. Food is good but pretty disappointing. Cool place tho.  Lots of potential to bad it's crap now!!

Came today. Food good, service terrible.  We waited and waited and waited in between each part of the experience. We had to keep trying to hail our waitress.  We ended up sitting for WAY TOO long for our water, silverware, bill and then problem with the bill.  Ugh.

We had a great time here! The food was excellent as was the service and atmosphere. Our waitress Sheena was the best and even staff not waiting on us asked how we liked everything and made sure we were happy. The whole staff is amazing attentive. I can't wait to go back again and again!

Was in the area, and decided to try it out for lunch after friends all recommended it.
We had no wait at lunch, and was seated right away.
We tried the Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower starter....
which was amazing! and the portion was enough for 2 to share.
Since it was lunch, we decided to share the Fish & Chips, which was also very good.
The fish portions was large enough for 2 to share...and the brown sack fries were crispy & tasty.
They have a great beer list, both tap & bottle, but they do need to update the rotating list at the entrance, as my first 2 choices were both out.

Over all, a great lunch.
Great brunch! Their lemonade is handmade by the bartender and is bottomless; not to common in this town. Will eat here again!

Located in Downtown Summerlin. Ok so they may not win any awards for service, but I will say this, the weekend brunch almost bottomless Bloody Mary for $10 is quite the deal The Bloody Mary is garnished with, among other things, a chicken wing, allow me to repeat that A CHICKEN WING!!!!!  Also try the Beermosa. I will say theta they have a very good happy hour as well. It's worth a stop in, get there early on the weekends and avoid the crowd. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

Fried Cauliflower is awesome 
Need to have the Ahi Tuna Tacos every time I come. 
Fig and prosciutto pizza is amazing. 

The beer menu is pretty good, the rotating drafts are even better. Try a new beer that you've never had, don't stick with the same old cap. Expand your horizons! Don't order coors, bud, Miller, shock top, or blue moon here, try their other beers! You might find something you like!

The food is amazing. Tater tots and parmesan fries were my favorite. The servers are all over the place. Mine was half inside and half out. Why?!? You can't properly serve tables when you're running all over the whole restaurant. Drinks take longer than they should.

A co-worker had an early lunch here last Thursday, and had an amazing experience( he got the Huntsman, the cauliflower, and pepperoni pizza- all loved!). 
However I, on the other hand, did not. 
I called in an order of pizza. The order taker was very kind and triple checked all my info. When I arrived there were a bunch of people blocking the doorway, waiting for tables, and unwilling to let me through. Once I make it past, and to the bar/pickup, I can see my food sitting on the cold counter. I was rather upset.

The bartender was very nice, greeted me in under a minute, attended to my order immediately, and with a smile. Did my best to be nice back, but couldn't shake the agitation of my food sitting out. I falsely assumed it would remain under a heat lamp until pick-up. My guess is it sat for 5-10m, as it was luke-warm once I got to my car. 

Overall, I'll give this place one more try, maybe... But only as dining-in, and only when it's slow. 

I'd advise people to never do take-out.

A cool spot to grab food and drinks in Downtown Summerlin. 

We came here for dinner on a Saturday night. Our booth on the patio was perfect on a beautiful night. Our waitress was great. She had great feedback on the menu and was very attentive. 

I started with the Crushed Velvet which is basically a lavender berry mule. This was one of the best drinks I've had in awhile, I loved it. The Cheddar Bacon Tots were our food starter. They had a great flavor and I loved the crispy outer layer. The sriracha ketchup really set off the flavors. 

For dinner I enjoyed the CCB which was described as the chicken burger version of a Cobb salad. There were a lot of flavors that made this pretty good, but very messy. I'm not sure it was so mind blowing I'd order it again. My carrot slaw on the side had oddly few carrot shavings, but the flavor was okay. My husband had the Fried Chicken & Green Chili Cornbread Waffles. He loved this unique combination. 

I haven't had the opportunity to visit for Happy Hour, but the menu looks awesome. I'll definitely try to make a return visit to try Happy Hour.

This is my favorite breakfast brunch place in Las Vegas! The chicken and waffle is so good it's criminal! I always ask for the gravy to be served on the side and in a giant bowl because I can seriously eat it as a side dish. The humus toast is also an indulgence. Pair that with unlimited cocktails and I would need to bee wheel barreled out of the restaurant. I do enjoy the spaciousness of the restaurant. It's never too busy nor empty but the perfect family crowd.

We just tried 702 again last night & it was much better. The food was very good & the beer selection was good. We went for happy hour & had the tater tots, pb&j burger bites, & buffalo cauliflower. I had two Stone Tangerine Express IPAs, my husband had two as well & a glass of the house red wine. Plenty to eat & drink & the bill was $65 with tip. We sat at the bar. The service was good, but that's the one area I feel like they could improve upon. We were happy to see there were no longer twenty-one year old bartenders standing around chatting. The bartenders were more mature & attentive, but could have been slightly more attentive. We had to wait a couple times to order & there were dirty plates in front of us a bit too long. It wasn't super busy, just an average crowd. Our interaction with the bartenders was good. They were nice & had good suggestions, they just need to step up to attending to the needs of the customers.

At the bar. Very good service. But in the dining room it was a bit of a cluster f@&k. The service bar is way too small and the servers have to wait in line to get drinks. The bartenders rock but they don't have any room to appropriately place drinks upon completion. The happy hour menu is ok. But for the price, the portions are a bit too small. Great atmosphere. Huge room with an oversized deck. Fun place with a lot of potential.

I don't think I've ever gotten on Yelp to bash one of our local eateries, and while this isn't an outright bashing, wow, this was some really bad service.  Our party of 8 was seated promptly but it was 15 minutes before our server approached and took drink orders. 15 minutes later, (most of) our drink orders arrived (since they were out of what I ordered, I had to wait another 5 minutes).  The menu had some interesting items but was overall meh, and food took forever to arrive. Some in our party commented on the plates that had been sitting under the heat lamps forever, turns out, it was ours. Fish and chips sat easily for 20 minutes so the fries were soggy as one could imagine. My buddy asked for more ketchup, never arrived. We ordered an extra round of drinks and after 10 minutes, same friend went out to the bar to get them himself. While there, he ran into our server, which was a little awkward, and the server commented about the drinks, and ended up bringing the round we ordered anyway, so now we have an extra round on our table getting warm. At least we won't have to wait for the next round to arrive.  
Bottom line:  With all the options in Downtown Summerlin, a restaurant really needs to bring its A game. The soggy food and REALLY bad service makes me regret suggesting it for our monthly get together. We won't be back.
Came for brunch. Beautiful Day, beautiful view from the patio, altogether a beautiful experience! Enjoyed the Almost bottonless mimosas toi

First time here, so let me get started...
It's a Saturday night, but not busy at all. We chose to sit outside due to it being so LOUD! 

Dinner was ok. Had the bangers and mash. Chicken & herb bangers were so so but the mash was excellent! Yum! Other guest had the fish & chips. He liked it. 

Dessert was a total miss. I had the blackberry cobbler. Gross! A tiny bit of crumble was on top. And the blackberry seeds kept getting stuck in my teeth. Other guest had the brownie. It was more like thick chocolate cake, but was ruined by the chili powder on top. We didn't finish our dessert. 

The decor was cool. School themed, even the menus. I'll be back to try another dish!

Having came here for the first time, I picked the wrong time to come. 5:30 pm on a Friday...it's Cougarville city here. The inside of the restaurant was packed, no seating at all, and the noise was deafening. I was glad we were able to find a seat outside. Even outside was getting super packed. If tables were full, people were sitting on the arms of couches or standing. 

Our server, Vanessa, was incredible. Honestly, it's been awhile since I've received such good service. She was great with beer and appetizer suggestions. And, as they were so busy, she let us know that things would take awhile to come out. What a concept! I feel that more waitstaff members in Vegas need to be doing this! It's an easy to set realistic expectations and enable diners to plan accordingly. 

Drink orders, as warned, took awhile. But I was surprised how quickly everything else came out. Our total order was two rounds of beers and two appetizers: Buffalo cauliflower and Mezza plate. They make the mezza plate with white bean hummus. So, if you are a hummus hater, do not despair. Try this instead! The buffalo cauliflower DOES live up to the hype. GET IT. Don't think, just do it. Although, I'm really not a fan of the chunky blue cheese dressing that goes with this. 

Added bonus: Our waitress noticed we had too much humus and not enough bread and brought more out free of charge. 

Thank you, Vanessa, for the amazing service!
Can not visit without ordering the Cutting Board appetizer. Great location, atmosphere, beer selection. Never had a full meal here, but have enjoyed apps and beer. Great service.

Had a great afternoon at Public School 702 for a little lunch date with hubby and friends. Have never been so needed a little help on what to get and thankfully we ha the best waitress! Aimee Bond was so helpful on welcoming us and making sure everything was perfect. She was upbeat and very friendly while maintaining a professional and positive attitude. Will definitely be coming back and looking for her section!!

Great service and delicious food. My friends and I came in for brunch and let me say I love this place. Everything was flavorful and came out quickly. Plus $10 for almost bottomless mimosas is such a deal.
Who doesn't like happy hour on a Friday? Drink and food specials available. All the food came out delicious and promptly. Clean environment and fast service.
Michael was an amazing server!!! Sad to see the crushed velvet cocktail go, but always excellent!!!

Food was wonderful, but the service was not good. Reservations were made weeks in advance for a birthday luncheon for 12. They were not busy yet it was 30 minutes before drinks arrived. After our food came the server never came back to refill drinks. We obviously were celebrating a birthday...balloons and birthday decorations, but they brought the check without even asking if we wanted dessert. I was very disappointed and embarrassed as the host of the party. I had been several times before and had much better service so I thought it would be a great place to being friends for a party.

First off let me say how expensive this place is compared to the amount of food you get is ridiculous. The menu is short and half of it is beers and brews. The food is overly spicy and everything is spicy! The burgers, the ribs, the linguine and meatballs and even their eggs. It was $65 for two people to eat. And it was disappointing to say the least. Not recommended

I will not be returning to Public School 702 ever again. To give you guys the shortest possible version, the server brought my 23 month old son spicy SRIRACHA ketchup with his kids fries, and we didn't realize until he started CHOKING in the booth with tears in his eyes, frantically asking for his water. No apology, just a "oh my god, my bad!! I'll bring regular ketchup." I was so shaken up I could barely speak, and our server couldn't care less. My poor baby. Then, my mom found a short grey hair in her salad, to which our server told my mom she was wrong, and that it was ginger. I'm pretty sure ginger doesn't have a cuticle, and I am a hairstylist, I know what hair looks like. I look at it daily. We both lost our appetites, the server never checked to see how my son was, never apologized for either thing, and a manager never even came over to say one word. We still paid a $35 bill and still left a 20% tip because I don't believe in not tipping, but we will never be back, and I urge everyone else to do the same.
Great beer. Great wings. Great happy hour specials. Service was slow for a bit but that's fine, it was not bad enough to knock a star off

Fantastic food and our server Tyler was awesome! This was our first time visiting this Resturant and it was incredible! The appetizers were delicious and the steak was so good! Give it a try and I hope you are lucky enough to be seated in Tyler's section but I am sure they are all fantastic, but Tyler was outstanding!

So I posted a review awhile back about this please and have enjoyed it in the past but I got to say the customer service tonight gets an F! I went to sit in the bar/patio area and watched after server upon server passed right by my group as if we didn't exist, I also saw a table next to mine being cleared by 5 employees, again not one checked in with my group. I am pretty disappointed in this as I have always recommended this place to friends and family but this will no longer be the case bad customer service ruins a reputation I hope that the employees and management of this joint realize it.

Everything we had was delicious. Started with an old fashioned and if that's what they all taste like I have a new favorite drink. Had the tuna appetizer and the fried potato appetizer. Both were excellent. We both ordered the steak Mac-n-cheese. It too was excellent. We couldn't decide what was better, the steak or the Mac-n-cheese. We sat out on the balcony, and had to wait 10-15 minutes for a seat, but it was worth it. The view looks out at a park like area. It was nice but still casual. Will definitely be back and will probably try brunch.

went here today during happy hr. it was our first time here.  its a big restaurant, cool decor too.  happy hr prices were pretty good, everything ranged from $5-7 items. we tried the naked wings, fries, margharita pizza and adobo tacos.  i would repeat all except the tacos; bland and boring for being one of the more expensive items on their hh menu. 
yes, food was good. however service was horrendous. our waitress took 15 min to get us water! we still didnt order yet after 15 min...  we ordered a beer n diet coke. we got a beer and a coke, not diet.  when we mentioned it to her, she gave us the heavy breath look like it was our fault n it would be a huge problem to go back n get the diet coke since it was the actual glass bottles. we said forget it n let it be. but u really have to enjoy the annoyed look u get for their mess up.  btw, we got 2 of our apps before our beer and wrong soda. thats how long she took!  
there are many runners bringing out food from the kitchen. we were also lucky to get the one runner who dropped the lemon aioli from the fries dish off the table, narrowingly missing my wife's shirt n pants. she was apologetic, but never replaced the aioli.  we had to ask for it when another runner came by.  
overall, ok... beer is good, food is good, atmosphere is good....service is NOT GOOD!

Colby was great. He was attentive and made sure we were happy! He is the only reason for this 5 star. The chicken and waffles won at our table. The lamb burger was good not great. And the steak with mushroom salad, our mid rare steak was cooked properly but the arugula didn't do the plate justice ( also the portion of greens was off for the price.)

OMG this place is amazing!  The food is excellent and the staff is exceptionally friendly and attentive!  Shoutout to Sheri who always gives us the BEST customer service ever.  Would recommend this place to everyone!

I had trouble writing this review initially because I really wasn't sure whether to give it three or four stars. It's one of those that I really wish I could give a 3.5, but that doesn't exist. I really thought about it and food matters so I'm giving this a three unfortunately. I've been here many times. For happy hour, brunch, and dinner. Lately we stick to just going there for brunch for the almost thought of us. It's $10 for four drinks which include a bloody Mary, beermosa, mimosa, or Michelada. There are a few things to choose from on the brunch menu as far as food. I think we've tried just about everything. The last time  in particular we had the sausage and grits, the fried chicken and waffles, and the avocado hummus toast. The sausage and grits was actually quite good. I would give that a four out of five. The grits kind of come in a firm grit cake and it's covered and a sausage gravy that has bacon in it. Definitely something I would order again. The avocado toast was OK. It was avocado and edamame so it had a taste that I wasn't a huge fan of. But it was good for what it was and it came with two big slices bacon on top which made it better, because bacon makes everything better. Now for the chicken and waffles. It was recommended to us by the server. We wanted something a little bit sweet to go along with our savory dishes. Well this was not sweet. It was basically a savory waffle with corn that came with gravy instead of maple syrup and some fried chicken that was just average. I would give this dish at two or 2.5 at best. I definitely would not order this again. It is not sweet and savory if that's what you're looking for. I was just underwhelmed by the whole experience. 

Bonus tip though: if you order the Bloody Mary first it comes with a chicken wing!

Public School is a fun little gastropub with a great selection of food and beers. I'm from San Diego County, CA and was pleased to see some of my favorite brews from back home on their menu!

Their buffalo cauliflower is a MUST HAVE. The ambiance and service (Tyler was great!) really make the whole experience at Public School worth 5 stars.

This place is amazing. The food is so flavorful. We had the fried cauliflower, tuna tacos and the CCB sand which. All of them were amazing. 

The service here is also phenomenal. Our server was Conner, definitely as for him. He is one of the best servers we have ever had. He is super friendly, polite and knowledgeable about the menu and all of the amazing beers they have. Check this place out!

First time here, thought the decor and theme was very fun. The atmosphere was great too. We all enjoyed our food very much, very flavorful and lots to choose from. 

HOWEVER... service----- SLOW SLOW SLOWWWWWW!!! Hence, the 3 star review. What's the deal!!??!! The waiter was nice but very forgetful. Drinks seemed to take a very long time. The drinks were in my opinion overpriced.. this isn't the strip, it's freakin Summerlin.. why do we have to price gouge the locals? My Jack Daniels and water was somewhere around $20. Come on! 

My grilled salmon was absolutely delicious. It was $21 but it was worth it. My friends enjoyed the deviled egg appetizers and tater tots. Again, food was very good but service, they need to improve.
