Couldn't tell if it was the waiter, the kitchen, the bar or all of the above that made everything seem so slow. Not sure that I will come back anytime soon.

I really like this place. When you walk in you get this cool grade school interior. The bar area had these lab tables that put you shoulder to shoulder with others which was awesome for socializing. The dining room has a really neat solar system light up above. The food was delicious and the service was really good. We went for fathers day and they were giving all the men a free choice of their draft beer for fathers day. Pretty cool. I'll definitely go back

First time here for happy hour. Got the Chorizo Mac and cheese, it was tasty. We also tried the Frito pie, "homemade chili, cheese, red onions pickled jalapeños, it was dry and uninspired and definitely not a chill. Then we tried the "American Sidekicks" three mini cheeseburgers, all bun with a small meatball of a burger that was dry and over cooked. So all in all, it's a pass on this one.

Fun atmosphere, decor is "school" themed. I love the outside patio with giant jenga a beer pong tables.

We ordered the Tuscan chopped salad; kale, tomatoes, soppressata, burrata, crispy prosciutto. Per the menu it was also supposed to have chickpeas but out of the whole salad we were only able to find one (seriuosly, one!). But overall it was good, and a good size portion for sharing. The pizza we ordered was basic margherita, it was ok. The crust is thin which I like, but almost too thin towards the center so when you pick up a slice you have to fold it. I think it could have been cooked a bit longer? 

We had an awesome server, Erin. She was really hustling for us. Our group was ordering a lot of drinks, she was on top of it and she checked with us very frequently. So aside from Erin, heres the kinks; the drink service could really use some work. It took a looooong time to get drinks. To give an idea, we sat down and ordered drinks right away. After about 5 min we were ready to order food. Our food came out before we had even gotten our drinks!? This isnt the servers fault, they just need a better system at the bar. New place so it takes time. Overall I like this place and I would recommend checking it out.

Food and selection is excellent. Great fresh food prepared perfectly. Great happy hour deals and regular menu items still a great price for what you are getting. A few standouts the burger, chorizo Mac n cheese, meat and cheese plate, Tuscan kale salad, and farro salad. Been there 3 times in less than 2 weeks definitely will be back.

Service and food was great! The best part was our server Jared smith who made jokes and made us laugh. Only issue was that management could not find a table for party of 10 for happy hour so that was disappointing. Jared made it fun and made some ok jokes but it was funny after a few drinks! I will def come back here with co workers after a Friday nigh. I wish they had ranch dressing but it was a great experience after a hard week of work. Wish I had more $$ to leave a better tip. Thank you Jared for making my first encounter with PS702 a great one. We will def come back here again. P.S. Kudos for the chef.

A group of friends and I came here on Sunday for lunch after a morning of hiking at red rock. We were easily able to get a table for around 12 of us around 1pm. I loved the set up of the place, it was huge! They also had life sized jenga, checkers and a few other games. The vibe was definitely fun and causal.

As for food I was stuck between lunch or brunch, but decided to go with the CCB burger. It was a little bit messy to eat, but so delicious! The favors all meshed together very well and the meat was cooked perfectly. It also came with a side of tasty French fries and siracha ketchup. Yum!

I thought this place was pretty good! It did seem a little bit pricey, but most likely because of the location at downtown summerlin.

Honestly I didn't wanna come here.  Magianos (spell check) was on my brain, and this was far from Italian - but it was one of the only places open for lunch. IM SO HAPPY I ENDED UP HERE !  First things first the service was amazing !  We sat at the bar and  Tom was the bartender.  He was more than accommodating.  Id be considered what you would call a challenging customer.  He was so accommodating and answered all of my questions without hesitation. The beer list here is fantastic, and so is their list of liquor.  They had a lot of things I had never heard of, including GInsky.  When I had asked to smell the bottle Tom was kind enough to pour me a small taster.  And sure enough, because of that, he made the sale ! That stuff is amazing ! My boyfriend had the fish and chips and raved about it! All the sauces have their own spin which is also super fun ! I had a steak Cobb salad.  My steak was cooked just the way I asked,  and for once I didn't need the extra dressing that I had asked for.   We will be back!  So happy to have stumbled on this gem !

This place is not great, at all. Busy, but I don't get why it is. Service sucks, food sucks. The bathroom was the messiest bathroom I have ever seen at any restaurant. Trash all over the place, napkins from the restaurant on the floor, no soap. I won't be going back.

Thanks to their social media person being a jerk online I will not be going back here. Business are made and destroyed through their customer interaction. You need to take a lesson from other craft beer places in Las Vegas.

Went for brunch here last weekend. The food was food but super rich so it was hard to eat the whole thing. I ordered mimosas which were "almost bottomless" they brought a carafe full of the mimosa and the mimosa just tasted like only orange juice. Wasn't that impressed with everything over, just wasn't bad either.
Amazing. Original menu. Spidey chicken, bison burger, shorty bowl were fantastic and very original.
Bottomless mimosas were the bomb!  Peter was the man!  Great times and great food.  Get the CCC.  Games kept the kids entertained.

Just moved to Las Vegas and usually like to make my own meals so eating out is usually semi pleasurable. However, this restraunt was awesome. The vibes and the atmosphere, the fresh taste of vegetables and meats, couples with an incredible list of beers and twist on drinks - Id say for a less expensive great meal out there are few places that come close!

I forget his name but when I go back I willl write another review but my waiter and the door greeter were extremely cool and took care of ny wife and our family like true professionals. I work in customer service and consider myself to be of the elite and these two guys made me step my game up!

I will be making a one month stop over to Public School in Downtown Summerlin once a month for sure! Apps, entrees and drinks for the price and taste - cant beat it!

We stopped in to have a drink on their patio overlooking DTS fountain area. It's a nice place to have a drink and enjoy the nice weather. The margaritas were $11.75 each. They were served in a small rocks glass. They were good though. I could tell they were made with fresh lime juice and not sour mix.

We were there during happy hour, so we ordered some apps from the happy hour menu.

$7 Ahi Poke - served with tortilla chips and covered in a sweet sauce. It was very good.

$5 Buffalo Cauliflower - this was excellent. Surprisingly very good. They fry cauliflower like chicken wings and serve it with hot sauce and ranch.

$4 White Bean Hummus - they serve it with grilled pita. I have had better hummus, but it was good. I really enjoyed the grilled pita.

$4 Quinoa Salad - it was very good. It reminded me of quinoa tabouli without the parsley.

The service was great and I really like how the dining area is set up with the patio and the bars. I will definitely be back for dinner. Their menu looks like a winner to me. If the apps are a preview of what lies ahead, then I think I will enjoy it.

I'll be back!
Waitress has Very fast service and great knowledge of the menu. Place was clean and tasty selection of drinks and food

Solid spot, great draft selection! Lots of good local beers offered. They don't kill people on the prices either, i would come here more often but it's kind of a far drive. Food was decent, but the service was spot on and our waiter was really cool.

Lack of attentive service knocks down this review and the check. We liked the vibe, menus items, and beer selections. Our waiter was scarce once dinner was dropped off by the other staff. Given the opportunity we would have ordered another round but by the time he stuck his head over the half-wall separating the writer station from our table we had been staring at our empty plates for twenty minutes. Not to worry though, he promised to get those plates cleared away soon. It took another ten minutes for that to happen. 

Overall the food was decent and the beers were tasty. Hope the service improves the next time we check it out otherwise it will be off our list.
Jordan our server was the best ever! Accommodating for all 4 generations here on Mother's Day and the food was great too. Try the Truffle frites!!

Made reservations which was needed on a Saturday.  Very funky old schools atmosphere with text books- the menu look like composition notebooks.   Everything was good..the Cheese and bacon Tator tots were just ok and husband's lamb burger was suppose to be medium rare and was medium well...but he doesn't send food back so his issue.   Scrimp and Grits were interesting--- the Grits were more of a Palenta cake not grits- fresh corn was perfect!    Best item on the menu was The Cutting Board with Chef selected meats and artisian cheeses with the most delicious fig jam!
came in again today and know matter what time of day it is or who is here I always get the same amazing service and the food is consistently amazing!
I love the atmosphere-everything has a school like theme. You're also allowed to sample a beer before you buy it, which is great. Pretty crowded during HH but a fun place to check. Out.

Food was ok.   Our server seemed very unsure of herself. I had 3 diet cokes and didn't learn until the bill came that they charge for each drink. My friend ordered her burger without a bun, and server came back 3 times with questions. The burger and fries were good but with my diet cokes, I spent $30 for lunch.  Server dropped off our credit card slips and no thank you or have a nice day. Poor customer service. Don't think I will be returning.

This is the most children friendly restaurant I have been to so far! I highly recommend any family with young children. Super friendly stuff and amazing food. I can't wait for the next time ! 

During my last visit , my daughter who is 3 months old cried non stop. She wouldn't eat and she wouldn't sleep. I tried everything and then my mother started to help and still nothing would work. We went outside at the patio just so we wouldn't interrupt other customers inside the restaurant. Few minutes later, a tall gentleman with a mustache who probably work in the kitchen area came outside with frozen blueberries. He asked us if my daughter is teething and maybe the blue berries will help. 

This is what I call going above and beyond for the customers and take initiatives to exceed customer's expectation ! I didn't get a chance to get his name but 702 instantly became my favorite restaurant!  Great job !

Service at Bar is Amazing! Louis is super friendly and knowledgeable about beer. ( and cute doesn't hurt)  Being able to taste a double IPA before committing is always nice! Chicken and waffles is a nice twist on the sweeter version served at most place, and the mashed potatoes side.....  uhhmmm yes please!   Seating outside is suuuper amazing in good weather! Fun out there with great views and large scale Jenga, beer bong, and tic tac toe board! Happy Hour from 3-6 I think it is.  Cant go wrong, and if you eat too much, its in the Summerlin Mall soooo walk off some of those calories before hitting a movie or heading over to Red Rock!
Food was amazing!! Our waitress  Jess was the best!!! Super sweet and helpful! Great experience

So disappointed in the service.  This was our second visit and the service is just awful. I gave it 2 stars because the food is delicious but I will not return due to being ignored for over 30 minutes by our waitress.  We finally got the host to find her so we could get our bill.

I was excited about coming here from the good things I heard from friends. I would definitely say I'm disappointed by the taste of the food. Their deserts had odd flavored. One was a (hard/stale) chocolate chip cookie sandwhich with bacon bits wrapped all around the ice cream. I also ordered the fudge brownie which was very dense and dry. The ice cream it was topped with had cayenne pepper sprinkled all on top!! I accidentally took a small amount to see if it was cinnamon or nutmeg possibly (considering they put bacon on ice cream), but nope, it was cayenne pepper. I wish I would've been warned by the waiter or if it would be written on the menu. It killed the taste of the whole thing. The layout was nice but it's extremely loud inside.

I really enjoyed having dinner at public-school 702. The atmosphere was really cool, almost like a high school cafeteria but very clean (really cute) the menu's are made of comprehension note books, good selection of food items..not to much, not to little, reasonable pricing. I also love the fact that theirs outlets at each booth to charge your cell and other devices.  The food was delicious, very friendly staff, the waitress ( Desiree ) was awesome, she was very knowledgeable about everything that was on the menu and suggested the best choices for us.

This is a great place for date night or night out with friends. I definitely will return!!
Great service, awesome atmosphere but I ordered the grilled swordfish and it was over cooked.
The micro beer and the burger was great, the taste of the micro brew had a nice fruit flavor that I never tried before.  My server was a super nice person
First time at 702, great outside balcony seating. Great menu, great food. We will definitely be going back.

Went here for lunch.  Was really impressed with this place.  Had a very cool theme.  Wasn't very crowded so we got sat right away. I highly recommend all of their salads.  I got the roasted chicken and quinoa salad and it was DELICIOUS.   My friend got the Thai noodle salad  which she loved as well.  I will definitely be returning.

My husband and I recently went to Public School 702 with a group of friends. We had a great time, and the food, drinks, and service was AWESOME! Sarah was our server and she was super friendly and helpful and did a great job! Jane was the manager and she was also really friendly and great! We had such a fun time and can't wait to go back! :)

Walked over from Red Rock Hotel for brunch. About 3 blocks. There coffee is very good. Food is an eclectic mixture of flavors. Some good, some a little too odd for me. But probably appealing to others. Food was good.  Would go back.
Great service and very friendly staff. Food prices were a little expensive but the place is very nice.

Went here to meet with a girlfriend for happy hour. The place looks really cool, very open and spacious. Great vibe. Not too loud. I found our table easily. 
        The patio was nice, I joined our group and after... A while, our server got my drink order. Eventually my drink came out. It was delightful, I think it was called a crushed velvet, it was refreshing and tasty and wonderful, served in a sweaty copper mug with lavender and blackberries it made me smile. I didn't meet the bar tender, but I know we would be the best of friends. Now I was ready for some food, it was happy hour so I chose their PB&J sliders. Tiny burgers with peanut butter and jelly and BACON?! Yes please. I waved down a server (not ours because I hadn't seen her in... Forever) and asked her if I could order something to eat. She hunted down our girl and she took my order. The sliders came out in a timely manner, and they were delightful. The bacon was thick and cooked to perfection, and just the right amount of peanut butter and jelly really made these juicy burger babies pop. It was close to time for me to head downstairs to see a movie so I put on my best "check please" face and looked around for our server who was once again gone forever. I flagged down another server and asked if I could get my check as the rest of the party was staying but I needed to head out, she found our server (from the abyss, I assume) and she brought me the check. As she handed it to me I said "can you hang on one sec, I'll get you my card right now." And when I turned back around with my card and the bill, she was again gone. As it was now three minutes till I needed to be downstairs I went in and asked someone to run my check or find my girl. Which they did and I speed walked to the movie and was alright. 
           Even though our server was incredibly distracted and the other servers brought other tables food and drink to our table multiple times, and I heard everyone's tales of how this is the standard for their service, I'll still try it again. The food and drinks were awesome, the service just wasn't there. It wasn't the end of the world, but it almost made me late to see magic mike.

Dinner at the bar was enjoyable- nice bartenders and really quick service! Had my order for buffalo cauliflower and the Asian noodle salad in 5-10 minutes after ordering. The happy hour special is great for apps and drinks. The cauliflower was tasty and would perfect as a shared app before a meal. Asian salad was good with shrimp and chicken- had fresh flavors with mango and mint. Great healthy option, but not what you want if you want a really really yummy entree. I was told by a regular to order their pizza next trip in. Great vibe for casual date or hanging out with friends!

It's awesome that Summerlin finally has a good gastropub!  This is a great place to get together and get some good food.  We had the following:

Beers:  They have a seasons selection that changes, if you can't make up your mind you can get little tasters.  I ended up with this golden ale that tasted more like a Guinness but with coffee flavors.  Interesting tasting beer for sure.

Chorizo Mac n Cheese:  AWESOME!  We're fans of salt and vinegar chips so to top off the chorizo Mac n cheese with that just added that extra pop.  It does have some greens, kale, but it's hardly noticeable for those non veggie lovers.

Grilled Watermelon and Heirloom Tomatoes:  Surprisingly this was a great refreshing plate for the summer, definitely a winner in our book.

Chicken and Green Chile Cornbread Waffles:  Heard a lot of great reviews for this, but was a bit disappointed with this one.  The chicken was pretty tender, but the waffle itself was pretty dry and a bit hard to eat without extra gravy and sauce on top of it.

Short Rib:  This dish was delicious!  Tender short rib draped over the mashed potatoes with some grilled onions.  This came out steaming hot, but the flavors were on spot.

Nutella Ice Cream Cookie:  A lot of reviews about this one too, we liked it for the most part but after a few bites it gets too much.  It's a decent size so if you have a group of four it would be perfect to split.  The nice thing about this dessert is the ice cream has bacon bits for those bacon lovers!

Overall the service was great, we had a super friendly waitress.  She was helpful with suggestions and also joked with everyone when she came to the table.  We'll definitely be coming back here!

Simply put, this place rocks.  I went to dinner here last night for some surprise birthday action and was really impressed.  The servers let us slow-play dinner by leaving space between drinks, appy's, and entrees.  I didn't have any appetizers but I did see the faces of those that did...and they were very happy ones. :) A few of the ape's they ordered were: buffalo cauliflower (like hot wings, but fried cauliflower instead) and deviled eggs (looked awesome).

Between the 13 of us, everyone tried lots of different food - I had the farro & brussel salad with seared scallops and it was incredible!  The flavor profile was unique (with a sweet curry dressing) and the scallops were cooked VERY well.  (I feel like it's so easy to screw scallops up, and they did SUCH a good job!)  The bison burger looked fantastic and the mac and cheese looked even better.  

OH - and the beer menu is LEGIT!  PLUS...can we discuss this amazing thing that happened at 9PM?  A crazy buzzer went off and for the next 15 minutes, all the draft beers were just a DOLLAR.  15 minutes later, the buzzer went off again, and they went up to $2. (They do this every 15 minutes til 10PM.) 

Also - one of the servers, Jamie F, was freaking awesome.  I asked her to help me choose what to order and she was super thorough and went through the handful of dishes I had questions about.  (Plus, I ended up getting what I really wanted.)  She even stopped by to make sure I liked it afterward.  She really made the experience THAT much better for us!

I will definitely be back!

The dining selection is creative and fun, but often times the presentation is more enjoyable than the flavor. Great happy hour and drink selection. Their Crispy Ahi Tuna Tacos are a reliable choice for sea food lovers like myself.
It was ok not super impressed with the food but the atmosphere was fun and it's very close to my house but don't know if I would recommend to a friend.
So great. I love Aurelia! She is best! Good times! Love it. All of the the above. Grammar! Public school. Best of time. Always. Love me tender!

My friend and I came here after our long hike at red canyon. We shared bison burger (medium rare) with quinoa salad and beets salad. The burger is so good. The brioche bun was soft and the patty juicy. I was so impressed. The beet salad was okay. It was overly drenched in balsamic dressing. Overall it was a good lunch

My favorite dishes are the Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower and Bacon Cheddar Tots. I have not made a visit without ordering both dishes to start the meal. The Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower ($7) is fried with a buffalo sauce batter; crispy and tender! It's perfectly served with blue cheese aioli and buffalo sauce. I would visit just for this dish! The Bacon Cheddar Tots ($7) are so great; I have to pace myself to make sure I don't devour it too quickly. I don't love the Sriracha Ketchup that accompanies the tots; the flavor is off and seems a bit too sweet. The tots don't need sauce anyway, but it also comes with their fries.

Chicken Sausage, Spinach & Goat Cheese Pizza ($15) with béchamel, roasted tomato, provolone, and chili flakes. I loved this combination of ingredients and it had such a great flavor, though I wish there was more tomato (it was pretty scarce). They also burned the pizza around the edges, so that was unpleasant. But otherwise, great pie.

I've had their Crispy Chicken Sandwich ($14) a couple times and have really enjoyed it. The chicken has a nice crisp and decently moist and I love the slaw. The thing that really puts it over the edge is the sauces; sweet carrot habanero aïoli and mustard BBQ - fantastic! It's served with their Brown Paper Bag Fries. These are decent on the fry scale.

The only dish I haven't liked is their Bangers & Mash. Everything was so odd about it. The flavor of the sausages, the flavor of the mash.. it was not good. My friend and I couldn't take more than a couple bites before shoving it aside.

From brunch, I like the Chicken Sausage & Cheddar Grits ($13) and Eggs Benedict Pizza ($13). The grits are phenomenal and the overall dish just sings; highly recommended. The pizza is good, but needs a touch more prosciutto and hollandaise as it was a bit dry.

I don't always make it to dessert, but I'm really glad I was convinced to try the Nutella Cookie Sandwich ($7). The cookies were surprisingly chewy and oh my, it was heaven with the ice cream, bacon pecan brittle, and Nutella drizzle. You won't regret it.

I reserve the right to increase this the next time I go because I will give them another chance. 702 is located in a real nice/fancy/clean outdoor mall/shopping center. The decor is clever, and the overall restaurant is clean. The support staff is nice and they do try to do their best. After getting seated, it took a solid 7-10 minutes before anyone acknowledged us and asked us for drinks. After that, it took 15-18 minutes before we had our drinks (water came after about 8 minutes). Then another 10 to take our order. Once we ordered, our appetizer took 15 minutes and our food took closer to 25, and my Dad's pizza took another 10 after that!

The food was solid although I wish there were more choices. I visit LV/Henderson/Summerlin area frequently and will try them again. I would suggest working on speeding up the kitchen and the attentiveness of the staff. Other than that, we had a decent experience.

Boyfriend took me here for a surprise brunch! 
LOVE the patio & "almost bottomless" drinks- the bloody-mary is served with a chicken wing & it's amazing, along with the beermosa. 
The Benedict Pizza was really tasty. 
Can't wait to go back!

I took the lunch group to Public School 702 in Downtown Summerlin today! It was so much fun. Great atmosphere. Our waiter was excellent! Everyone said their food was wonderful! Reminds me of the Yardhouse at Red Rock but the food is much better!

This is one of my favorite restaurants in Downtown Summerlin. I enjoyed their chorizo mac & cheese, buffalo cauliflower, and their shrimp & grits! We also ordered their ahi tuna poke, which I wasn't a really a fan of. It comes with this mango tangy sauce, which I don't think belongs with tuna and should belong in a cocktail drink. Food comes out pretty fast and I love the ambiance of the place. It's like I'm having a small picnic in a classroom with their composition journal style menus.

If you're looking for a brunch when almost bottomless mimosas (or beermosas, micheladas, or bloody Mary's) - this is a great spot. You get 4 rounds for $15 but I feel like every time I come here, they're always short staffed so you are probably always going to be waiting for something. 

Besides that, the buffalo cauliflower is a must have, love their "naked wings", the chorizo mac and cheese is a must and the potato nuggets with cheese and bacon are whatever. I always feel like I'm ordering a bunch of small plates here and I'm always satisfied. I never catch myself ordering actual entrees, even for brunch, but some of it looks really good. 

I give our waitress credit for hooking it up with an extra round of mimosas while we waited for our friend to finish her last drink so I'm giving this an extra star, but truly, it was more of a 3-3.5 star kind of rating. Unfortunately, the service has been consistent with every visit whether it be they're short staffed or whatever it may be. 

I'll still be back and still enjoy brunch and happy hour here but will still hope for one day to have more speedy and better service.

This place is a joke! Tried to reserve a table for a bday party for me and my co workers back in June but the manager Nick was being an asshole and never returned my call after calling his cell and calling the restaurant several times and leaving a message with his staff to confirm reservations since it was for a party of 10. This went on for like 2 days of me calling them and them not answering any of my messages. Finally I got fed up and emailed their corporate office and voila the next day Nick emails his apology and is now able to accomodate our party but of course I already made reservations to another place (at Lazy Dog) which literally just took me 2 mins. over the phone to do. So this review is for the service (that I never got) and not for the food or drinks as I never got the chance to try em.

Cool place. Not so great if you want good service, sat at the bar area ordered a beer and two glasses of wine. It took a little over 15 minutes for the drinks, and then the waitress couldn't remember who got what. Place wasn't horribly busy either. Sad, seems like this place could be a lot of fun but not sure we'll be back.

My friend, who is a Vegas and Summerlin local suggested that we check out Public School because it has a cool vibe to it and it was in the new plaza that was built. 

We came in around 9PM on a Sunday night and it wasn't too busy. The hostess told us that we could sit anywhere in the bar area, so we grabbed a table and menus were brought to us almost immediately. Our server then came out with a bottle of water and two cups for us. 

I loved the ambiance here because it was super cute and hipster-like. I felt like this would be a place I could find somewhere in Portland. The decor mirrors that of a classroom, so you have yearbooks, dictionaries, encyclopedias, math cards, and all that jazz around the restaurant. The menus itself look like composition notebooks and the theme is followed through to every aspect of the venue. 

We got the Citra Rye Pale Ale. Now, I'm not much of a beer drinker, but this had a lychee and grapefruit scent that followed the bitterness of the beer, which was nice. I thoroughly enjoyed it, and it wasn't even expensive! $5 for a glass of this goodness. Perhaps this will be my step towards developing a taste for beer. 

We then ordered a brown bag of fries. The fries were perfectly cooked and came with Siracha Ketchup and mustard BBQ sauce. The ketchup overpowered the Siracha so you can smell the Siracha, but the taste of it is very faint. The mustard BBQ sauce almost tastes like honey bbq. Quite interesting.

We also got The Cutting Board, which was an assortment of artisan cheeses and cured meats. We had a goat cheese, blue cheese, and sheep cheese with prosciutto and salami. There was also cashews, jam, onions, and other little things on the board with toasted artisan bread thinly sliced in the middle. All very interesting and tasty. It's chef's choice, so this probably changes from day-to-day. 

I loved the atmosphere of this place and how cool everything is. I'll definitely want to visit again next time I come into town.

Came here last Friday night and just barely missed 'Recess'. 

Overall, not the worst. But for the price, there's a lot of other restaurants that I'd rather visit on a Friday night in downtown Summerlin. 

Appetizer:

We ordered the bacon cheddar tots which were extremely oily, but had a nice creamy inside and the sriracha ketchup added a nice sweet and spicy flavor to it.

Main dishes: 

Chicken burger - forget the name bc it was extremely forgettable. Bland but the chicken was juicy. The side we got was the quinoa which didn't have feta as advertised and was so dry.

Bangers and Mash - chicken sausages were just okay, the mashed potatoes with bacon and shredded sautéed Brussels sprouts were good, but not good enough to save the entire dish. 

BBQ Bison burger - asked for medium rare but it was basically well done. Not extremely flavorful or seasoned. Would pass on this next time. 

The waitress delivered our dishes and dropped a hefty handful of fries on the floor as she was placing a plate on the table. She apologized and we didn't mind, but she said she'd come back with more fries to make up for it...which she never did. And we couldn't find her after that incident so we couldn't ask to follow up. 

Beer flight:

The IPA was actually not half bad, and the earthy hop was average. It's nice to have the option of a $5 sampler. 


Overall:
Nice atmosphere to gather with friends and get appetizers during the happy hour. Main entrees and ordering appetizers post recess/hh not worth it.
Cheesy bacon brussels mash. I need it more than the air I breath. I have tried multiple dishes from Public School over the past month and keep on coming back for more. I have yet to be disappointed!

Came here for lunch with my coworkers and I got a pepperoni pizza. It was super greasy and not crunchy at all. There was barely cheese on the pizza. The sauce wasn't enough. I could only taste the plain soggy dough.

If you haven't tried this place you are seriously missing out. The patio is a must and everything on the menu is amazing. A completely cool experience. And if you can land Vanessa as a server you are in for a a great education in the beers they offer both on special and the regular menu. She rocks!

Loved the atmosphere and how everything is school themed. Our waitress was extremely prompt when bringing us more of the unlimited mimosas. Even brought a carafe to make it easier. The food was absolutely delicious!

For starters, we made a reservation for a group to sit on the patio. When we got there, they said we would have to wait 2 hours to sit on the patio, so we ended up sitting inside. What was the point of making a reservation, if we needed to wait 2 hours? Our waitress was inattentive and mediocre at best. We tried to order drinks, but they didn't have most of what we wanted. What bar in Las Vegas doesn't have Red Bull, Belvedere vodka, Captain Morgan and fireball? We ordered the naked wings and requested ranch dressing, but they said they never have ranch dressing. 

The empty glasses kept accumulating on our table as we ordered round after round of drinks. She never took the empty glasses away. Our waitress disappeared for a long periods of time, even though they weren't really even that busy. When we asked for our checks at the end of the meal, they were all incorrect.  

In the ladies restroom, there was a complete mess. There was no toilet paper in the stalls and the floors were messy. When we left the restaurant, I told the hostess. She asked me if anybody vomited in the restroom. She made it sound as if a lack of vomit on the floor, made all the rest of the mess acceptable.

This is a very cool trendy new bar! I went here for brunch and had the best chicken and waffles ever! The green chili cornbread waffles were so tasty and very original. The menu here is somewhat limited, but the entrées are unique and made from high-quality ingredients. The jungle juice cocktail was a refreshing drink. They also have a nice variety of draft beer including some rare taps.

Had happy hour for the day after my wedding which turned out to be a party of 25.  Sat in the casual dining area; with 2 tables of 10.  Appetizers are super reasonable at $4, $5, $6, and $7.  Beers are $7.  I had the sliders, hummus & flatbread, and the wings.  Was a great way to end our wedding weekend

Went to check out Public School last Tuesday since I live right by Downtown Summerlin. The vibe was pretty chill and our waitress was cute & attentive. Got the cutting board as our appetizer but how could you mess up cheese, cold cuts and bread right?..Went with the pepperoni pizza as our main which was the biggest mistake of my life (gross, greasy and salty). Literally equivalent to eating Little Caesars that someone drenched with 2 lbs of oil. Was gonna complain but our waitress Courtney, but she recommended good wine so I liked her; plus I ate it all because I was dying of starvation. Conclusion: never order the pizza at Public School. We probably should have gone with the shrimp and grits our waitress recommended as the Summers Cabernet she recommended was good. 

Cheers!

Fantastic happy hour, great light bites such as the mushroom fontina flatbread and the deviled eggs...yes...the eggs! The decor is quirky and unique but just what you'd expect at Public School. Make sure to get there before the "buzzer" to take advantage of their entire happy hour menu!!

We wanted to try this place out and sorry to say we were not impressed. My wife and I each tried a different burger. I had the bison BBQ burger and she had the moody burger. Both were middle of the road, not great but not horrible. We had our sons girlfriend with us, she had the shrimp and grits. According to her no flavor for the dish. 

Service was slow and not that together.  Water took over 5 minutes to get when we first sat down and that's after it took our waitress awhile to even greet us. I asked for extra catsup and when she finally brought it put it in front of my sons girlfriend. Not sure if she was new or not, but definitely needs work.

A mixed bag. The tomato and watermelon salad was amazing as was the fried chicken and waffles. No issues with the food at all. The service was wonky. It was early, 5:00 on a Tuesday, and they couldn't seem to figure out who was supposed to be waiting on us. We plan on giving it another shot because the food was great. Beautiful space too, and fortunately it was mostly empty when we were there because I bet it gets crazy loud when it's full.
Did stay the "Whole" Restaurant was on break for 20 Minutes!  Whet To California Pizza in stead.

I like the whole theme of this restaurant. It takes ya back to the elementary school days. As you walk through the dining area, you come upon these giant globes hanging from the ceiling, which reminded me just of the solar system in my school library. We were seated at a table with chairs, but there are also booths and bar seating. The chairs are a cute small scale black metal chair, of course following the school motif, but are not at all comfortable. It's very noisy in here, but it didn't affect our conversation too much. The menu is very different, but some safe choices too. Bangers and mash, fish and chips, pizza, etc. I ordered the Mac and cheese app as my meal accompanied with a cup of tortilla soup. The soup was forgotten and I had to ask for it, not a big deal..it wasn't too spicy, just the right amount. The Mac had chorizo in it, which I found way too salty. My friend had fish and chips. She said it was good, but the fries were even better! As an appetizer, we opted for the calamari. It came with a ginger aioli that was delish. The calamari was heavily breaded, but ok. I'd like to go back when it's a bit warmer as they have outdoor seating looking down on the courtyard. We asked for a to-go box and also received a brown paper bag labeled 'homework', so cute!
Place is legit great beer selection friendly staff and a nice party scene highly recommend. O ya this cool ass doctor bought shots for the whole bar!
Holy crap. Haven't got the food yet but this place is so dam LOUD. Won't be back. Literally two people over, can't hear a dam thing. Is this their first go around designing an eatery? Sheesh.

Service was beyond sub-par. After we were seated we did not get greeted by our server for at least 8-10 minutes. When she finally came by it was just to say "I'll be right with you" and then she proceeded to pick up dishes from empty tables and talk to the table next to us about desert. She finally came back and took our order and our appetizer came out shortly after but it was cold. The food was just average. Our water glasses also stayed empty the whole time we were there and not once did we get offered a refill. We noticed that every other table actually had a water carafe to refill their own glasses but we did not. We definitely won't be returning here, a friend highly recommended this place so I had way higher expectations and they were not fulfilled at all. I can honestly say the only thing I enjoyed about this place was the view from the outdoor seating

This place is awesome!! My family and I had Dinner here for my Birthday. We had the chorizo Mac n Cheese and the cutting board for starters...it was awesome!!! We were suggested a few favorites from the staff... so we ordered every recommendation. The chicken sandwich with truffle fries was to die for...all the amazing flavors from sweet to a kick of spice and combined with the truffle fries...Omgee!!! Your mouth was exploded with the variety of flavors...the shrimp & grits- who would think of having that.....I tell you it was the bomb!!! You were right Jane...writing this review is having me craving for more!!! The highlight of our dinner was the manager Jane!!! She was awesome at answering all our questions and made our experience more memorable with her upbeat and positivity!! Thank you Jane and your Team!!

I don't write many reviews as Yelp can testify to! Lol! . It is our anniversary and we decided to come here. I had the skirt steak and Brussels sprouts and my husband had the fish and chips. They were both fabulous!  The service was OK, but the food was awesome! We had the bacon cheddar tator tots for an app and they were good too. Best fish fry is Las Vegas that we have found - and that is coming from Wisconsinites! Go Public School 702! We will come back!:)

This is my absolute favorite restaurant. I love the atmosphere, they sometimes have live music and there are usually always a good amount of people there. I really enjoy the cauliflower for a starter. The burgers are great as well. My favorite thing is definitely the shrimp and grits or the bangers and mash. Can't go wrong with this restaurant!

I went last night with a couple of girlfriends to check it out. Overall, it was just...decent. I like the theme and ambiance. They carried the school theme out very well in the decor and it was fun. We ordered food off the happy hour and regular menu. My friend got the Parmesan fries, which were excellent, and the wings and cauliflower which she said were just ok/good. My other girlfriend ordered the poblano and quinoa. The pepper was good but the rice was very bland; almost no flavor at all. For $16- not with it. I ordered the margherita pizza, which was good, once I got it. Unfortunately, they forgot to make it so it took awhile. The good thing is they comped it, which was nice and done so without me asking. 

My only complaint is the drink prices. I spent $27 on two glasses of wine. And it was nothing special, just house Chardonnay. $11/glass is outrageous for a house glass of wine. I also noticed happy hour beers were very, very limited. Regular cocktail prices were upwards of $15-$16 a piece. 

Overall, it was decent. I probably won't go back unless it ends up being a meeting place decided on by others.

Average burger n fries. Good beer choices. Service people have good intentions, no exprience. My burgee was punched in as a different item (ext$4) and i never received the last beer order. Waited 15 min. Didnt wanna argue over the bill. ( last beer wasnt charged just never received) when the weather is nice, patio is worth it.
One of the best happy hours I've ever been to, great choices, great pricing. Love it, I'd go back anytime

Public school impressed me. The concept was creative. We had the chicken and grits.
Our waitress was Ruth, amazing! Down to earth, knowledgeable, and to be frank,  she's very charismatic. The only thing better than the food was the service (see previous paragraph) -  this place did it right!!!!!

I have been twice and both times I had terrible service. The first time I went in for happy hour with a group of 5. After the server took our order we never saw him again until we had to flag him down for the check. In addition to our non-existent waiter, we didn't receive our drinks until we had already received the check. I decided to give them a second chance and went in last night for industry night at around 9 o'clock. We sat in the bar area and I had high hopes because they were NOT busy. I saw at least 3 waiters walk past our table with no acknowledgement towards us. After waiting 20 minutes with no one coming by to take our order we left. We decided to go to The Yard House where the bartenders are friendly and the service is great! I will not return to Public School 702.

Shady service! Put down a few hundred to open up a tab at the bar for a few beers then we order a few appetizers at the table while playing games. They opened two tabs and the bartender says we closed out his tab and have to pay for the second one. Basically pocketed the rest of the cash. He wouldn't show us the tab he closed out either. Garbage.

Such an awesome place and the service was on point. I was a little disappointed to see that their menu was not more expansive but still found great items to eat.

Their menu seems to me to be more about their beer and drinks. The ambiance is great and would be an awesome place to hang out, eat, and drink with friends without having to go to the club. 

We sat on the patio area of the restaurant and it was beautiful. The conversation was good, so we didn't realize that our food hadn't come out for an hour. Our waitress was very attentive and was actually the one that brought it up to attention. They came back up to us to apologize and bought another round of drinks for us. Awesome save Public School 702.

Loved the atmosphere and choices of beers. This place reminded me of restaurants in San Diego! Service was really good and their cocktails were very yummy. Passion fruit mojito tastes really refreshing. And I forgot the name but the coffee  cocktail they have was good and strong. The food however, was mehhhh. The ahi poke was decent with the passion fruit sauce in there but the fish didn't taste fresh. Now on to the entree. I got fish and chips and wow, the inside was less barely warm and there was wayyyy too much batter. I ended up just eating the fish on the inside and left out the batter. Fries could be crispier. They were too soggy in my opinion. Definitely ask for the bbq honey sauce to dip your fries in. All in all, I would come back here just for drinks and maybe some bar food during happy hour. I don't think their entrees are worth the $$$.

I finally made it over to public school this week after hearing so much about it.   Maybe I went in with my expectations too high but I thought it was just ok.  I thought the beer selection was really nice but my burger was just OK and very pricey.   I think it's cheaper to eat on the strip!   I do like the patio and the vibe so I'll bump it up to 4 stars.
This place has the best happy hour and our bartender Conner was amazing! Super knowledgeable about all the different kinds of beers and definitely made our experience awesome!

Food and service were good, appetizer fries were small. We asked for outside seating when making the reservation but was told none available and could not accommodate. We did watch as walk-ins were taken outside and seated after we were seated inside. Public School 702 does not give military discounts either.

This is our go to place when my wife and I want to have good beer and something light to eat. The appetizers are on point, and the shrimp and grits is the best around. You can never go wrong with the fish and chips. Also has an amazing atmosphere. Make sure to order the buffalo cauliflower  it's like eating healthy chicken wings

Ate here with my hubby couple months ago. Superb food. Very clean reataurant...Atmosphere was on point abd though menu was surprisingly small, the quality was there. Had an excellent time. My husband even got a surprise message from the GM because we were happy with the restaurant and staff and service...he was comped a nice gift card! Thanks public school we will be dining in pretty soon! I do recommend bison burgers snd some of their local brews!

Had a very fun time here. The energy was uplifting and positive as the servers all looked to be enjoying their job. The service was outstanding. Amanda was our server and she made our time spent there very pleasurable. She was very knowledgable about the menu and drinks, and was more than willing to explain items as well as offer beer samples. The grilled watermelon was excellent. Had a burger which was cooked just the way I ordered it. I can see this eatery only getting better. They are off to a great start. Will return!!

This place was super fun we are thinking about making it an every Sunday funday spot. We had a large group and were well taken care of by our waitress BRITTANY, she did a great job and was super friendly. The brunch menus had some great options as did the drink menus

The swordfish was great but my son's fish and chips wasn't good. It was very dry and bland and didn't have any flavor to it all without putting sauce on it. 
I doubt we will return for future meals.

The food is still very fresh, the margaritas were excellent and the service was great.  My only complaint was this place is now loud as heck.  The architecture and high ceilings seem to make this place into an amplifier turned in on itself.  We literally had to shout to talk and only got about half of what the waitress was saying.

Was invited at last minute to a wine event, rock n roll wine hosting. The appearance is very chic and modern reminding me of something on the East Coast where I'm from. Just ordered the crispy buffalo cauliflower, hold on...Holy Moley! Thanks Bree for the heads up. Its delicious and I can taste why its voted a best here in Vegas. I put that ish on everythang! Will be back

Emily and Jason were amazing. My fiancé is allergic to mushrooms and we completely forgot to tell them no mushrooms. We were distracted talking about our wedding and forgot to mention to mushrooms. We told Emily we were so sorry and forgot to tell them no mushrooms. Without a problem after making a burger that had mushrooms, Jason was able to make a new one without any hesitation. I loved their energy. They were just concerned about my fiancé and trying to make sure he didn't take a bite of the burger that had mushrooms. Plus Jason had so much energy and passion. I worked in customer service and I can tell when someone enjoys their job and loves to make customers happy.
Great food great beers. Service is hit or miss at times. Has improved tremendously since the first week they opened. The patio is impressive and big.

I thought this place was so cool! Everything is set up like a school, hence the name. Our menus looked like a composition note book and the specials for brunch were on a scan-tron set up menu. I thought it was really clever and liked the concept.

You can sit inside or outside but since it was summertime in Las Vegas we sat inside. 

The chairs were a little uncomfortable but overall not bad. 

I decided to get bottomless bloody marys. They were only $10 which I thought was a great price. I could only get two though because it was so spicy and I started to get heart burn. Next time I'd try the bottomless mimosas instead so I wouldn't get heartburn. 

We started with the deviled eggs. They used a chipotle sauce which made them taste amazing! I highly recommend them.

I then got the veggie pizza. I should have shared it with someone because it wasn't personal sized. It tasted really good! It had goat cheese on it so I knew it would. Its a white based pizza as well which was a nice change of pace.

Our waiter was really friendly and knowledgeable. I would visit this place again.

Went here for date night before a movie, wait was 20mins so we sat in the bar area. Took forever to get drinks. Server was friendly. Order poke for app which was great. Husband ordered steak salad and didn't like the dressing. I order the tacos, you get 2, 2 as a meal... I took one bite, GROSS! The meat was so rare it was chewy and soft and basically seemed old. I don't like sending food bad. I'm giving 2 stars thanks to the staff and poke app. I won't be back, I feel like I wasted $75 on a meal, pretty disappointed!
Jess and "Thor" were awesome servers.  The food was very good.  Interesting cauliflower appetizer in a good way.  We were too full for dessert but they sounded delish.

Love the patio seating here. It's perfect for a beautiful brunch or even a nice dinner al fresco... The only con for the patio seating during brunch is the sun can shine directly at you but what can ya do?! 

Our server was really sweet though it took her some time to get to our table... She answered all questions and gave us her recommendations.
The food was just ok. We shared chicken and waffles and a healthy egg scramble. The chicken was bone in and the gravy was thick. The scramble had lots of veggies. 

We also got the bottomless bubbles but their "bottomless" certainly has a bottom as it is 4 drinks per guest. You can get a carafe of mimosa and that constitutes as 3 drinks and then you can get a bloody. The Bloody Mary was way too thick and spicy. I wouldn't get it. It doesn't go down that well after eating and didn't satisfy my Bloody Mary craving. You can also get a bloody beer/Michelada. 

We may be back for the outdoor seating. The prices are not that bad. BTW, love the school theme on the napkins and menus!

HOT TIP: Recess/Happy Hour at the bar. Mon-Fri 3:30-6:30. Discounts on brews, wines, & bites!

Wish there were different categories to rate:

Fish and chips were pretty good, flaky, needed a touch of salt and maybe pepper.

We ordered a flight, our understanding was it would be 5 tastes......only got 3-  had to send 2 of them back for dirty glasses,  

Waitress was seemingly upset we were there- probably the first customers if the day, guess we interferes with gossip time.
Food is good, service is all over the place. Forgetting orders throughout not just at our table. Service needs to step up a lot.

Heard about this from a fellow Yelper and last minute changed my plans to go here instead of Cheesecake Factory! I'm glad I made the change and so was my friend.

We came in and the placed was very spacious, well lighted with natural light from the glass windows. The globes on the ceiling was very nostalgic. So were the chalk boards and even down to that weird smelling brown paper towels they used in elementary school (I know they also use it at other places but still).

Another surprise was when we were sat down and saw the menu. The throwback to the notebook, the scanttron test menu for brunch and the napkins! Once we were down with the nostalgia overload (and I so wanted to grab a pencil #2 and fill in the test ), my friend and I went through the menu. 

Everything was decently priced and we so wanted to order everything but we had to control ourselves. Our waitress, Kaila, suggested we do the Beermosa... wow. I didn't think beer and champagne would be great together but I was proven wrong. That and $10 for a bottomless, why not?

We ordered the mezze plate, mac and cheese and ahi tuna nicoise.

Mezze plate looked like it could feed 3-4 people but between me and my friend we did our best. The highlight was the nice firm and not too salty marinated feta, tapenade and hummus. The Flatbread was nicely grilled and perfect. Downside was the babaghanoush needed more citrus and salt/seasoning. The fried chickpeas was ok. But for next time I will try and see if they can accommodate a double babaghanoush and hummus only :-3

Ahi tuna nicoise was great.  Big portion. Would serve 1 person for a full lunch meal but great split between two people. We were given the wrong salad initially ( we were served the scallop and Brussels sprouts salad... was so tempted to say yes that it was our salad and that she forgot  our ahi but we are definitely coming back to try that salad ). The dressing was great. Perfect citrus notes and  not too over powering. The take on the eggs being served "deviled" style was a nice surprise. Bibb lettuce had not lost its very little crunch to it (meaning the salad was perfectly dressed). The one thing we did not care for was the potatoes.  It seemed like an after thought to their composition as it had no salt/seasoning. Trying to mix it with the salad dressing didn't save it so we just picked around it.

The fact that we had to stop ourselves with this order should tell you the portions are great. We got the bacon mac and cheese.. and man seeing those salt and vinegar chips on top.. I was in love with the dish. Not too cheesey and not too dry. One of the best mac and cheeses (sorry for me you guys haven't beat out Beecher's Mac and Cheese).

These little nuances is not the cause of the 4 star rating.  The rating mostly goes to the amount  of Beermosa refills we had. You guys have definitely beat out DW Bistro for my go to brunch place from now on, but the lag on the drink refills was the one that did you in. My tip to myself for future visits and to others with a small group... sit at the bar and see if they can fill up your drinks on the fly without the wait.

Other than that I will definitely be back along with some friends in the near future!  Definitely have to come back and try the Recess!

Excellent food but if you're coming here for bottomless mimosas go to Whist over in Green Valley. We were here for three hours and got 2 mimosas. Slow service and they pre make them so they are flat. Horrible, hands down the worst bottomless mimosa brunch in Vegas.

My teacher friends and I have the chance to be students at PS702 on Friday, June 19th. I can truly say I have never had more fun, good food and great atmosphere in my life. There were 10 of us total and we tried EVERYTHING on the menu, food and drinks. We played some other the games and just soaked the place in. It was fantastic. We had so much fun we will be having are July birthday celebration there.
I love this place !!!  The buffalo cauliflower is the best the service is perfect . It might be a wait but it is worth it ..

The decor is cool and appropriate, the foh staff is nice and friendly. Our orders were taken well and given some good suggestions. They need some more popular beers on tap though, not just forcing you to drink a craft beer. The menu had some nice and some not nice ideas. I ordered the flat iron steak (medium rare) and it came rare, way too many potato chip on top of the Mac and cheese it came with. Also found a old dried out piece of Canadian bacon in my Mac and cheese, turned me off to the whole meal after that. Decent ideas for food but you probably have inexperienced cooks behind the line cause from experience that's what it seems like to screw up such an expensive but simple dish. Probably won't come back for a long time. Grape street is still way better.

I had the best server ever!!! Her name was Britney Craig and she was excellent on knowledge, service, personality, and most importantly kind.
I like the food! Interesting menu with spice. Some people can't have spice or like it but in my case.....I Love it! Britney was excellent! I am a server and have been for over 27 years. I have been in restaurant business and own a catering business as well. She gets five stars!! Seriously if you go there ask for her and you will not be disappointed!! PS my favorite dish is the spicy shrimp and pasta ( not the actual name of it and it has chorizo in it as well)

Had lunch here at PS702 at DTS and it was awesome! Great gastropub food! Typically I haven't been a fan of this style of food but PS702 does it right! Great portion sizes, wait staff and host were great! I'm excited to go back again and try different things!!!

Very nice place to go.  Justin is great and greats you like an old friend he hasn't seen in a while, whether he k it's you or not.  Love their happy hour specials.   Food is good and they will do anything to make sure you leave satisfied.   Great place.  Outdoors is nice as well. Will definitely be back!
Great place for lunch!  Would definitely come back for dinner. Mandi was a GREAT server. Have indoor and patio seating. Will be back for sure!

I've been here for both brunch and dinner and everything I've ordered has been delicious. The place has a really fun atmosphere and the servers and staff are friendly. If you like beer, they have a great beer list. Their brunch menu is one of the best in town. My personal favorites are the chicken and waffles or the French toast. I highly recommend this spot!

This place is so cute and different from any other restaurant bar. 
However, the food isn't amazing. It's pretty normal. The menu is pretty small for both lunch and dinner. 
It's a good place to drink with friends! They have a "study group" section in the menu where you can share a variety of different beers- which is cool! 
I'd rather go to a more local bar for happy hour.

I should've listened to the reviews about the bad service and avoided this place all together. My boyfriend and I walked in to no one standing at the hostess stand except for a miserable waitress who just rolled her eyes when my boyfriend said hello to her. We proceeded to the bar only to be disappointed once again by a bartender who didn't have time to properly greet or acknowledge us. Long story short we decided this place was not worth our time or money and left. It's too bad because it seemed like this place had potential.

My co-worker and I went here for happy hour and loved their food. The Buffalo cauliflower was delicious! We also tried the deviled eggs, truffle fries and wings - all were good. We were sad that the milk stout was unavailable but we are looking forward to our next visit.
Amazing service, amazing brunch, amazing atmosphere. Request Peter!! He's the best! Will definitely come back for more Rosé beer pong!

We went here for brunch last Sunday.  The all you can drink was cheap.  The food was mediocre.  My girlfriend became sick off her Bloody Mary she received so we had to leave abruptly.  The service was good though.

First visit to Public School! I've lived in Summerlin for only a few months after moving from Cali. My sister came to visit and we were on the hunt for food and drinks with a cool environment. My sister came across Public School, i mentioned to her I knew of it but had never been. We got here at about 8:45p with closing approaching at 10p. We were seated right away by the hostess. Our Server Aurelia took care of us, gave us enough time to look over the drink order. We ordered the Rose to drink, Brussels, cauliflower bites, and poblano with quinoa and so much other good stuff to share. Everything was HOT, FRESH, and so delicious. They also were accommodating with adjusting our order to vegan friendly! Which can get complicated for my sister and I but it was no problem here. Aurelia checked on us and she was awesome, and friendly! Also ordered the chicken sandwich Togo, she gave me all the sauces I asked for on the side and nothing was missed. Toward the end of our meal we had a visit from the GM, Kevin. He was very kind and welcomed us to Public School! Not only will I be back with other friends but I know my sister and I will return together. Thank you Aurelia and Kevin! See you soon :)

Great place to eat. Server was a bit slow but she was overwhelmed by a large group of 10-15 as well as several filled tables nearby. The food was awesome and their seasonal beers are always delicious. I'd recommend the mac and cheese as a side with any meal, it was a favorite at our table.

Great location.  I enjoyed the food,  although my husband wasn't impressed will his frito pizza.   It's very up close and personal.  The guests sit very close to one another.  The music is ridiculously loud,  so you can't hear what the person next to you is saying.  I guess that could be good or bad,  depending on who you are with.   I liked my party of 4, so felt the "noise" was a bit much.  It looks like they are going for a young crowd, with the music and noise, but attract a variety of ages.... they should consider toning it down to fit into their clientele.

This place was really really good!!!!! We got the tots, calamari, huntsman burger, and the ccb. We also tried the temperanillio wine, a local IPA beer, and this blackberry Moscow mule type of drink. Everything came out in a timely manner, the interior was beautiful, and all of the food was amazing!
My only complaint was the soggy burger bun, and everything was a bit pricy for what it was but this restaurant is a very typical hipster restaurant.

Overall I will be back to try the rest of the beer and to try everything else!

It's been a while since we've been here and honestly I cant remember every detail on how our visit went. But what I can remember is what this review will be based on. 

We came during lunch on a weekday. Probably the best time to come because we were seated right away. Had a nice seat with a view by the window. The place is decorated nice! Its modern but with a school theme. 
Hence the name. 

I quickly started to notice the small things. Like the USB Plugs at every table.. The Composition Looking Menu.. The Edison Light Bulbs..
ALSO the dirty cloth napkin that was sitting in front of me. White cotton napkin. I was wearing black and being the gentleman that I am I placed the white napkin on my lap. That was a mistake. I didnt have my lint roller with me. 
Our waitress brought us our water. 2 dirty glasses and a dirty glass bottle filled with chilled tap water. 
Were they even washed?? 
2 strikes.. Waiting for the 3rd??
I ordered a drink (diet coke). On the menu it never stated that they were tiny bottles and they were $2.50! I told the waitress.. I wish it said that on the menu or was disclosed that when I ordered..most big restaurants/pubs have soda on tap.
Well this was really disappointing. 

On to the food.

For starters we tried the Bacon Cheesy Tots. It was a recommendation from our waitress. 
Deep fried golden brown to perfection. Crispy outside and high in flavor! Sriracha Ketchup on the side! Yum!!

BBQ Bison Burger with Quinoa Salad - Wow! They can really make a damn good burger!!  Patty was grilled to perfection (medium-well) for me. The BBQ sauce was good and not too sweet. The Quinoa was cooked perfect as well. 

Now this is what I dont remember.. My wife ordered a HotDog of some sort. I checked the online menu and I didn't see it. Maybe it was a special or something. 
Bun was toasted yet soft center. The hot dog itself was overcooked. Like something you see inside 7-11 when they've been sitting on the rollers for hours upon hours. But, the toppings on it made up for it. 

It was an ok visit for our lunch date. 
I'll try it again. Maybe a dinner date with my beautiful wife.

Two trips here and two very different experiences.  I want to really like this place...location is great, decor and vibe is good...what's inconsistent is the service and food. I ordered the Bison Burger for myself and a kids slider new for my daughter...the sliders came out like rocks and had to be returned. Not sure why they ever left the kitchen? Staff...I don't know. First visit a month ago the waitress was great, attentive, etc...last night like it was a hassle and just not interested. I don't know...maybe an off night, but not a good second impression.

Updating my review. I decided to give this place another try. Came for lunch on Tuesday afternoon. (4-12-17) Again the menu seems limited but I ordered the edamame hummus which was good. I would've been happy with a side salad along with the hummus but they don't even offer that. Just ordered water this time. Our waitress was great though, I wish I knew her name. Although my thoughts of the menu are the same, at least the service was much better this time. I probably won't return here to eat again, the options just aren't appealing and they're very limited for plant based diets.

First timers today at PS 702! The food was delicious! Great ambiance and very clean restaurant. We started with the speck and eggs and the bacon cheddar tots with sriracha ketchup. Both were good. The speck and eggs didn't have a lot of flavor so I found myself dipping a lot. Then we moved on to lunch I got the green chili soup of the day it was amazing a little spicy but we'll made. My husband got the American burger which does not come with cheese heads up! An American burger with no cheese WHAT!?!? So he added American cheese go figure :) my sons shared a kids cheese pizza and let me tell you it was huge. So parents if you want to save a little money since the restaurant is pricey order 1 kids cheese pizza for all the kids it really is that big!!! 

 I gave a 4 star review instead of a 5 for a couple of reasons. One my husband is a soda drinker and it is not complimentary refills! He was not happy about that! They only have bottled soda! That just isn't right especially when they do have spicy foods! The second reason I took away a star is because the food took a while to come out and I mean 30 minutes! For a medium cooked burger, cheese pizza, and a cup of premade chili to take 30 minutes is just ridiculous. I feel like there is no excuse for that especially on a saturday for brunch when they should be properly staffed. Other then that the restaurant was great and our server was pleasant. We will be back my husband fell in love with the burger and skinny fries! 

Little tip for all you craft beer lovers they have an epic list!

Super excited for a new gastropub near me! Vegas needs to get down with gastropubs and open up more. 

First off, the structure itself is really awesome. From the patio, the decor to the vibes. 
They have an excellent craft brew selection and the food was excellent. No complaints on that!

The only thing was service. I really struggled giving this place 4 stars but I had to go with 3 because our waiter was horrible. He was super nice, but he literally never checked on us and kept forgetting our drinks. We kept having to ask other waiters to get them for us. I don't think it was his area, but still, he wasn't busy. We went on a Sunday night at 8 and didn't leave until 10 because it took forever to get anything. That's a huge downer.

For the beer: I had Dawn of the Red. It was amazing. It's a hoppier amber with fruit notes. It's now one of my favorites. 

Food: 
Fiery Calamari - very good and fried perfectly. It wasn't spicy at all though.
Shrimp and Grits -  It was super tasty. The grits are more of a grits cake and it has so much in it with a ton of flavor. The sauce was very rich and spicy. 
Beef short rib with parmesan mashed potatoes - it was very good and the au jus gravy was very rich. 
The NUTELLA COOKIE SANDWICH. I'm going to be 100% honest. I'm not a dessert person. But when I saw this cookie on Yelp, I decided to go here solely for that purpose. And friends, it did NOT disappoint. It was the best cookie and ice cream dessert I've ever had in my life. The cookie was all gooey and soft. So perfect. 

Overall - I loved this place. I saw other servers being super tentative to their tables. We just got super unlucky. I would love to go again soon to try out other dishes and other yummy beers.

PS702 hosted a group dinner for me for participants in a class I'm running at my company.  We used the beautiful outdoor dining as a private space, and loved playing jumbo sized Jenga and Connect4, the food was WONDERFUL!  Apps and a fixed price menu were well received by the guests - something for everyone, including our vegetarians.  But most of all, Victoria, whose name is bigger than she is, was a powerhouse as our server! She was friendly, attentive, accurate and accommodating. Great time was had by all last night!  Thank you Victoria and PS702!
Great experience and fantastic food! We sat outside and enjoyed the view. Super low key and not loud at all. The staff is really attentive and great with recommendations.

Not a bad restaurant. The customer service was great. The service was great. The food was "meh"..... Naked wing and bacon & cheese tator tots were ok. Had lots of sea salt on them. I love seasonings but this was a tad bit salty. I would go back and try something different.
Service was excellent and the food was delicious. We will Def be back soon for recess.

This was an awesome gastropub! We went here yesterday for a date night and were not disappointed! There was a little bit of a wait if you wanted an actual table but it wasn't long and it was a Saturday night so what else can you expect. Our waiter was great. He was very helpful with suggestions of food and beer. He also let us know about the specials they offer throughout the week. We ordered the kale Caesar salad, bangers and mash, and bison burger. Everything was fantastic! My fiancé enjoyed his beers as well. The service was also very quick but we didn't feel rushed or anything.    We also loved the atmosphere and the decor. We would definitely come back here. I can't wait to try the rest of their menu.

So upsetting! PS702 is not family friendly, rude waiter, bad service, reluctant to serve people with children, burnt sliders, RAW chicken. Not much else to say....we have been going there since the 2nd day it was opened. We've been dozens of times without kids and twice as a family and both times bad which is more of an indication they don't want to serve families.

Food is amassing. 
Atmosphere is totaly unique. 
Food and beer specials are totally affordable. 
I found out there are more than one so i guess ill have to try them all.
Deserts are the worlds best.
Thank you Chef Ramon Castro.

None of the entree items actually sound enticing... They're over-priced, and flavors are meh. Gave it two tries, same impression both times. The theme of this restaurant is the most interesting thing about it.

This place is truly amazing.  The concept is fun,  but the food is actually incredible and original.  I went with a friend that is very picky, and she loved everything.   There was a pepper dish km particular that she actually came home and tried to make. I'll be coming back for sure!

I came here on a Wednesday night after watching a movie. This perhaps is my second or third time here at Downtown Summerlin. (I just recently moved to the northwest of town from the south side. It's definitely a much better atmosphere here. )

Back to what matters, the drinks definitely seemed more appealing than the food menu. Most options have bacon bits and being that I don't eat pork made it annoying. I ended up getting the Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower and Irish Stout Braised Short Rib to share. I definitely recommended both to try!!  It full of flavor and a great portion size. 

Im really big on customer service and as a new spot I definitely feel like the staff our waitress in particular wasn't very attentive to discussing what was best to try and lacked knowledge of the menu. It took her 20 minutes for our check. 

Overall it was cool and might visit again for the patio experience.

We went here for brunch, it was a very pleasant atmosphere over looking the summerlin shopping area .
The place was clean and had a great theme going it really did look like school.
There's lots of drinking games and fun to be had and would be a awesome pre drinking area although we went for Sunday they did do bottomless mimosas they didn't look that appealing and they hadn't quite crated the right atmosphere for a raging good Sunday sesh.
The food was good the shorty bowl was potatoe crunch thing which goes great with the short rib.
I can't remember the name of the burger however it was good too and the ketchup was awesome.
All round for the price and theme that the place is going for its worth 5 stars.

I have gone here for brunch on 2 occasions, and both times have been simply wonderful. I ordered the chicken sausage grits with the "just about bottomless" mimosas. First off, the grits were like heaven in my mouth. Crispy on the outside and soft, perfect texture on the inside. This alone made me want to come back for more. Secondly, the mimosas were delicious. For brunch they actually have several drinks options you can choose from - mimosas, beermosas, bloody Mary's, or michelada - and you can have 4 of them in any combination you'd like for just $10, which I can say is more than plenty! The staff were friendly on both occasions and the atmosphere was great for socializing. There are also TV's for those people who want to get their football fix.

Came here for happy hour after work with some coworkers and I was not impressed. We asked for a table and all the happy hour seatings were taken so we had to sit outside in the hot humidity. The table we originally sat at had a broken fan and all the other booths that had fans were taken... Luckily we had to move since we had more people join us that originally planned.

The food was alright. It wasn't the best I've had and their beer selection was okay. I wouldn't recommend this place for a happy hour event.

Josh (in the Guinness hat circa 2009) was OK...

But the cauliflower was decent. Wish they had ranch, Josh suggested we go to Wolfgang Puck instead
A great place to come and hang out especially during happy hour. They have a great selection of beers that you'll have a hard time finding anywhere else in Las Vegas. Check them out!

I'm definitely pleased to have encountered Chef Shea and he encouraged me to give this location another chance after a couple bad visits.

On this recent visit I was immediately greet by Victoria who had a fantastic smile and energetic personality - a definite plus for a hostess and significant improvement over prior staff choices.

We ordered several items and were please with each. We hope that corporate will allow for the menu to be changed to be more accommodating to variety of tastes and allow the chefs to perform as they should!

Please add STEVIA to the sweeteners!

Jane was the manager this visit and was a significant improvement over prior managers. She should be the GM and handle customer interactions.This location is in a great spot in Downtown Summerlin and has some impressive indoor and outdoor seating to include USB outlets at some of the tables for charging devices.

The restrooms were very spacious and clean, and the staff were super friendly and energetic. This location really needed a management change and I am glad to see it happening.

This is a great place for a night on the town.
Great atmosphere. Inside is a little loud for the large group we had. We could not hear across the table. Outside when weather is nice would be great. They have beer pong, jenga, etc.. Tvs outside to watch sports, great small bar outside hidden in back..
Will go back for nighttime drinks on the patio.

WORST EXPERIENCE IN DINING I HAVE EVER HAD. 

I've been here one time before and was reluctant to try another dish a friend of mine had. From first experience the food isn't as great and the price does not fit the quality for most dishes. However the truffled steak and macaroni was a big hit to me and felt that, that was the only reason to come. The server (at the time) was a big sweetheart and was another reason why I wanted to share this restaurant with personal friends and family.

Well today was my mother's birthday. Knowing that their steak was great I was excited to bring her in for a try since she's already tried several yummy steakhouses (Fogo de Chao just below) plus and overall presentation of the restaurant is extremely creative! Which is the ONLY reason why I would give this place a star. 

I proceed in, and a woman with red hair who kind of reminded me of Ronald McDonald quickly frowns from her fake smile once we turn in. Ultimately I ignored it and didn't care to let one gesture ruin our night. I proceed to say "2 for balcony please." She leads us in right away and offers us any seat in the house and will aware the servers that we are here.

10 minutes later, not one server came. At this point I was losing patience. Several server goes by and not one acknowledges us. I had enough time to have a conversation to reserve a dinner at fogo de chau and ultimately ashamed that I brought my mother in here. Being the sweet woman she was, she agreed that we should just leave. Not only did this place ruin a birthday dinner but was rude in every single way. Will not becoming here any longer. 

On side note: maybe if she apologized when she clearly saw us leaving, I might have reconsidered the whole situation but she instead rudely smirked as we left.

I really wish I could give Public School a better review.
