Their menu and beer selection is good and there are some unique items but at the end of the day, it's just another Yardhouse, BJs, etc. Vegas has a million of these places already so it really didn't stand out in any significant way. The theme and decor are pretty cool though so that was a bit of a different spin on things. I had the shrimp and grits, were were tasty and a portion that was a decent size. My wife had the Chicken and Waffles were were a large portion and very good. Father-in-law had a jalapeno and pepperoni pizza that he liked and mom-in-law had fish and chips...they looked nice and she said they were OK. That's the good. Now time for the bad.

Service was OK but not great. It was a busy Friday night but still...not the best. My meal really wasn't very hot considering it was being served in a skillet so my bet is that it was sitting under a heat lamp for a few minutes. It was just hot enough to eat and not cold enough tow warrant sending it back but it should have been hotter. While they do have a decent selection of brews, their prices were really high for what you were getting. Once you start charging $9+ for a pint, that's getting to be a bit obnoxious, regardless of what kind of micro-brew it came from. 

All of that is insignificant though by comparison to the noise. Let me make this as clear as possible. This place is SO FUCKING LOUD!!! I've been to Metallica concerts that weren't as loud as eating in this place. Seriously, if you are planning on having any form of conversation during your meal, you need to bring a bullhorn and set the volume on that sucker to 11. If you are not planning on having a conversation, ear-plugs should be mandatory. When we all left, it felt so pleasant to just hear a little silence for a few minutes. The noise alone is the reason none of us would ever return, so in case you missed it the first time, this place is FUCKING LOUD INSIDE!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Ok trendy theme but horribly slow service and it's not even busy. Food is bland. Ordered pizza and it was blah. My husband ordered the flat iron steak and it was medium rare but had a horrible burnt flavor. Not sure how that happened. Waiting on the check and still can't get a second beer. Urgh won't be back here this place is cute on the outside but broken on the inside
The service is amazing, Mac & Cheese melted in your mouth. If your looking for a great friendly environment to bring your family for lunch this is the spot to be in Downtown Summerlin.

So....I have mixed feelings about this place. Let's start with cocktails! I ordered the Yellow Smoke which was really good. If you are into spicy  cocktails you will love it. I also had a gladnof their Sangiovese which was really nice. Next were the apps, we ordered the Bacon Cheddar Tots & Buffalo  Cauliflower. Both were pretty tasty but I prefered the cauliflower. The Siracha ketchup with the tots is amazing but again I enjoy spicy. **PERFECT BITE ALERT** Cauliflower with the blue cheese aoli and hot sauce on top #yummy. I also tried a bit of friends Watermelon and Tomato Salad AMAZING!

 For an entree I ordered the Flat Iron steak with Chorizo Mac n Cheese. The steak was really good and you could cut it with a butter knife. The Mac N Cheese was not good at all but I am a Mac N Cheese snob. It just lacked flavor to me...a dash of salt and pepper would have been great.

 Service is really hit or miss. It took some time to get drinks as they had one bartender making drinks for the entire patio. Our server was cool my only issue was he seemed to linger and talk a little much for me. He was so busy telling his life story we had a hard time asking for more water or placing an order. His other tables were a little frustrated as well and he was very over dramatic. 

Overall I would give this place another try but it hasn't made my favorites list yet.

I tried this place 3 times and I don't know how they are going to make it.  It's a limited menu and mostly kale based.  The service is not great (if you want to eat with your hands sit on the patio).  Now maybe it's different if you are going here to drink and hang out....

I visited here twice with my girlfriend. The first time, we had a decent experience and I don't remember having any complaints.

We revisited this place on July 2nd, 2016 at around 7 pm.. We wanted an outside table and were told there was a 15 minute wait and they would text us when the table was ready. They finally texted us around 20 minutes later and we were seated outside. At first, the hostess tried to seat us at the only table with a broken fan when it was over 100 degrees outside! After bringing that to her attention we were seated at a table with a working fan.

We sat at the table for 20 minutes. No one came to take our drink orders. No one asked us if we needed help. One waitress made eye contact with me 3 times and didn't say anything. 

We ended up leaving and going to Wolfgang Puck next door which was excellent by the way.

I would not recommend this place based on the non-existent service.

Public School 702 is a very unique restaurant and bar.  I absolutely  love  the  theme and decor of the restaurant, which embodies the whole school theme.  I can only imagine  their happpy hours  here.

The food selection at the restaurant  is very typical : burgers,  pizza, fries, and of course  drinks.  Their brunch menu contains a limited number of breakfast items; however their chicken and waffles  are good.  I also enjoyed their endless, well almost endless  styles of mimosas.  Overall,  this is a fun and exciting  restaurant and bar  to hangout at.

Good place. Good potential. Still shaking off the opening jitters. Wait staff could use some bussers to focus on the customers but the food and drinks are good. Can't wait to come back when they've had time to settle in!

Was looking for somewhere new to eat for my birthday and found this place online. Came in and found myself to love the experience of being in 'school'. Bookshelves, books, world maps, an amazing solar system lighting piece, chalkboards, list goes on..The menu is on a 'notebook', loved it. And specialty drinks listed on college ruled paper on a small clipboard. Definitely a school-like atmosphere. We started with tater tots with sriracha ketchup (bomb!!), and ahi tacos (tasted a little too acidic for me), then went on to order the steak salad (steak perfectly cooked, though the salad itself a little too oily for my taste. Couldn't tell if I was drooling or if it was the salad oil dripping, but overall good.) My colleague ordered the Adobo taco with cilantro lime rice (I should've ordered that, that was crazy delicious), then sampled a few brews before deciding what we wanted. Our waitress was amazing, though I have to admit the service was a bit slower. It slowed after we ordered our main dishes (appetizers came out fairly quickly), so I can't blame the waitress (likely an issue in the kitchen, there weren't too many diners), as we were served after about 30-35 minutes (the drinks did hold us down enough to barely notice the time). Since we were in a bit of a rush at the end of the meal, we asked for our deserts to go, which we came to find out ALWAYS includes ice cream, so the waitress kindly offered me a gift card instead. I was happy with that, as I will definitely come back for recess.
The food was alright but the customer service was horrible and the serve time is ridiculous.
Hidden place, no host, food quality is dry and no flavor. Do not recommend as a "restaurant" maybe ok on the bar side but need upbeat bartenders. Sad to say this but this place won't last long

My husband and I had a FEAST at Public School 702 on a Monday evening during happy hour. Happy Hour specials are available in the bar area and outside on the patio Mon-Fri from 3:30PM - 6:30PM. We ended up out on the patio with a nice view of Downtown Summerlin. I'm thanking my lucky stars we stumbled in here just in time for "Recess".  

CRISPY CAULIFLOWER ($4 HH): The favorite of the evening. According to the menu, it's supposed to be served with blue cheese dressing AND buffalo sauce but we only got the blue cheese. The cauliflower is amazing! I'd highly recommend getting an order of these. 5/5 

PARMESAN TRUFFLE FRIES ($4 HH): A large portion of flavorful fries, but neither of us cared for the lemon aioli. They tasted better straight up! 4/5

MARGHERITA PIZZA ($6 HH): Lightly dusted with red pepper flakes and a pinch of basil leaves. Would have liked for there to be more basil and less charred black dustiness on the crust. 3/5

CRISPY NAKED WINGS ($6 HH): Came with 7 or 8 good-sized wings and my guy thought they tasted great. We learned Public School 702 does not serve ranch and that their sauces are made from scratch. 4/5

CHORIZO MAC & CHEESE ($7 HH): Sans the chorizo so we could both share. The vinegar potato chips layered on top added an unexpected crunch, as did the surprise arugula. The mac & cheese was slightly spicy because of red pepper flakes in the dish - wise choice. 4/5   

FOUNTAIN DRINKS ($2.75 HH): My husband ordered a coke and it came in one of those cutsie bottles. Unfortunately, refills are not free. The extra coke was $1.50. What are we, in Europe? I just had water, and our server left a nice vase of water at the table so I could get all the refills I wanted. 2/5

VIBE: Public School 702 has a class act theme, complete with menus that look like old school notebooks, chalkboards displaying the specials, and an awesome galaxy set up that would win any science fair competition in the main dining area. This new gastro pub feels industrial and trendy, and I love it here! 5/5 

SERVICE: Selina was an awesome server! She checked up on us often and was super nice. 4/5

Worth a Return Visit?
There's still so many Happy Hour menu items I'm dying to try. And, I will definitely get the legendary Nutella Cookie dessert Yelpers are talking about next time I visit! Two thumbs up Public School 702.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #187

Food was on point. Seriously awesome concept and menu selection. Place is beautiful. Liquor selection is smaller than I anticipated. Great staff and attentive service. 
Went on a Monday or Tuesday? Around 9-10pm. So it was slow. And I enjoy that pace. I imagine the madness on a weekend, and for that reason I will revisit on a weeknight.
My boyfriend and I and our friends came back to 702 and we had requested Valerie again and again she was amazing! She will keep us coming back and bringing our friends.  Thanks Valerie!
Great food , happy hour is awesome and the food is definitely delicious,  the vibe is fun and open to all ages

I love public school. The menu keeps my old favs, like the buffalo cauliflower, and adds new fun stuff, like the chicken Thai salad, to keep me interested.  Although known for their beer, Public School makes the BEST n/a drinks for us moms to be, which really makes a difference in picking a place to suit my cravings and desire for something other than water.  

Our last visits, our waiter TYLER was amazing.  He was attentive and cracked some legit jokes.  Ask for him :)

Buffalo Cauliflower....YUMMY!    My friend had a very tasty burger.  I opted for the  healthy caesar kale salad with chicken.  It was good, but not as exciting as the cauliflower or burger.  We also tried the tator tots, good, but they say they are made with bacon.  We didn't taste any.  Drinks were good and nice to sit outside on the patio.  Service was a tad slow, but everyone was very nice and friendly.  Would try again and sample other items.

The food was delicious especially the Tater tots and Chorizo Mac n Cheese. I have seen the Knocks on service and I can honestly say our sever was Tyler and he was very attentive and knows the menu very well.. We will be back!!!!
The food was awesome! Service was good and fast too. BBQ chicken salad was really good. Decor and ambiance were neat. Will for sure be back!
Had the wildest brunch today with Peter at public school. Went bottomless and topped it off with Rose Beer Pong! Come hang with him on the weekends.

Went for late lunch on a Wednesday. Service was excellent. The BBQ Bison Burger had that authentic char-broiler taste with just a touch of not too sweet bbq sauce and emmental cheese. The Wild Mushroom & Taleggio Pizza had a bold and earthy mushroom taste. Fries are served with Sriracha ketchup. Besides their regular tap beers, they have a rotating list of about twelve or fifteen first rate drafts.

I saw pictures of a mythical dessert called Nutella Cookie Sandwich. For a week, I've been imagining what it could possibly taste like and feel like until I've finally decided to try it.

By the entrance is a glass display with sports trophies, Pom poms, Michael Jordan lunchbox, algebra book, calculus book and all things that would remind you of school minus the nun that smacks your hand with a ruler because this is Public School 702. You just get budget cuts.

The menu would remind you of a notebook and the napkins would remind you of a notepad. Blackboards on the wall and the moon and planets above your head. Hipsters with their glasses, beards, sleeve tats and a beer. 90's hip hop playing in the background.

We tried the grilled salmon, bison burger, chicken and waffles and the Nutella Cookie Sandwich. The entrees were just ok. The bison burger had a nice spicy kick to it but I also almost had an anaphylactic reaction because of an ingredient that wasn't on the menu description but was somehow in burger. The fries were not great.

The Nutella Cookie Sandwich would be the only reason I'd come back here. So, you get chocolate chip cookies with Nutella schmeared on the flat side of the cookies, vanilla ice cream in the middle with a wall of bacon brittle. "I got 5 on it"...yup, it's only $5 that's big enough for 2-3 people.

The service could use remedial lessons.

We had a six top for a 6:30 reservation, table had four chairs looking into the setting sun.  Youser! Two employees said they were sorry but nothing got fixed.  The metal chairs were the worst chairs ever in the history of restaurants, owee.  The service was c- at best, one person at our table had to school, no pun intended, the server on the beer selection.  Once all the meals were ordered we did two appetizers, the cauliflower and the tots.  Tots were great, cali was good.  The tots came out 30 seconds prior to our first dinner plates.  I have to say all the food was not hot, mostly warm.  Not good.  The food tasted good and the presentation was good as well.  We ordered the giant cookie for desert, one plate for six of us????  Ok then, it was good though.  Overall food was good, warm at best, service well below average, loud and uncomfortable.  We probably will not return.

I LOVE this place. The crushed velvet cocktail is absolutely delicious. The theme is adorable here with the menus being composition notebooks and take out bags saying "homework" on them. I have already eaten here twice in the last couple weeks. Love love LOVE this place.

Love the location and menu. Giving 4 stars because our sorority alumni group specifically asked for separate checks multiple times before and during ordering , but the waiter epically  failed to do so ! Edamame hummus and flatbread is amazing, as is the buffalo cauliflower !
Lunch was amazing.  Excellent choice of options, perfect portions, great draft beers with rotational selections, highly recommended this place!

Came here for lunch and had the salmon ... Actually attempting to eat it now as I am writing this review. The food taste horrible portion size is enough to feed a small 5 year old child - they are incredibly small. Their lunch menu consists of 30 items none of which are appetizing. Additionally, I requested a straw so i wouldn't have to put my lips on the glass for water and I was brought out a cocktail stir stick not a straw. I would AVOID this place like the plague if deciding to come her for lunch, perhaps dinner is better but I won't be coming back to find out. I will be letting family and friends know of the disappointment this place is, and that they should avoid it. Go eat at California Pizza kitchen or even Wolf gang Puck instead (slightly better portion size and better food). Disappointed in leaving this place still hungry ... My girlfriend ordered the fish and chips and didn't even finish her meal she stated she wasn't the slightest impressed with the food or service.

I was lucky enough to attend their soft opening dinner invitation, which offered an amazing selection of dishes to enjoy. I started off with their Moscow Mule (a MUST HAVE), and enjoyed their cheese and meats appetizer- which was good. My girlfriend enjoyed their asian Salmon dish, while I had the skirt steak, medium-well. I can tell you the salmon was out of the world and perfectly cooked- a nice seasoned outside and a flaky and scrumptious inside. My stake was a bit cold, but the flavor was good. All and all, this place has great food and drinks for any occasion, especially when you are looking to get off work and blow off some steam!

With ample space, large screen TVs, great customer service, and a central location inside Downtown Summerlin, this place is a must-visit!

My favorite restaurant in Downtown Summerlin, the Wild Mushroom pizza is sooooo good, Moody burger was a great one too. Outside seating is nice during fall - winter, I wish the restaurant was taller, but the view is still nice. Good for kids as well!

Menu looked promising, and the ambiance/decor is definitely cool, but the food is extremely average. We got the PB&J Burger, Chorizo Mac and Cheese, and Nutella Cookie for dessert. All sounded great, but were poorly executed. I wouldn't recommend this place or come back.

I used to come by regularly, about three times every two weeks. It's been a while so I was due for a revisit. Well, that was a bad idea to come tonight.  I walked in at 5:35 and it was far from being busy. In fact, eight guests at the bar, at best. The tables had all of 10 guests spread out. The ratio of staff to guests was about equal. At 5:52, I realized I was invisible. Not one server acknowledged me and I was seated right smack in the middle of the entire common area, centered on the tv screen. As I walked out, the hostess (brilliant in her intuition -- not!) said, "Would you like me to get you a server?"
I was speechless. Well isn't that the point!!??!!

What a fantastic place to dine. The food was great and the service by Jaimie was even better! Will definitely go back since we are new to the area.The buffalo cauliflower and the cheese board were wonderful suggestions by Jaimie and the chorizo Mac and cheese was quite a surprise. Just go and try it, you won't be disappointed!
I thought it would be better. Had the shrimp and grits, not exactly what I thought it would be. The drinks were good though.

Aurelia is the best reason to come here. The food and drink are good but she is amazing!

The entire team was kind but she killed it. 

The drinks came quick and were made perfectly. We shared a bunch of dishes and everything was great!

The outdoor patio has misters which should make it a great place to hangout in the summer! 

Highly recommended!
I visited lazy dog cafe and got the best service from Drea she was fast, efficient and funny!

Good- atmosphere and decor are pretty cool. Decent beer selection if you're into that. Bad- the food. Had the chorizo mac and cheese as an app. Noodles were hard. Not aldente. Hard. The sauce was very thin and the chorizo was unevenly distributed in big chunks. Had the pepperoni pizza for my meal and was very disappointed. It's  hard to mess up pizza but this came pretty close. It tasted like cafeteria pizza but cost substantially more. For the price of the whole meal I was displeased. Would only visit again to grab a drink.

We've been here twice when hanging in DTS (Downtown Summerlin) and love the vibe!

Service - the service has been good both times we've been here. It's not always the fastest, but the servers are friendly and happy to oblige.

Food - I love the buffalo cauliflower, burgers, and the shrimp and grits is to DIE for! It had a 'cake' of grits with an amazing blend of shrimp and kale sauteed with sauce to top it. 

Drink - I've been pregnant both times I've been here, but the husband says that he loves the beers! I have had their homemade lemonade which is delicious.

Atmosphere - I love the themes in the restaurant related to school and 'homework' for takeout food. The menu has just enough items and matches well also.

I haven't tried their brunch menu yet, so want to come back for that!

I've eaten here on multiple occasions. I love coming here for brunch as their brunch menu (small though) is always good. Plus they have cheap mimosas/beermosas. 

They have a good menu and tons of drinks. Even loved the peanut butter and jelly hamburger. 

I love too that it's so large with a large balcony. 

Sometimes the food is hit or miss to be honest (didn't like the pictures brunch toast or their fried chicken sandwich) but it's a fun spot anytime of the day with a great beer selection.

We needed a place that could accommodate a diverse family of eight and had some diversity in food and drink. The problem with these places like Public School, Yard House etc, they're just generic. The food was decent fare, probably a 3 1/2. Service was solid and for lunch we were pretty happy.

This restaurant is very new. As a matter of fact I believe they opened two days ago. With that in mind I know it's a little early to be criticizing this restaurant.  When we got to the restaurant two girls battled over how to Seat us. Once we were seated we waited. We then continued to wait. We waited some more. My wife and I actually played a game where we would see how many waiters or waitresses would either pass by or look at us directly.  After about 10 minutes of just sitting there I told my wife if one more waiter walks by us we would leave. My wife was extremely embarrassed at this, but I had to put my foot down. Shortly after two waiters walked right past us as they talked to each other. We got up to walk out. As we walked out of the restaurant we both laughed. Not only did nobody notice we were leaving, but the greeter who had just seated us actually said thank you have a nice day. I know that this restaurant is fairly new so I won't talk about the food or drink. Oh yeah, we never got to that point. Not sure if we would ever go back to this place. It's just a weird situation to be honest. Doesn't the restaurant want to serve food and drink to its customers? Apparently not for public school (702).

Yeah.. the food was great and all but... we would have ordered more drinks had Mindy just stopped talking to the boys next to us and gave us a little more attention. A $70 bill would have turned into a lot more.. going to Yard House now.. oh well.

Came in for happy hour and had the best time! Food was great but the service was over the top amazing! Our server was fun and knowledgeable which we always appreciate!! Thank you PS 702 for having the best happy hour specials and thank you Layne for delivering fast service with a smile and making our experience that much better.

This is one of the coolest place I've been here in Vegas. The whole School theme is so artsy and unique. I'm glad that a cool place like this is not located at the strip. It's about 15 min away from me place. I'm not a beer kind of gal because I hate that bitter beer taste but their knowledgeable staff was able to help me pick out a beer, she even gave me a sample of what she think I might like. 

I love their Ahi Tuna and their flat bread. 

Definitely a great spot for friends to hang out and enjoy good food and beer, they also have a nice patio overlooking the fountain, on the weekend sometimes there's a cool band playing which make it even cooler.

Kid friendly too.

We are on a satisfying flavor overload! From the appetizer to the dessert, we couldn't ask for a better experience to celebrate our anniversary. Just look at the pictures, and imagine the scrumptiousness that follows when you try this place! 

And despite what the reviews say, we were lucky to have such a knowledgable server...ask for Amanda!!!

Hallie was the host and Lacey was our server.  Amazing.  Amazing customer service.  What a beautiful and delicious morning.   I told the server to surprise us and the host was so patient when we asked to move to the patio.   I had a chicken and waffle breakfast with bottomless mimosas and was so happy I asked Lacey to surprise me.   Can't wait to come back and support this place again :)

Good not great. Nice selection of beers and the service was good although our server was a quiet talker and we could barely hear her over the din.  That's right it's not a quiet spot. Nice decor though and cute keeping with the school theme.
Ordered the crispy ahi tacos which could have used a bit more acid and a pinch of salt but overall tasty
Bacon and cheddar tater tots were really tasty
Buffalo cauliflower was good with one hitch.  On the larger pieces of cauliflower there was uncooked batter in the nooks and crannies.  A bit of a turn off.
Fish and chips were tasty but really greasy as well.  My wife took all the cocktail napkins on the table to soak up the oil and they were all soaked. 
I ordered the huntsman burger which our server recommended I order medium.  I opted for medium rare ( my personal preference).  Burger came out medium.  A bit disappointed but not a  deal killer.

Some minor hiccups and I will probably give them another shot but if it's still mediocre that may be the last time.  If a place bills itself as a gastropub I expect some innovative food.  Not the case today.  Time will tell.

Aurelia was an excellent server! Always checking in on us and making sure we were taken care of! She is the best server I have ever had here! Everyone should definitely request her when they come here! A+++++++++++++

My family and I had some free time on a Monday night, heard about happy hour here, and it was well worth the visit! We ended up at the beer pong tables outside, it was winter season and Jane always made sure to check up on us, and even turned on the heaters outside to make sure we were comfortable. Amazing food, and amazing service  we'll be back forsure

Very interesting & unique concept. The food is all made from scratch and very yummy. The place is big but very loud. A mixed crowd but very young crowd as if you are in school. Service could be better. Will return in a few months to try other dishes.

Came to brunch on Saturday with some of my girls. And I'll tell you the food here is pretty good. (Although a little pricey for what you get).  I had the smothered breakfast burrito with was really good. Just kind of expensive for literally a burrito and nothing else. Also we partook in the (almost) bottomless mimosas which with the purchase of any entree is $10. (Almost gets you up to 4 drinks). You can mix and match the drinks with a beermosa, michelada, or Bloody Mary. 


I'd def come back because the service was excellent, and the food was good as well.

We stopped in for brunch and it was very yummy. Super-awesome veggie hash, sweet looking chicken and waffles, amazing buffalo cauliflower, and a very cool atmosphere that will take you back to your school daze. The selection of local craft beers is fabulous, and the ones we tried, a Pilsner and a Belgian wit, were very tasty. Love this place, we shall be back! Thanks Brody Remy for the inside info on how the delish food is prepared!

I'm mainly giving this place 4 stars because crispy buffalo cauliflower. Awesome!

My parents and I were able to sit outside on the rooftop patio. We enjoyed a couple drinks and decided to all try a few different things on the menu. I got the C.C.B. (handheld cobb), my dad got the fish and chips, and my mom got the thai noodle salad. All really good.

A few around us were enjoying brunch with pitchers of mimosas (A in my book) and other delicious looking items. The chicken and waffles is next on my list when I stop in again.

The atmosphere is cute, but the chairs are definitely not comfy. The food has that weird fusion vibe, but the Mac & Cheese was delicious so well worth it! We also added Jungle Juice to our dinner and that was yummy too!

All I can say is WOW!!! Awesome food. Great service. The beer selection and variety is SWEET!! Delicious food. Don't pass this place up. Unique food with unbelievable flavors. It will definitely be on your favorites list.

Great decor and waitress was very attentive so that's the three stars.  Food was boring.  Frito dish was suppose to be chili over Fritos with cheese and pickled  jalapeños.  It was just taco meat over Fritos with a little cheese cream sauce.  Very dry and uninspired.   Sliders were tiny dry burger rounds on oversized buns.   Chorizo Mac and Cheese was excellent.

The food was okay. But nothing special. When we went in for lunch we had a very rude, disrespectful man serving us. When we asked him a question he responded in a very mean tone and acted like we should already know the answer. Then, he judged us on how we were eating. Both of us at the table noticed that he was talking with his colleagues and pointing at us and laughing. We felt very disrespected. We loved the vibe  this place gave off when we ate here before but he made us feel un-welcome.

I never been in the bar where you have to pay before you get you drink service is ok 5 Bartenders running like they have 200 people appetizer very hard to explain for a first experience never again !!!

We went there for the first time today during lunch.  Timing must have been right because it was not crowded at all.  Beer selection was pretty good...both tap and bottle.  I opted for the Golden Monkey and my boyfriend got the Peanut Butter Milk Stout which he loved.  

Ordered the Ahi Tuna Poke first for the appetizer.  Yummy!!!
The Eggs Benedict pizza was enough for two people.  It was delicious and flavorful!   It had ham, roasted brussel sprouts, cheese and fried eggs placed on top.  

Marilyn, our server was very nice and took great care of us.  We can't wait to go back.

We came in the day after Christmas, so we expected service to be a little slow. We didn't expect it to be almost non-existent, and for our complaints to be met with rudeness.

After waiting almost 45 minutes and still not even receiving our drinks, we spoke to our server about the wait. He then said, clearly annoyed, that he had too many tables to wait on, pointing out each table and how he had no help. No apology for the wait, just excuses. We told him that while it was regrettable that they were understaffed, that was the responsibility of his management to deal with  ultimately not our problem. He responded "well, it's not my problem if things are a little slower than you'd like them to be."

At this point we were done. We asked to speak to the manager and waited for him for ANOTHER 15 minutes before walking out. He never appeared. 

There are too many other options in the area for anyone to have to put up with such abysmal service.

Tried this place twice. Not a fan. The girls who seat us are snooty. The food is alright, but nothing compared to all the options in DT Summerlin.

Now, look-wise this place is cool. The interior and table settings are all "school" themed. Cute idea. Would be ideal place for someone wanting to try a wide variety of beers. Not being a beer drinker myself, I found myself with little options. The cocktails were okay, but nothing I would order again. If you are a big beer fan, definitely check this place out.
Julian was awesome! It's rare to find servers that make your day. Great beer selections and a solid crowd turn out for Sunday Funday!

I was searching yelp on my visit to Las Vegas during the sema show and found this gem of a restaurant and i was so glad i did. The place was awesome looking, inside and out. The staff was super friendly and we were seated right away. The food was really good and the selection wasn't the normal stuff all other places have. If you're ever in Vegas, look this place up. I wish they had one in South Florida. Keep up the good work 702!

I live here in Summerlin and have been to Public School several times. They are located on the second floor and have a nice outdoor patio. Drinks are good especially the berry mule, and a lot of beers to try. Favorite apps are the chorizo Mac and cheese, and buffalo cauliflower.  Steak tacos are good. Carrot slaw is spicy but delicious. Pepperoni pizza is spicy and one of my favorites.  My friends have raved about the chicken sandwich and shrimp and grits, but I personally haven't tried them yet. 
One of my favorite places to eat!

Mom and I decided to try out one of the new restaurants in Downtown Summerlin.  This looked like a cool place so we decided to eat here.  The place is decorated like a school with books and the solar system.  Very cute concept.  Seems like it would be a fun place at night hanging out in the bar.

We started with diet cokes.  They brought us very small bottles.  Not sure if this means you have to pay for refills.  I had the Colorado Lamb Burger with tomato cranberry jam, arugula, brie, brioche bun (I held the bun and had it wrapped in lettuce instead).  The burger was nice cooked.  Looked the brie, cranberry jam and arugula.  Yum!  Mom had the fish and chips.  She asked for cocktail sauce which they don't normally serve but they made it for her.  Fish was crispy on the outside, flaky instead.  Good flavor.  Mom loved the fries. 

We had good service with a friendly waitress. Definitely a cut place.  I am sure we will be back at some point.

The view from the outdoor patio is great! I got shrimp and grits and it was delicious! The shared plates are average size calamari and bacon tots were good. Service was on point. Prices are a little steep but given the location that's expected. Casual atmosphere.

Cute little spot in Downtown Summerlin but the food and drinks are disappointing. Cauliflower dish was tasty but all of our burgers were pretty mushy and unflavorful. I was super disappointed in my drink as well. It tasted like syrup and old ice. Service was also pretty slow considering we were one of three tables there.

After shopping around all day, I was looking for a quick bite to eat. I've heard a lot of cool things about this place so decided to give it a try. We walked in and we were told its happy hour. Score! 
Happy hour is Monday-Thursday 3:30-6:30. Happy hour isn't everywhere but just at the bar or in the bar area. We originally sat a lot a table in the middle of the bar but moved over to a booth once it was cleaned. The food was pretty good, the service was just ok. Our server didn't say more than 10 words to us the whole hour and a half we were there. I understand it was happy hour but when we got there, it didn't look too terribly busy?? She didn't ask why we switched tables. She didn't ask if the food was tasting ok. She said the most when she dropped off the tab. 

Pros: chargers under the bar, happy hour prices, and at each table by the bar area, laid back cool atmosphere, menus are composition notebooks, super clever! They do have wifi, cute little bookshelves, math cards all around to really make it feel like a school atmosphere, outdoor seating looking over downtown summerlin, the outdoor seating has fans everywhere.. Also a life size connect four 

Cons: waitress did seem like she was in a huge hurry when we first sat down, despite the restaurant not looking busy 


Tip*** wifi name is under public school and the password is public school

Happy hour food: I highly recommend the ahi poke, it was delicious!! Also the fried cauliflower with buffalo sauce was very good. And the red quinoa salad was my personal favorite. 

Would I go back? Overall I would go back to try some more things. The food was pretty good. The service was a bit lacking to me but I would go again

Lovely dinner on the deck overlooking Summerlin downtown. We still love the Calamari and the spicy cauliflower for appetizers. I had a wonderful tequila cocktail and salad with noodles and shrimp. Our guests had fried fish and lamb bolognese. This is a relaxing and lovely dining atmosphere (no loud music) thank goodness. We could hear our guests across the table. Inside is noisier so we always choose the patio deck!

Had to check out this new cool place (like Yard House) but better atmosphere. The service at the bar was very attentive at lunch time. My chicken sandwich was crispy, with lots of good stuff inside. Overall, I would return.

Another great experience here and I feel obligated to review it now.  Connor was my bartender server and he was super engaging.  Knowledge, attentive, but not at all forced.  Had the chicken salad at his suggestion and thoroughly enjoyed.  Great vibe, staff and menu.  Check it out!
Accommodating to my special diet request, but service was very slow, felt over priced for a salad... But flavor profiles were good. Expected more.

The gastropub scene with it's craft brews and tricked out Mac and cheeses is getting quickly saturated and fiercely competitive, leaving you grasping for differentiators to accurately recall where you dined the night before. 
 The beer itself won't do it anymore, nor will a quirky bacon wrapped or jammed fare. 
 The upstairs patio set up at Public School makes for a nice atmosphere reminiscent of Southern California, so good job there. 
 The beer selection doesn't hurt either. 
 Food is rather predictable, though still delicious and interesting to look at. 
 I decided to throw caution to the wind and go with lamb burger, laden with delicious, fatty, juicy calories, minus bun, plus quinoa salad. While the delicious fat made the burger...delicious, quinoa salad was very meh. I make better? No? You come my house, I feed you. 
 Here is my gripe. Yes, we were a group of 22. Yes, it's a PIA. But, we did have a reservation. So ok, can't put tables together- fine, three adjacent tables are totally cool. But not two waiters working at two VERY different speeds and on different schedules, completely independently of each other, except for coordinating the bill. So here it is- while I'm just putting my order in, my coworkers at the other table are getting their food delivered. A bit extreme, if you ask. So they have to wait and stare us down,  while we tuck the napkins into our collars. 
 Otherwise, everything went seamlessly. No special urge to go back.

Yay, I am a fan of PS702!  This is a reliable spot for us to get food, from their shared plates to entrees.  If you want a beer, they have a large selection of those, too. 

Favorites:
-FOR THE TABLE:  Bacon Cheddar Tots with Sriracha Ketchup, Speck and Eggs, Chorizo Mac n Cheese
-ENTREE:  Shrimp and White Cheddar Grits
-SALAD:  I just had the Roasted Chicken & Quinoa Salad with arugula, feta, avocado, tomatoes, red onions, walnuts, and champagne vinaigrette.  It is a nice balance of protein and greens and the dressing isn't heavy, so you feel good about yourself after eating it.  That feeling might go away if you eat gelato afterwards, but still, salad like this is good for you.

If you're in Downtown Summerlin, try recess here.

Public school 702 overall dining experience is what I call a great get together place for friends. Their bar is prett cozy. This place is located in downtown summerlin. I tried many varieties of their food and the Poké tacos caught my taste buds. They gave us a complimentary pazookie for their mistake which I highly appreciated. For all you guys trying to have a good social time come to public house 702.

Great for brunch, just to grab a drink or bring a big crowd. Plenty to keep you entertained and a good little view from the patio. The service has always been great and the mac and cheese is a must must must.
I love love watermelon heirloom tomato salad is great short ribs fabulous I will come back for bangers and mash! Thank you Public School staff for a great night out!!!!!

I love this place so much it pains me to only be able to give it 3 stars. The food is always amazing, but the service is so spotty no matter what time of day we come. Tonight's dinner took 3 hours for 2 people to have apps, entree and share a dessert!!! Why does it always take so long for a serve to acknowledge a table once seated? And it usually just spirals from there. This night it was a missing appetizer that I had remind the server about. It finally showed up at the end of the meal. If it wasn't for the awesome pizza and BUFFALO CAULIFLOWER I would never come back. Sometimes a meal is worth sitting thru bad service for.

Simply amazing. We sat outside on a beautiful day. I ordered a Thyme after Thyme cosmo and I couldn't get enough! Although I could tell which bartender made which drink. There were only 2 bartenders. My first drink was made by the female...first one was pink, had squeezed lemon, frothy and thyme...the second time it was a different color pink, no froth, no thyme or lemon. When I asked for a new one I asked if the male made my second one and the waitress said yes...so I asked if the female could make it and I'd patiently wait for it. Matt got an old fashion, also made by the girl. His second one came back and it was a completely different color. Before the waitress sat it down she mentioned it looked different and it also didn't have the cherry in the second time around. In conclusion The food was great! The deviled eggs were amazing! I'd go back again!

I have passed by this place several times but never stopped in before. On Thursday evening, I joined some friends for HH. Upon arriving, this place is much larger than I expected. Plenty of seating in the bar area and the restaurant has plenty of tables as well. The bar area extends outside to some comfortable booths and tables. It was such a beautiful evening we elected to sit outside. The patio overlooks part of Downtown Summerlin and the darker it became, the prettier the view became.

Upon being seated, we were greeted quickly by our server. We decided to take advantage of the HH deals. We ordered the cauliflower buffalo wings, cheeseburger sliders, margarita pizza and the Italian meatballs. My friends both ordered the Tangerine Dream beer, I had a Pacific Ale from Ballast Brewery our of San Diego. Our server was super attentive and helpful. Our food arrived quickly and hot. All of us devoured the cauliflower buffalo wings. I had never had these before but really liked them. The meatballs and sliders were also tasty. I passed on the pizza but I was informed it was delicious. 

All in all we really enjoyed our time at this restaurant. Service was remarkable and very customer friendly. I anticipate returning to enjoy a full lunch or dinner in the future.
What an amazing place. From the atmosphere, staff and food! Will definitely come back.  Thank you for accommodating our large group! We had a blast

Public School 702 has been one of my favorite spots since I first tried it. Recently my wife and I had lunch on 2/20. I ordered the cheeseburger, medium rare as usual. This was the third time I've ordered it. When I arrived, it was nowhere near medium rare, closer to well done. I thought, well some siracha ketchup and it should be fine, as long as it still tastes good. Second bite, charcoal. I inspected it, totally burnt on the outside and even the cheese on top had burn spots! This was seriously the first time I've sent food back. The waitress was very sweet and apologetic, said they cook me another one right away. 10 min later the second burger shows up. Still not medium rare, but at least it wasn't burnt. I didn't want to wait another 10-15 min to start eating. So I finished my burger, paid, and left. To their credit, they did take the burger on the check. But I'd rather pay for the delicious burger I came for than the meh one I got for free. 

Was really bummed as I have started to love this place. Will still try again, but definitely not making a trip for it.

Think about Yard House but with a school theme, better food, and a more limited drink menu. 

LOCATION & ATMOSPHERE
Located in Downtown Summerlin's little circle of restaurants and random rock formation fountain, Public School 702 gives off that perfect local hangout vibe. It's always poppin' every time I've been. The restaurant itself is very large and they really stick to the schoolhouse vibe (the menus are super cute composite notebooks!). 

It's obvious Public School 702 is a recent addition to an already successful chain of restaurants. I love that they make each location unique to its area code, including the menus.

SERVICE
If service was amazing this place would definitely be a 5/5 in my book. It can get very unorganized and since the employees are dressed casually it's sometimes difficult to tell who is who. In addition, some of them are not the friendliest people and I sometimes feel like I'm burdening them when I keep having to get their attention.

However, some servers are super friendly and go above and beyond. It really is hit or miss here. One cool thing is that you can get samples of any of the drinks! They bring you a little shot glass of beer to try things out.

FOOD & DRINK
Two words: CUTTING. BOARD.

I don't know why I'm so obsessed with it but the Cutting Board ($14 appetizer charcuterie plate) is just bomb to me! It's a combination of the delicious cured meats, cheese, and thin crispy bread. They meld together so well! Also love the onion and capers. It's so worth.

Also the AHI TUNA TACOS are amazing. I have never liked those kind of newfangled tacos (I'll stick to my adobada and tripa, thank you) but this one had the perfect amount of freshness, delicate fish, and thin crisp. It just melts in your mouth! $10 gets you 4 tacos.

I had a couple other dishes but none of them really made an impression. As for drinks, I have only tried a few of the craft beers on their menu. Campfire Stout is alright but I was happy to see they carried Ninkasi Dawn of the Red. 

The bill can get a little costly here (depending on your appetite for food and alcohol) but sometimes it's worth the splurge, especially if you get to sit on the balcony on a nice evening. I have yet to hit up their happy hour but will definitely come back soon!

In general, I really enjoy what I've had so far at PBS. 

The first time I went, 11/19/15, i was bogged down with shopping bags and I was alone. I remembered all of the reviews mentioning the crispy cauliflower and I decided that I had to try it. I came for HH and was seated at the bar. Although alone, the bartender was pleasant and was chatty without being intrusive. I liked that. I had the HH portion of the cauliflower ($5) and the tuna tacos($7.) I also had an incredible beer, 2 Stone 's "Sorry Not Sorry" that was suggested by the bartender. Honestly, I'm not a drinker, as Yelpers at events can attest to, but this beer was fantastic (as it should be for $8.) 

The second time I went, a few days later, I again had to have the crispy cauliflower. The regular portion is much larger than the HH size, so the price is fair. Brian P. and I also ordered the mashed potatoes (just as a snack, not a full meal) and the potatoes were taking a really long time to come out to us. When we mentioned to our waitress that we still hadn't received the potatoes, she went to check for us in the kitchen. The kitchen told her that they were already aware that we hadn't received our potatoes, as they had made them already but they weren't up to par. Because of this snafu, the cook was remaking our order and without us even asking, she told us that we wouldn't be billed for the potatoes. That's good customer service. Thankfully, the potatoes were piping hot and delicious. 

While my only gripe is that the entrees are pretty pricey for a casual bar type place, in general, I really enjoyed PBS. I love the theme, the food and the service. I will be back!

We came in for brunch and got sat outside. Waited about 5 minutes to get waters and spent another 10 minutes waiting for someone to take our order for drinks. After finally getting tired of waiting we went to the bar and ordered drinks. I would have given them 1 star but what saved them was the bartenders which were all nice and their 10 dollar bottomless mimosas for brunch. Other than the bartenders and specials everything else was bad. I'll try this place again in a few weeks. Hopefully it's better.

Service is horrible. 10 minutes to get the waiter's attention to order. 20 minutes and 4 requests for napkins and flatware, to no avail. Finally had to get from the bar back. Waiter never checked on us. Would have liked to order a second drink, but the waiter was never around. Only go here if you want to be treated poorly.

Love this place , the games they have outside are cool and they have a mini shuffleboard. Staff was friendly and server was awesome.
Their pizzas are off the chain!

Food: fish and chips, basic breakfast, kid's cheese pizza. The fish and chips were very hearty - 3 big pieces perfectly fresh and fried and came with grilled lemon and the BEST tarter sauce - nice and lemony! It also came with siracha ketchup which was too spicy for me so I requested regular ketchup. The fish and chips were the best fish and chips I have every had. The kids pizza was HUGE, enough for two people. My husband enjoyed the breakfast that came with eggs, two big potatoes and bacon. He said it was the best bacon and potatoes he's tasted and he doesn't like potatoes.

Service: Friendly and attentive.

Ambiance: Very cool decor, wood floors and metal chairs. 

Location: 2nd floor in Downtown Summerlin.

I went here for the first time for happy hour with my wife, brother and sister-in-law. The venues in a really cool location in the Summerlin marketplace. Right above Fogo day ciao

The vibe is really cool, the music playing is alternative with a mix of top 40 and some old-school 90s tunes. The name and the Decour totally match;you walk in and you feel like you're in a science lab or library with chalkboards and comfortable seating. In the bar It's communal seating very long tables with 10-12 stools on either side.  I would coin this as a bar, not a sports bar there was only one TV in the bar that I could see so if you want to watch the basketball games, you'll have to go someplace else. We sat in the bar for only about five minutes, before we even ordered drinks because they were going to allow us to have happy hour on the outdoor patio, which is delightful, great atmosphere, not as noisy as inside, the weather was warm and helpful service.

The first look; the menus were notebooks you would see in college, they had a small clipboard as well as a happy hour menu. The happy hour menu had 8 to 10 food options along with some wine and beer.  They also had well drink specials to.

I tried just about everything on the appetizer menu, and was disappointed the ahi poke was bland, the PB&J sliders wasn't explained to me that that was actually a hamburger slider with peanut butter and jelly, just didn't go together for our tables liking. My wife loves pizza, so she ordered the margarita pizza, which didn't have enough cheese on it. The pizza sauce was a little spicy which both my wife and I like. I'm a huge hummus fan and was excited to try a white bean hummus to know what that really was, it was OK it needed a little salt to increase the flavor, just to me tasted flat. 

There was no salt-and-pepper on the tables, I try to get a hold my waiter "Brandon" it wasn't his fault. I wanted to tell Brandon that the appetizers were mediocre at best and return the pb&j sliders but it was "good Friday" and I didn't want to be too picky and "thankful" but I had 6 appetizers and not one stood out. Oh that's  not true, I did try the fried cauliflower which was probably the most appetizing appetizer.  The service was very good they leave a water bottle at your table so I don't have to keep asking the waiter every time to fill my water glass cup, I really like that.

I wouldn't go back there for any of their food, if their happy hour appetizers are so boring I wouldn't expect the food to be any better. I would go back for a drink or have a glass of wine with my wife (no food), the brewery across the street at the redrock Casino has far better appetizers and 10 times the amount of choices. 

Right before our party of four left I had to make a quick stop in the bathroom, I came out and did see one of the chalkboards talking about their specials I know there was a few errors I'm probably being too picky here but they said their beers for $4-7, I didn't see any beers on the menu that were $4, management should update their signage to properly address that the happy hour menu says.

Just checked out this new Downtown Summerlin spot.  I would highly recommend it!  It had a very cool vibe, the service was very friendly, and the food was excellent!

Pros: Food was great!  Service was friendly, outside area was very nice

Cons:  Inside was VERY loud, they were out of a few beers on tap, 

Overall, very well done, definately a place I would go back to!

Sitting on this patio makes me feel like I'm on vacay! 
Great views, relaxing vibe, beautiful marble tabletops, good service and food. 
I always get the buffalo cauliflower here because it is so good, served with a side of bleu cheese and buffalo sauce. Side note: they do not have ranch here at all. Which is a good thing, I think. 
On this visit just had a few apps, all reasonably priced and drinks. 
Great spot to come to in downtown Summerlin where you can walk around and shop and have a bite for a delightful experience.

Great place to watch games. Lots of tv and plenty of room. Good brew selection and the bar food is not bad. I would have given them 5 star if they kept things consistent. Sometimes the fries are perfect, sometimes soggy. When  they switch brew they sometimes don't clean out the line, which can be really bad if you don't like sour. Big plus are the staff. The service at this place is fantastic! 


T would enjoy hanging out at the bar.

Had dinner there last Friday with 6 others. Nice place. Poor service. We sat outside. Our server screwed up 2 of our orders. I would have had a second drink but never was asked if I wanted another. I was never asked how my food was or I would have sent it back because it was wrong.

Tried the American Burger. Nothing special, just your standard, typical burger you'd find in any ole restaurant. Fries were lacking and soggy. Hubby got the crispy chicken sandwich w/kale salad. If you like blue cheese, get the salad. If not, it overpowers the salad. Hubby's sandwich had a decent spicy flavor to it, but it was nothing special. Also tried ahi tuna tacos to start. The dressing was nice and tart, but I would prefer it on a salad, not to flavor ahi. The ahi itself, being raw was a bit fishy w/no flavor other than its fishiness.  I like Downtown Summerlin, but Im not interested in coming back to Public School 702.

Went here for drinks with a friend what a cool concept! They have live music outside and the inside looks like you walked into your high school! The specialty cocktails are very yummy! Especially their version of a Moscow mule!!!

The food was good but I have an issue with this restaurant. It bills itself as a scratch gastro Pub. First, the "scratch": store bought bloody Mary mix (so easy to make this from scratch). The bar: Out of Brandy, can't make a Pina Colada or a toasted almond or a blue martini, doesn't carry decaf coffee (had to go down stairs to Crave restaurant to get a cup of decaf to go and bring it back up to make a decaf an Bailey's). The Yellow thunder was very good.

All of that aside; the Chicken & waffles was excellent as was the steak salad. The cheese & bacon tater tots were also good. My favorite was the mac and cheese with Chorizo. The cookie ice cream sandwich with Nutella and bacon brittle outside was kind of gross.

My husband and I were out shopping with our daughter and my mother in Summerlin. I had heard rave reviews about this place through a few co-workers at the Wynn. We decided to try this establishment with my two year old. (Fingers crossed) 

It was perfect! Even the kid's meal presentation was on point. I had the steak salad and my hubby had the fish and chips. Very good. Ambiance was not too loud but just enough to drown out her fun that she was having. 

We are looking forward to going back this week for a little date night. The menu had a great amount of options and the decor was well thought out. Food was very fresh. 

Hoping that this restaurant opens up another location soon!!! Please go check it out. Well worth the money.

The service was extremely slow. It took 10 minutes to greet you when you say down. It took 45 minutes for the arrival of our meal. The food was not high quality.  I was told by my waiter that the steak salad had romaine lettuce, radish, balsamic vinaigrette. What came out was arugula, radish, and not so tasty vinaigrette. I was not impressed with the food or service.
Good food. Loud tho hope da food is tha same. They have my wife drinkin beer lol food had been beyond expectation so far

Christina S took very good care of us. We ordered all the items she highly recommended and they were amazing. The food and that guavalajara drink were just heavenly! Great food great vibe! Thank you very much!!

Decided to check it out again and was blown away. Atmosphere was awesome again. The service was amazing. Extremely kind hostess (Victoria) and waitress (Sarah). The food was so good. Ordered new things and now have new favorite appetizers! You have to get the fried buffalo cauliflower and the bacon cheddar tots. So good! The inside of the restaurant is nice and clean. Outside is chill and they have some games to play or you can even sit and watch a sporting event on the tv's and hang out. This will definitely be a place I come to more often.

Pretty excited to discover this Cali gastropub was arriving at the swanky Downtown Summerlin. Great beers and our server was not only fun but extremely knowledgeable and turned me on to the whimsical and tasty Golden Monkey. Outdoor patio is great place for a late night meal. And best of al locals get half off their bill on Mondays. How good is that?

I'm very impressed with this place just opening up! Husband and I were seated immediately and our waitress, Christina, came over shortly after. She was wonderful, right away she told us all about the place and pointed out some of her favorite options, which I'm always pleased with when it's not just the most expensive. Also, I liked that they have about 6 dishes that can be made vegetarian by request. 

We started with the buffalo cauliflower, her suggestion, which was amazing and I am not a fan on cauliflower. It's served with a blue cheese aioli and Frank's red hot sauce on the side. It was a large portion for the two of us and I would get it again! 

Also, we got the ahi tuna wonton tacos. They were good. Not amazing but good. I don't think I would get them again though since the cauliflower left such a big impression. 

For dinner I got shrimp and grits with a beer-blanc sauce. It was perfect!!!! I would order this again. The shrimp are cut in half so it looks like you are getting more than what you think you are. I didn't mind this because I like cutting the shrimp in smaller pieces so that I get some in every bite. The lady sitting next to me ordered this and she recommended it but said it was a bit to spicy for her. I enjoyed the bit of heat the dish had and didn't feel that it was all the spicy. I enjoyed just smashing and mixing everything together so that I would get a little of everything in every bite. The portion was large enough for me to take some for lunch tomorrow too which I liked. 

Husband got fried jidori chicken & green chili  cornbread waffles that had a bacon red eye gravy on the side. He ate it faster than I've ever seen him eat before! He LOVED it, he said the waffle was a nice savory accompaniment to the fried jidori chicken. I was able to sneak a bite the chicken was the most juiciest and moist chicken that I've had in a long time it was VERY delicious. It was the best tasting chicken I've had in a long time it was creamy yet firm, and had the best chicken flavor I've ever had! 


The atmosphere was very hip with all types of decorations from a classroom. The ceiling over the bar looked like a gymnasium floor, they have beer pong, jenga, table shuffle board, and darts. The patio is beautiful, reminds you of a nice back yard with cool seating options. Each cabana like table has their own personal fan for the summer and heater for when it's cooler. They have A variety of seating options anywhere from two toppers to larger parties which I liked because it seems like you wouldn't have to wait as long for tables to get pushed together for parties of 6 or more and they had round tables for larger parties which I like.  

This will definitely be our new go to. I can't wait to try the rest of the menu, everything looked scrumptious.

Decided to drop in here for lunch one day because its new and many of my friends have tried it out. Rolled in around 2:30 pm and it wasn't too busy. No hostess at the front table so I just wandered over to the bar area. Sat down and looked over their bar which is loaded with plenty of beers and some interesting alcohol selections as well.

Christina the bartender came over and greeted me with a smile and explained that a few selections were out, and more about their featured beer menu which changes weekly. I chose a nice Citrus-y IPA and looked over the menu for some food.

This is where they lose some stars because I read the menu several times looking for something that would pique my interest but there really wasn't anything that screamed "Eat me". I ended up going with the CCB, or chicken burger. It was decent, with bacon and avocado and cooked well. But it wasn't fantastic out of this world good. 

The two girls next to me were sharing a pizza, and I could see that it was slightly burnt. Didn't look all that impressive. At least the girls were pretty to look at. TV's above the bar seemed out of place and not really a focal point of the bar area. Maybe this place is hopping during Happy Hours. It is a huge space with plenty of tables, and an outdoor patio area that overlooks a nice garden and water feature. 

Total bill was $22 for a beer and a chicken burger, so I probably won't venture back in for a meal but might do some drinking here.

The decor is so cute and so is the idea of the restaurant! The reason why I'm giving three stars is because I feel like the menu is very limited and very standard. You're paying a lot for regular bar food, even during happy hour!

Being a positive person I always look for the good in things. Positives are Public School is a cool idea (Grade A+). Cafeteria style seating indoors, but noisy (Grade B) and outside is a large patio with lots of space to enjoy(Grade A). But that's where it ends. Service was okay at best (Grade C) , yes they were polite and positive (Grade B). The kitchen slowed them down and what they served was nothing I would be proud to turn in (Grade D). Overall I'd give Public School a  grade of (C). To stand out in  Downtown Summerlin Pubic School needs to take some extra credit and study a little harder.

Great atmosphere to enjoy good food, appetizers, drinks and the different genres of music playing in the background. Clean, sporty, relaxed, fun environment for family night, first date, group meal, etc. Excellent location just walking from downtown Summerlin mall.

TURN DOWN THE MUSIC PLEASE! It's not a night club. When a round table of 6 young people can't hear each other talk, it's more annoying than enjoyable. The server got 4 things wrong and I think it's because she couldn't hear us!!! 

The food and drinks are good, so the next time we eat here, if we can't sit outside, we will just pass.

First time here and enjoyed the bottomless mimosas and the  calamari, for my entree ordered the huntsman burger and couscous salad everything was very delicious. Great prices and fun interesting restaurant, will definitely be back.

We hosted a small event on the Patio at PS702 today. From introduction to Randy one of the managers, working with Sara in catering to the waitstaff Victoria, Cody and Elizabeth we were really impressed! Friendly, efficient, complete 100% pleasure working with this group!

What an AWESOME place!  Great food, great service!  We made a reservation, and were glad we did!

Got there just in time for the tail end of "Recess" (aka Happy Hour).  Decent variety of drink and appetizer specials, with enough that should cover everyone's tastes.  Bartenders were very knowledgeable and very friendly, even though it was PACKED.

Dinner, things just got better, we tried the fried Coli-flour, as has been reviewed here many times.  It was really good, but what outdid it was the bacon cheddar tater tots.  YUM!  For my main, I had Bangers and Mash.  Really good, the sausages were excellent, though not quite true to the English form of B&M, but still VERY good.  My wife had the Roasted Pablano, she's not a vegetarian, but  it would have worked, and it was delicious to boot!

Our friend had the Short Rib, which he reported was out of this world good.  His wife had the Shrimp and White Cheddar grits.  Best grits I've ever tried.

Just wish there was more than 5 stars to really make this place stand out even more.  We will be back for sure!!
Great service. Especially Amber Lynn and Francisco. Buffalo cauliflower and Brussels sprouts best part of our meal.  Need larger size beer options. Great selection on tap.

After a mediocre first experience several months ago, a group of friends were meeting here for lunch, so I joined them.  As opposed to our last visit, service was very good, but then the restaurant did only have a smattering of guests.

Food?  A different story!  I asked if the Thai noodle salad with chicken and shrimp would be enough for lunch.  Server said, "Absolutely!"  Well, he was wrong!  I usually take leftovers home with me.  I actually left hungry, and came home and had a sandwich!  For $14, I thought it would have at least a small chicken breast.  It only had one small shredded piece about the size of my little finger and 2 mini pieces of shrimp!  Salad was bland, with little flavor.  I also detected no cilantro. 

One friend ordered the chicken breast sandwich with bacon and avocado.  It was served on a nice bun with fries.  She said it was good. 

After 2 pathetic experiences, I probably won't be back.  There are just too many choices in the area.

It is no surprise the restaurant was nearly empty during what should be a noon rush hour.

I come here all the time after work for a drink with my coworker. I'm not a huge fan of beer, so I won't mention anything about that but the fact that they have an incredibly long list of different beers. I prefer to drink wine, and they have a nice selection. The gentlemen at the bar are always willing to give samples to try before you decide. My friend and I usually order a bottle of wine, as single glasses are no less than $9 each. The bottle we order is usually around $36, which I find a bit pricey, but not surprising seeing as we are in Downtown Summerlin. I absolutely love the fiery fried calamari, it's a must have every time I come. I've also ordered the cutting board which comes with a selection of cheeses and meats with bread, great pairing for wine. I've ordered the sliders, margherita pizza, and truffle fries... all amazing. I have always come in and sat in the bar area, and service is great. Food almost always comes out quickly. Things are a bit wild during Happy Hour. Waitresses take ages to come to your table, and takes longer to get food. You only receive happy hour specials at the bar, and the bar area fills up very quickly as it's not too big. I don't know much about the service at the tables. I love the atmosphere, the music, and the whole vibe here. One of my favorite bars in downtown Summerlin. My only reasoning for the 4 stars are the prices. If they knocked a few dollars off, this place would be perfect.

The food is amazing. A lot of drinks to choose from. It's really awesome they have jenga and beer pong. I docked major stars and would give service alone 1 star. Our waitress karissa was horrible. Sat down and waited ten minutes to get drink orders. She forgot to get my sons order. As she took our drink orders she goes over and talks to another worker for about five minutes then finally goes outside to her other table. I understand when people are busy but she was talking half the time and seemed like she could give two shits. I will give this place another try but maybe for drinks with friends. 
Also it's weird they have steak but no a1 or steak sauce? They brought BBQ sauce??! Even fine dining steak houses and chillis have a1 I mean come on. At least a busser , of course not the server she was Mia, had the courtesy to bring out some kind of sauce for my husband.

I've been here a few times both for brunch and lunch and as much as I absolutely love the decor and ambience (which is all "School Subject Themed") the food has always been underwhelming and the service, somewhat subpar. 

Most of the waiter's seem quite friendly and fairly attentive and some are incredibly well-versed on the beer menu and will go so-far as to suggest food pairings, which I think is pretty fun. 

In this last visit, I received my check, paid with my Card and it was processed for over TWICE what I owed. Now, to be fair, this was an accident and the waiter was absolutely shocked at "how" this happened, since it appeared to be an anomaly, however, he took what (hopefully) would become the Voided Ticket, so I have to way to prove my card was charged twice (or mis-charged) on my end, if need be. 

This round, I ordered the chicken burger and my brother had the lamb. Honestly, I prefer his over mine and I appreciate that quinoa is a substitute option over fries (which come with a spicy ketchup that is good, but not my taste-bud preference.) I definitely preferred his burger to mine, although I liked that my Chicken was, in fact, a ground chicken patty and not just a strip of chicken breast. 

We did arrive during a Knight's Game, so it's possible that food service was a bit backed up, although only the front of the restaurant/bar was filled - there were still plenty of opens seats that lacked TV views. My brother and I opted to sit outside and it was a beautiful day, with clear skies and the misters provided an occasional dusting of coolness which was perfect and relaxing. 

All-in-all, I just wish I liked the food a little more and I wish the brunch menu was more exciting, somehow. I want to LOVE Public School, but there's something about this place that just keeps falling short of my expectations.

Had dinner here with a big party on a weekday. Cute atmosphere, FANTASTIC food, and great service. Connor and Janelle took care of us and were very attentive. We enjoyed dinner and had a chance to play some games. They had a life size Jenga and Connect Four. They also had corn hole and beer pong. I would definatly come back on my next trip. Thanks guys!!

This place is awesoooooooooooome!!!! 
Cool vibe, nice interior, lovely outdoor patio. Came here on a Wednesday night with some girls, and a DJ was playing some awesome 90's hip hop, alternating with some karaoke action. 

Bacon and cheddar tater tots- 4/5. Everyone loved it but I thought it was good. 
Summer succotash- 4/5. Good stuff but not to die for. First time eating succotash and apparently it doesn't get any better than this. 
Deviled eggs-3/5. Good but nothing special. 
Truffle fries- 4/5 Good but I've had better. 
Mezza plate- 3/5.  The waiter recommended this. I didn't think the hummus and anything else was that great except for the fried garbanzo bean that was crunchy on the outside. 
Shrimp and grits- 5 stars!!!!!!!!!!! Great sauce flavor, shrimp was perfectly cooked, and the grits patty that looks like a hash brown was absolutely delicious. I'd come back for this dish hands down. 

Phenomenal selection of beers available here. One extra star for carrying my fave beer...Greenflash IPA. 
Service was excellent. It's slow because it was busy, but our waiter Jared was super helpful, friendly, and made sure we were taken care of though keep in mind service is generally slow and our food took a while to arrive. 

Kyle, the GM came by to say hello and he was super nice as well. 
I like the ambiance of this place, and the DJ who played awesome music really made the night for me. Met a lot of cool locals. I'd definitely come back to try the jidori fried chicken as well as their burgers. Kudos to Jared for putting up with us ladies on our girls night out! ;)

It a great start to the evening.you're playing a friendly game of shuffleboard as we wait! Brittany the food quality or serving times were poor. That is being kind the waitress did her best but the food was cold came out at all different intervals. We here this was great but more like a hipster night club loud music your mileage may very!

Brunch options are great. Relaxed atmosphere on the sunny terrace. Chicken sausage, eggs on grits was very tasty. OJ was fresh squeezed.
 Server not too attentive though.

Based on what I tried, this place is acceptable. I tried the Fried Jidori Chicken & Waffles, PB&J Burger, and Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower. 

Fried Jidori Chicken & Waffles -- 3 stars -- the fried chicken wasn't crispy and the over-easy egg on top didn't help with the lack of crispiness. The waffles weren't crispy and quite soggy, but had some nice heat from the green chili. Overall, I found dish to be lackluster.

PB&J -- 4 stars -- creative twist to the good ole hamburger. Nice balance between nutty, sweet, and savory in each bite. Patty was cooked medium as requested. 1-star ding because it could have been bigger given the price.

Crispy Buffalo Cauliflower -- 3 stars -- deep friend cauliflower with some buffalo and blue cheese sauces. Expected much more from on usually a cool twist on cauliflower. My issue was that the cauliflower could have been softer, considering it was deep fried.

5 stars for ambiance -- old school bleachers on the wall, 80's theme, and other retro designs. Pretty cool and nice music.

Wasn't crowded for Saturday brunch.

Plenty of parking since it's anchored to the Downtown Summerlin mall.
Just meh. Food was good but nothing outstanding i want to return for. The decor inside is fantastic. I loved the concept, location and decor but it just wasn't enough with the food being so-so.

Best service I've had at a restaurant in a very long time! Waiter was Matt and he was very Attentive.
I got the Eggs Benedict Pizza, really good prosciutto and the crust was buttery and hot when it came out.

Grandma got the chicken and waffles, tried it as well was really good especially with their take on waffles which was made out of corn bread. Love corn bread and the fact it was eagle texture but still filling and hardy? Perfect. Gravy was chunky but still flavorful. Overall all the flavored balanced well.

Uncle got Lamb Burger, looked good and he enjoyed it but said it needed the creamy horseradish he loves and once he got it A1 as well.

Came for brunch and they also have bottomless options. 

5 stars in my eyes because of one key thing. Went to the bathroom and my family had walked out and I thought they'd grab my left over pizza.. Was about half.. They didn't so I walked back to the table - no more than 3 minutes later- pizza had been tossed. Didn't even insist and Matt out of his way to stop what's he's doing speak with his manager and quickly inform me if I am in no rush if I could wait 5-10 for a new one to cook for me to take home. I mean I wasn't and was gonna walk around anyways so I opted to wait around and was expecting maybe half of a smaller version of one. But they gave me an entire pizza.. This one even seemed larger than my original one! Don't know the managers name, Caucasian man maybe 6'3 .. Thank you nd hats off to this place!

Awesome decor; color schemes matched & you can tell the place was good simply by the fact that they were slammed.. I'm not the only one who thinks it too.

100% recommend and I will be back to try some of those crazy percentage drafts

So... everytime I have been here, the service is amazing, the food is always consistent and amazing. The live talent is way too loud, I should not have to shout at my party with me, or the staff serving me. Please fix this.

Do you like being disrespected by waitresses? If so, this is the place for you!! My cousin and i went to ps and 2 diff times the  waitresses came up to us with meatballs and said "here are your meatballs" and i was like "i didn't order meatballs" . Response was a u turn and no comment when walking to the correct costumer with the food as if they are too savage or rude to say "Oh ok" or " no worries". 

Total b words to the waitresses but the male bartender working on sunday night that was in his late 30's with a shaved head was super cool. Hence the 2nd  star. Lol

Overall all a great experience at Public School. Food was tasty and came out relatively quickly once ordered and I loved the decor of the place.

My only (very small) issue was that our server (who was extremely nice) was taking care of almost all of the tables on our area. I counted at least 6. I have never worked in a restaurant so I am not sure if this is normal or not, but two of those six tables were of parties larger than 10. She was doing the best she could but it obviously took her a while to check on us and to take our entree order after we ordered our appetizers. Other then that amazing experience and would definitely go again, just maybe on a slower night.

Sadly we gave this place 3 tries and instead of third times a charm it was 3 strikes you're out. From getting Drinks wrong to our waiter keeping our change without being told it was his tip to undercooked burgers being sent back 3 times ( seriously we thought maybe we were on hidden camera). Sadly I love DTS and appreciate having close to home spots for cocktails. This one is off our list.

The service was good.. The food okay.. I can not eat a lot of garlic and the food is all in garlic.. I ordered the Grits & Egg and was unable to eat the item..
Wow..
I am impressed the GM called about my experience, because of his professionalism and his concern..this shows that he cares..I will try 702 again .. I will Update my review..

If not for their loyalty club, The Insider, I'd probably stay away. There always seems to be some issue with the menu items, or the drink selection, or promos, etc. 
But I'm a sucker for a loyalty club! 

I went on a weekday evening to redeem my Birthday Reward, and one person joined me. We sat at the bar and I ordered the Flight School- $5 for 3 chosen local craft brews (4 ouncers), per the e-mail from PS 702 I received.  The bartender told me their $5 flight wasn't local brews. I did what any reasonable person would- ask if they have local brews. And showed him the email. 
Lo and behold, after consulting with a manager, the $5 local brews flight was mine! Well, 2 of the beers were local- a porter from Hop Nuts, and the brew from Bad Beat escapes me. My friend is not so much a beer snob and was happy to get the "ordinary" $5 flight. Whatever that was, I didn't really care!

Service was good, and as always, we were offered samples as we inquired about certain beers, or in my case, the Rose on tap. I had a glass and wasn't impressed.
